Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bijou05
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 (me/ my husband7 17 years old daughter) that stayed at Hotel du Pantheon from Saturday 31 march until April 5th). We loved the hotel. We stayed at the Prestige room (romm 62) that is suitable for 3. We were very pleased with the size of the room and bathroom. We were in the 6th floor with a magnificent view of the Pantheon and Sacre-Cour. The room was spotless cleaned, the bed was quite good, the 3rd bed was ok. The reception was fantastic. Everyone who works there spoke english and helped oss in every way we needed. They really helped our stay to get even better. Breakfast was quite good. The only remark we had:internet signal was very low; even if the router was restarted) and we missed reading light when in bed. The lights beside the bed was inside the wall, so it was impossible to read in bed). But we will be back and recommend to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Ask about Construction!”
Reviews.Author: rjkim
Reviews.Content: Due to the overwhelming positive review on this site, we booked our honeymoon stay here. Pros: Location is great and easy to find. It's pretty clean and the customer service is pretty good. Cons: THERE WAS CONSTRUCTION NEXT DOOR and no one told us. We woke up to banging each day. They actually felt bad for us so they didnt make us pay for the "superior" room rate, but still it annoyed the hell out of us when we tried to take midday naps. There was also some construction being done within the hotel - they shouldve comped everyone's breakfast or made it up to their customers. The rooms are small- even the "superior" room was tiny. Closets are weird and you hang each piece of clothing behind the other. The bathroom showerhead sprays water that is super hot or super cold so you have to use the handheld shower head. It's not a very secure place - they take your room key when you're leaving and when you come into the hotel, you just have to tell whoever's at the front your room #. It felt like anyone could get into any room. And if you want the front desk to watch your luggage while they're cleaning the room and getting it ready for you, you basically watch them take it to the side of their desk where anyone can walk by and take whatever. Just take anything valuable with you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: R_and_K_G
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel. Very clean, comfy bed. We had a superior room with a great view from the 4th floor. Room wasn't big like many in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Rita B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Parisian hotel with perfect view of pantheon (room 43). Right by Sorbonne so plenty of little cafes around. We didn't have the breakfast at €13 each, we picked a cafe round the corner and got two cafe au lait and 2 croissants and baguette with butter and jam for €7 altogether! Staff very helpfull and very well spoken. Been to paris 7 times now and this is the only hotel we would go back to purely for location, friendliness and comfort. Lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So romantic!”
Reviews.Author: paulineBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel right in the Quartier Latin. We've been here twice and loved it both times. To respond to some criticisms posted here, the breakfast really is good value - round the corner you can get the usual croissant and coffee for half the cost of the hotel breakfast, but it's very limited and if they've run out of croissants (as on Saturday!) you just get a bit of bread and jam, so it's not that great. I recommend the hotel breakfast and find it better than those available in the local cafes. Some rooms (like ours) are small but we don't mind that - they are clean, cosy and very well soundproofed. One thing to say is that the small rooms are perhaps not good for people with mobility problems. I kept noticing things that would bother my mum (mainly in the bathroom: some awkward corners) but for us it was just perfect. You can relax in the bath and drink up all the champagne in the mini-bar as you ponder where to eat out that evening - very beneficial for a sense of well being! The reception staff are multi-lingual and very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Egoorsky
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are 22 and 23 and were in Paris from March 10-15. Neither of us had ever been, so we wanted to do all the fun and touristy things! We found this hotel on this website and decided to book a room with a balcony. The gentleman working the desk when we checked in was extremely nice and friendly and kept welcoming us to Paris! He then informed us that we were not only upgraded to a nicer room, but the room with the best view in the hotel, simply because it was open. We had a BEAUTIFUL view, and it was such a pleasant surprise! Every other staff member we encountered was also extremely friendly and helpful as well. The room was quite large, which was also a nice surprise. We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning, and it was well worth the 13 euros. The cafes out in town charge 9-10, and the quality was better at the hotel, in my opinion. It had a huge assortment of breads, cheeses, ham, crepes, etc. It was close enough to walk to a lot in the city, but we also had a metro pass which helped. I also enjoyed that it was close to tourist sites, yet I didn't feel like I was in the middle of all the tourist craziness! My only slight negative about this hotel was that there was loud construction/renovation going on sometimes, but it was nothing I couldn't deal with. Also, we found that although the closest metro stations listed on the hotel website are the Cluny-Sorbonne and Cardinal Lemoine, it's much prettier and easier to take the RER B to the Luxmbourg Gardens station and walk toward the Pantheon. Overall it was a fantastic experience, the staff could not have been better, and I would recommend this place in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely start”
Reviews.Author: ed_1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for our wedding anniversary, upon arrival we were informed that our room had been upgraded. We were given a beautiful room overlooking the pantheon, it was clean, the bed was comfortable and it had all the standard amenities that you would expect. The only criticism that I could have is that the toilet cubicle is very compact, this aside it was perfect. The staff are lovely and it is highly convenient with the RER a two minute walk away. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, Act 1 & 2”
Reviews.Author: Margaret E
Reviews.Content: In 1971, I visited Paris and stayed at Hotel du Pantheon. Many things have changed since then, both in my own life and the life of this wonderful hotel. It had a funky charm in 1971, and I loved the location, so when my husband and I planned to go to Paris for our 25th anniversary I suggested we stay at this hotel. It had had a face lift since 1971 (as had I) but lost none of its charm. We loved the hotel. Everything was wonderful, from the service to the quality. This hotel is still a great value in a great location and I hope to return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: EvetheLondoner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in march, and had a great time. This was marred on arrival to find a hoard of builders in reception renovating the lobby - they were not limited to the lobby either, and could be found (and heard) fixing the elevator and banging. Of course the Pantheon and the rest of Paris was on our doorstop to explore, so we escaped the noise and dust. The location is second to none. We booked a superior room with a Pantheon view and it wasw worth it. To have a little more space (especially given all Paris hotels are super teeny) was perfect, but the toilet cupboard (my 6"4 boyfriend could barely squeeze in) left a lot to be desired. The decor, is boutique, french and charming, and the room features a sleek lcd tv. The team on reception throughout our stay were very helpful both before and after our stay, so thank you! I imagine once the hotel lobby is done, this will rise in TA ratings. Just be prepared to have your bank card at the ready as Paris is expensive to do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: ranmor23
Reviews.Content: Stayed in February12 for 4nights in superior room with a very good view of Pantheon Good location. friendly staff clean and fairly comfortable Toilet located in very small space separate from bathroom with no window or extractor Breakfast at 13 euros was not good value

Reviews.Title: “Cleen nise”
Reviews.Author: Galit1996
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited at the beginning of March 2012. Great hotel! The rooms are clean. Small but cleverly designed. The service was courteous and pleasant. Breakfast is tasty but not worth the price. The location is great. We strongly recommend the hotel and we will return to it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, charming, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkskhdkuasyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hôtel du Panthéon for 3 nights in February 2012 and were very happy. This was our first time to Paris and we felt comfortable and safe here. The hotel was very clean (bathroom was spotless). It was walking distance to lots of great restaurants and not too far from the RER/Metro. We even walked all the way home from the Lourve once (it was a long walk but possible). The staff were very friendly and helpful from checkin to checkout, and all fluent in English (very helpful as our French was practically non-existent!). Our room (just the standard room) was lovely which made our stay extra special. Photos of the rooms were one of the things that attracted us to the hotel and we were not disappointed. Of course I don't think any place is perfect so my only criticisms are that the in-room wifi wasn't always reliable and while the lamplit rooms were cosy, a brighter light in the main room may have been more practical. But these were just little things that didn't affect our enjoyment or comfort. I feel like we got great value for money. I loved this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, great value!”
Reviews.Author: nsegoly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel du Pantheon for one night and opted for a room with a view- it was well worth the extra money as our window opened right onto the Pantheon- couldn't beat it. The room itself was lovely and comfortable, and a great size by European standards. Above all, the staff downstairs was absolutely wonderful and even prepared trip itinaireries for us while we were at dinner (at a restaurant which they recommended). Highly highly recommend this hotel, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend for all three family generations”
Reviews.Author: ICoburnC
Reviews.Content: We had some special needs with elderly parents and family rooms - the hotel staff excelled in helping arrange the rooms and the transfers plus a wheelchair. The Hotel was the perfect location for a weekend holiday for all: friendly & helpful staff, pretty, attractive and clean rooms and a great view too! All-in-all excpetinal and highly recommended but check rooms and views when booking. Also Hotel doesn't have a restaurent and the hall/lounge is a littel small - but the vicinity is full of places to dine. For the study it is in walking distance from the tourist locations and river but also well connected with Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect perch for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: lutraperegrine
Reviews.Content: We found this gem by searching tripadvisor for hotels with high scores on the romance scale. This one really foots the bill. We were cozy room on the top floor appointed with exposed beams and period - late nineteenth century - furniture. The view from the balcony to the north included the Pantheon, the tower of Notre Dame, and off in the distance, Sacre Coeur. The hotel provided a great base for exploration of the literary loop, around the same neighborhoods frequented by the likes Hemmingway and Sartre. The room was spotless, the staff greeted us by name on arrival, and you could tell that they made a concerted effort to pamper their guests. We skipped the hotel breakfast in favor of the broad selection of local bakeries and cafés.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice little hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: kac1959
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very welcoming, helpful and pleasant. While the rooms are small, (cozy for 2), they are nicely appointed and clean. The hotel is very well situated across from the Pantheon. The breakfast was very good and while not included in the price of our room was a very good value for the nice selection and service. Am planning to book there again when I return to Paris with my Mom and Aunt in May.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly and pretty hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: OrlaMcD
Reviews.Content: A picture perfect small hotel in the 5th. Handy for all locations and situated in a lovely quiet area. Staff extremely friendly and helpful with any request. Hotel rooms decent size for Paris, lovely bathrooms and the rooms were spotless. Very relaxing and perfectly full of Parisian charm for a special weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ross C
Reviews.Content: Small but clean room. Good bathroom, easy to use temperature control on shower. Room safe is a bit small and was locked on arrival. No kettle in room. Excellent view of Pantheon. Included breakfast with the offer I got. Continental only. Multiple reasonable cost places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money with a true Parisian feel!”
Reviews.Author: MAC1976
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon and had a fantastic time. The rooms have a truly Parisian feel and the location is totally unbeatable. We were 3 friends on a nice w-e away and got room 62, which they can arrange for 3 adults - the views from our room, on the 6th floor, were breathtaking, overlooking the Pantheon and with the Sacre Coeur in the distance... They're not huge but are nicely decorated in a very Frenchy way and clean. It's got that "oldie-goldie" look about it. Service is very friendly. If you want a high class hotel, this may not be for you. But if you want a good value-for-money hotel, in which you do feel you're in Paris, this is definitely a great option! Next time I'm in Paris I will definitely repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LACATraveler1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Pantheon is an excellent botique hotel, well located to enjoy Paris. The staff was excellent, they were particularly helpful in arranging shows, dinner cruises and other events for me! They spoke good English and were excellent advisors in helping me get the most out of my time in Paris! I would definitely recommend the hotel! Rick

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: 1500LOCUST
Reviews.Content: I got recommendation for this hotel from my French friend and it was really good. Room was very small but clean (I guess it is old though), and people are very friendly and helpful. The value was great among others.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Pavel O
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, pleasurable staff and perfect location. Very clean and organized rooms. Room's coffee/tea kit was one thing I really missed. Also there is no television stations in Russian.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: HolidayDH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay in this hotel, we were given a perfect room with a view of the Pantheon. Lots of restaurants around this hotel and just a short stroll to the Luxembourg Park. The metro is also nearby to connect us to the other parts of Paris. The staff is friendly and all my arrangement were done by them without any questions asked. The lobby is homely with comfortable sofas and nice decorations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot for a Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: duomogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Hotel du Pantheon while visiting Paris on business. The hotel was charming, with sweetly decorated, antique-filled rooms and friendly, helpful staff. Beds were not as comfortable as I might have hoped, but otherwise my stay was lovely. Location is terrific - close to the RER, a couple blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens, and about a 15-20 minute walk to Notre Dame. Lots of great cafes in the area. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andrew T
Reviews.Content: I travel often through Paris as a writer for National Geographic, and have grown very fond of this small, friendly and elegant hotel right across the street from the Pantheon, in the middle of the 5th arrondissement. The hotel is a short walk from the RER and the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg, and close to the 6th and central Paris. The staff is friendly, the rooms cozy and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully French”
Reviews.Author: Pkeys1
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. The rooms were very clean and the staff were friendly & helpful. I was worried when I seen other reviews. The room we stated in was quite small - but had lovely french character and furnishings - unlike the bland hotels I'd normally stay at. The location was good too - lovely cobbled streets outside and round the corner from shops and restaurants I'd definitely reccommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “At last: a quality boutique hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ernestBT48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a memorable visit to the great city. I have traveled to Paris on many occasions and found many hotels there wanting in space, value, quiet, quality and service. Hotel du Pantheon has changed that. Accessible from the RER at the Luxembourg stop (direct line to the airport), this hotel puts you just a walk away from the wonderful 'left bank' attractions. The hotel is tidy, spotless and the staff were all A1 in customer service. As in any big city, hotel room size is a premium, and while our room was compact we had ample space to enjoy from our balcony with magical views to the Pantheon, Notre Dame and (in the distance), majestic Montmartre. Fabulous place, great staff, simple tasty continental breakfast, nice common area in the lobby and free wifi throughout. Stay in this hotel and be sure to request a room with a view! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in winter........”
Reviews.Author: robynne s
Reviews.Content: Lovely corner room however we had a 'small' problem with the third bed. three adult bodies and only two adult beds plus one child bed provided even though it was booked for three adults. When this was brought to the attention of hotel staff, and we asked if another bed could be exchanged for the child bed, we were told another bed was not available. We did enjoy staying at this hotel, and would stay again and we would recommend it to others but we would require the proper size beds in the future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Girl39
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. We stayed here four nights and then relocated to an apartment on Ile Saint-Louis. Il Saint-Louis was wonderful, but we think we liked the Latin Quarter better. Our room was ready when we arrived in the morning. We were very happy with our room and felt it was a great value. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful, and we found Jenna to be exceptional. We were also able to come in from CDG airport on the RER, which was an easy walk from the station. It was also great to come out the front door of the hotel and see the Pantheon across the way. Paris was very, very crowded over the holidays, but the area around the hotel always seemed serene.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PennyReedie
Reviews.Content: After traveling all night, we arrived at the hotel on Christmas morning and our room was ready. The staff very kindly suggested a restaurant for Christmas dinner and made the reservations. During our stay the staff were exceptionally helpful and thoughtful. On New Year's Eve, the delivered a thank-you card, glasses and a bottle of champagne to guests. The rooms were very nicely decorated and well maintained. The hotel was very quiet in spite of being across the street from the Pantheon. The location was wonderful for us: we walked to concerts, the Cluny Museum, Sainte Chapelle, le Marais district, Ile St Louis and Notre Dame. We would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CDNGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Quaint little boutique-style hotel in the heart of the latin quarter. The location is great - within walking distance of Notre Dame, Pantheon, and many great shops and restaurants. We stayed in room #1 which was right by reception - not ideal, but overall not bad. Breakfast not included.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for family with teens”
Reviews.Author: Robinh
Reviews.Content: We were here four nights and loved it. The staff were very accomodating and went out of their way to help (except for the man who worked evenings...he was just ok). They went next door to find us an electric converter when we brought the wrong one and offered umbrellas when it rained. We have two college age girls and stayed in two rooms, one with a gorgeous view of the Pantheon. The rooms were quaint french with open beam ceilings. Until we got our bearings it was easy to find the hotel because we just had to ask directions to the Pantheon. We had previously planned to move to another hotel off Rue Cler near the Eiffel Tower for New Years Eve and wished we could have stayed here the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “cozy hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: prod_dev_travel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and good value for money. Just across the Pantheon monument and a 15 min stroll to NotreDame. Nice and efficient staff. Tastefully decorated and quiet rooms, a bit small but up to average Paris standard. Only downside was the elevator that seemed run down, making strange noises and eventually failed at the end of my 2 days stay, forcing everyone to use the narrow staircase up to the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Christmas visit 2011”
Reviews.Author: Allison W
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful five day stay at the Hotel recently with family. My husband and I have stayed here before, in room 51 overlooking the Pantheon. This time we were accompanied by our two teenage sons who stayed in room 45, while we were in room 61, again with a stunning view of the Pantheon. The rooms are very elegant and cosy. The Hotel is in a perfect location, within easy walking distance for all the major attractions. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Nearby are lots of places to eat, our favourite is the Cafe Soufflot. Easy to get to from the Gare De Nord, ( Eurostar ), 3 stops on the RER and a two minute walk from the Jardin De Luxemborg. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: Excellent first choice. Close to RER B, bus and Metro stations. Walk to Notre Dame Cathedral area in 20 minutes. Very quiet and safe area with lots of students who could sometimes be heard singing outside early in the morning. Staff were excellent throughout our 1 week stay. The food, coffee and service in the cellar breakfast room was a real treat. Room was small as reported but cozy, well decorated and had a large bathroom with all the amenities. Flat screen TV with good news and sports channels was also handy. The hotel staff really make the difference. We didn't know there was a (broken) elevator for several days as we had so much fun walking up and down the spiral staircase.

Reviews.Title: “This is a tricky one!”
Reviews.Author: DorkingJaneG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Paris. I found the hotel very clean and comfortable (maybe the bed was a bit hard - but its probably best for your back!?). We stayed in room 15 - very nice decor, lovely soft pillows and a nice bathroom but a lot of noise from some sort of machine in the courtyard to the back. This weirdly went on all night but was silent during the day - a mystery to me still. The staff were so nice, which I feel makes up for the noise. We will give this hotel anther go and be careful to request a quiet room with a little more space. The location is excellent and if you like a firm bed you are on to a winner. Would also like to point out that the front desk staff were fantastic in getting us taxis and giving help-full advice. I'm finding it hard to give an overall rating - I feel it was good as opposed to very good but hopefully next time it will live up to my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: samdixey2001
Reviews.Content: We both loved the hotel. Great location with stunning view. Short walk from the metro station and close by to bars and very good restaurants, also stroll to the river. Good area not very touristy. Staff very happy to recommend tours and places to eat. The lift was broken for our stay but we were told before our arrival and our luggage was taken to our 4th floor room for us. We were also asked if we would prefer a lower floor room, which we declined, the view was worth the climb! The rooms are small (this is paris!) but excellent, very clean and with heaps of character. Spiral staircases, beams in the rooms, cosy bar area, all added to the charm of this hotel. We got a discounted rate for a winter special. It is on the expensive side, and without the discounted rate may have looked at other options. But can't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: janice m
Reviews.Content: Warm, friendly staff, great location, excellent rooms in a french country style, CLEAN, just wonderful and was at a good price. Hope to stay there again. Resturants just down the block, close to metro stop and down the block from hop on tour bus. PERFECT

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Katskeie
Reviews.Content: Great location, great great views (if you book view of Pantheon) and the rooms are beautiful and cosy. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully classy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: This hotel oozes charm and is on one side of the Place du Pantheon. The rooms are small but adequate and are quiet. There is a bar area downstairs in the foyer, where tea and coffee are also available. The main reason to stay here is for the view: directly onto the Pantheon and beyond if at the front of the hotel and the nearby Rue Mouffetard offers lots of reasonably priced restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An address you'll want to keep”
Reviews.Author: Bussetboy
Reviews.Content: For business or for pleasure this is a lovely little hotel. Easy to find, easy to park (at least to drop off the luggage) and a nice warm welcome. As you'd expect in a building of this age, the rooms are small too, but for me that only adds to the charm. If you have a room facing the Pantheon (and you should ask for one when booking) then the view over the square, even from the 1st floor, gives an impression of space and relative quiet rarely found in Paris. Breakfast is served in the renovated vaulted stone cellar which is windowless but nevertheless original and pretty. Again, service is attentive and personal. The overall decoration is typically Parisien chintzy, you either like it or you don't but it goes well with the building. During my visit the lift was out of order but I was warned by e-mail beforehand with apologies, something rare enough to be appreciated. There was also a plumbing leak which affected my room, the kind of unexpected thing that can happen anywhere but it was immediately attended to, again with apologies. If you're using the metro then the nearest station is a bit of a walk, especially with luggage. Nice quarter, lots of places to eat, drink and visit with easy access to St. Germain, Ile de la Cité etc.. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: ZYX032
Reviews.Content: Have been going to this hotel for many years and have never been disappointed. Yes the rooms are small but thats part of the charm since this is a very old but typical parisian building. Yes the lift was not functional but we were relocated from the 6th to the 2nd floor (a bit of a let down!), we missed the view but had seen it many times before. Staff is always very pleasant, helpful and providing the necessary service and answers. Breakfast reasonable and good; cheaper and better than at a local Cafe. Location great to walk to the Lux gardens or down to the Seine. RER is 5min away and direct to the airports.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: ImmieQ S
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but the room was tine. Though it's quite usual for Paris. The hotel itself is pretty and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Blossom and blooming in the Hotel du Pantheon!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruler68
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to celebrate our blossoming relationship with a romantic trip to Paris. Our love bloomed in this beautiful city and the Hotel du Pantheon played its part too! This is a charming, friendly, laid back hotel with a tasteful French design and an old style charm. The design could be described as a mix of French 50's retro mixed with a classical style, but I am the not the right person to be describing decor and style. The hotel has a family run hotel vibe to it, being small, intimate and friendly. It is comfortable and clean and I would guess that it borders somewhere between comfort and luxury. Our room had a view of the Pantheon and although the room was of a typical small Parisien size, it was romantic in a French movie sort of way (and not in a choclate box, soft focus American sort of way!!). The location of the hotel is perfect too and the area is nice and quiet at night. The two girls on reception were very friendly and helpful and refreshingly laidback unlike the stuffy, servile, all business-like, faux-posh manner of desk staff in American, British or Irish hotels. No complaints about anything really. The hotel du Pantheon certainly has its own unique identity, atmosphere and pace, that I find hard to articulate! Suffice to say that it is all good and, from experience, I can definately recommend it for a romantic break. All in all, I love this hotel. Only quibble was I found it a bit expensive, but I guess all hotels in Paris are expensive? Lastly, a wee bit of advice. This hotel may not be too the taste of a certain ilk of American, British (and my compatriot Irish) visitors who are used to the uniformed British/American 'luxury' hotel or who love chain hotels. The Hotel du Pantheon may be unique and too far removed from (your very narrow) comfort zone. My advice would be to ditch your concept of a hotel and go with it. When in Rome and all that..... Vive la difference! Anyone who loves the real, authentic, contemporary Parisien experience will love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Good 3 Star for Paris ***”
Reviews.Author: rmtkol
Reviews.Content: A good hotel centrally located for most attractions and close enough to get on the Metro or RER to reach others (It's 1.40 Euros to get almost anywhere - one trip ticket). As others have said the 5th floor is a must for fab views of the Pantheon - although the lift was 'out' for all 4 nights of our stay and the 93 steps from reception proved a challenge - not a deal breaker, but chose a lower room or check if important to you. We had a superior room which was clean and well decorated, of an adequate size with separate toilet and bathroom. Hanging space is limited, as is clothes storage space. Rooms have heating but no a/c - we left windows open at night. Breakfast is 13 Euros per head; we had on each day as couldn't really find anything that much cheaper. The breakfast room in the cellar is fine, if a bit hot, and breakfast was very good with choice of cereals, choice of breads, croissants, chocolate croissants, fresh juice, fresh fruit, tea/coffee, choice of hams and choice of 2 cheeses. There was a choice of yoghurts and 'make your own' pancakes too as well as a toaster. We didn't need anything else til 2pm-ish having had breakfast at 9am-ish qand even just a roll and a coffee. Breakfast locally, but way less extensive is about 9.80 Euros in cafes and I guess if you just want a coffee and a piece of toast this was probably available; a pub on the other side of the Pantheon did a cooked breakfast (The Bombardier) at 13.60 Euros and at 4pm was packed and had a good choice of English beers. We found a good Italian, Trattario Italiano on the Rue Des Carmes, other side of Pantheon and a good Greek in Place Du Contrascarpe (behind and to left of hotel). Most restaurants close by - not the posh ones - did a 2 course meal with wine (or Litre carafe) for about 50-60 Euros. A bottle of wine in a restaurant is about 18 Euros for the cheapest, but a good one in a wine shops was about 6.50 Euros - to put in the mini-bar fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: heleleat4915
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon, and it was as spectacular as the first. Found initially through trip advisor it is a great little piece of Paris. Close to the Latin Quarter for fun nights out, and of course opposite the Pantheon. Close to public transportation, sights, fun, yet nice and quiet at night I cannot recommend this piece of paradise enough. The staff are beyond kind, and it is wonderful to sit in the lobby by the fire having a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb value”
Reviews.Author: JandPEngland
Reviews.Content: Everything worked well except the lift which was shut down for major maintenance, but the exceptional staff coped very well and managed the luggage quickly and efficiently up and down the tight stairs and we did not hear a single complaint.The rooms were immaculate and housekeeping standards were of the highest order. Advice on all manner of things from bars to transport was well informed and very helpful. There appeared to be a strong team ethic operating throughout the hotel which made for a very pleasant atmosphere and a determination to offer guests the highest possible levels of service. The ladies doing breakfast were both characters in their own ways which always got the day off to a good start. A real gem at very sensible prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, excellent staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: PotatoMasher
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with many period features. The rooms are well appointed with traditional furniture. This is a small hotel so expect a cosy, homey feel. The staff were very helpful. The location is literally next to the Pantheon in the 5th. I had a view of the square that also included the Eiffel Tower and Sacré-Cœur.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but stay upstairs!”
Reviews.Author: peterandbrenda_10
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed everything about our stay apart from the ground floor room, with windows right on the pavement and consequent noise that made sleep difficult. Go for an upstairs room! The location was perfect, no need for any carnets as you can walk everywhere. Loads of good varied places to eat nearby, certainly the best area for food we have found in Paris, especially the Epoque bistro, which we would hunt down again! The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier and a glass of wine in the reception bar while looking over the Pantheon itself was a real pleasure. We would certainly stay again but would insist on an upstairs room.

Reviews.Title: “You know you're in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Keagriver
Reviews.Content: Lovely décor, comfy bed, great location facing the Panthéon, helpful staff. As previously mentioned, it's worth going for the more expensive rooms on the top floors facing the Place du Panthéon because of the fantastic views and slightly larger rooms. We know this because we started out in a room on a lower floor facing a side street, and although it was beautifully decorated and had a larger bathroom with a window, we found it to be dark (poor lighting) and noisy in the mornings. Granted, we're late sleepers, but we felt like we could hear everything being said in the rooms nearby. Our second room, while still a bit noisy, more than made up for this with its spectacular view. We didn't spring for the pricey breakfast and would recommend walking to nearby café which had the best coffee: take a right out the hotel door, turn right at the corner and then right again at the end of the block then find a spot at the second restaurant you come to. My best tip: read "The Paris Wife" while you are there. It's a novel about Hemingway and his first wife, and you can find their first Paris apartment just a few blocks away on Rue du Cardinal Lemoin.

Reviews.Title: “Great small french hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Timothy H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. Across the street from the Pantheon, it is well placed close to excellent cafes and restrauants. Close to the metro and bus stops. Located in the latin quarter it is vibrant area with lots ot activity but rooms are quiet. The staff was wonderful, very helpful, rooms were very clean and updated. Rooms are small as is the custom in Europe, but not so small they were difficult. When we visit Paris again we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: EconomistGuy
Reviews.Content: Where to start..... the front desk staff, breakfasts, our room, location.... all outstanding. We decided on the Hotel du Pantheon this trip based on reviews, helpful communication with hotel staff prior to arrival, and its close proximity to Parc Luxembourg which is a favourite area to just hang out on a sunny afternoon. Prior to arriving we upgraded our room to one on the front with a view of the Pantheon. When we arrived, we found it had not only the best possible view of the Pantheon but also a patio big enough for a couple chairs and a bottle of wine (5th floor).... sitting on the patio with a glass of wine was nice on humid 30+ degree days. Our room was elegant with wonderful bed linens. We thought based partly on other reviews it might be noisy but it was completely quiet even though it overlooked the Place du Pantheon and was adjacent to the elevator. The cozy breakfast room in the basement was a real treat.... a wonderful place to start each day. Breakfasts were outstanding and were included in a 200 euros/day room rate..... great value in my opinion. The front desk staff (especially Jenna!!!), were fun, full of information, and helped us with our French on a regular basis. Jenna had several good restaurant (Le Perraudin and Le Berthoud) and area recommendations (rue Mouffetard) . The hotel is a little further from the Metro and RER than most.... 4-5 blocks west down rue Sufflot to Parc Luxembourg RER station (goes directly to CDG) or 5-6 blocks north to Maubert or Cluny-La Sorbonne Metro stations.... still an easy walk. It is 2-3 block walk to rue Mouffetard which is a popular late-night area for students at the Sorbonne with ice cream shops,little cafes and bars filled with locals. We will definitely return to Hotel du Pantheon on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but...”
Reviews.Author: Paloma1962
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located (heart of Latin Quarter). Beautiful views (if you get up high enough). Friendly staff. Beautiful rooms (fabulous interior decoration). BUT: It was terribly noisy at night, partly from people whooping it on on la place du Pantheon, but mostly from traffic roaring through, and very noisy garbage collection early every morning. Because of the noise, we asked for a room on a higher floor (we had been on the first; unbearable). Our fifth floor room though smaller was quieter, but not quiet. For top hotel rate of over $360 per room, this was not a bargain. We would look next time for something tucked away on a side street, and a good distance from noisy boulevard traffic (many motorcycles these days).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy044
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic in the Latin quarter, nice central location to all the sites of Paris. The room was small but very clean & comfortable & very quiet. I would definitely stay here again:))

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_Couple_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hôtel du Panthéon for four nights in September. Coming from Charles de Gaulle airport, the hotel was easily reached from the airport on the RER train by heading to the Luxembourg station, then walking 150 metres towards the Panthéon. The hotel is in the heart of the Latin Quarter, not far from the the Metro and RER networks. While the hotel is situated on the square in front of the Panthéon and does receive some traffic noise during the day, we found that it died away almost completely at night, making for uninterrupted sleep. The hotel staff were exceedingly friendly and spoke very good English, although they were also happy to let us practice our French. The rooms were small (this being Paris) but not so small that we had any issues moving about or accessing our luggage. The building itself, while quite old, seemed well kept up. The room was very clean, with a traditional and cozy if not grandiose or particularly elegant décor, and the bathroom had been modernized. While the hotel offered breakfast for a reasonable fee, we opted instead to head out to one the many local patisseries located in the hotel's immediate vicinity. We were very happy with the Panthéon and felt it represented very good value for Paris. We would suggest spending a bit extra for a Superior Room, which gives you a terrific view of the Panthéon and square. It also moves you further away from any residual traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Brisvegas_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for our first time in Paris. The girl at the front desk Emily we believe her name was sorry if this is wrong was extremely helpful and always friendly. The rooms are clean and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: PmLike2travel
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Staff was helpful and we could walk to everything. Close to Latin quarter but not in the middle of it. The room was very comfortable and it was priced well for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend in Paris! The most amazing views!!”
Reviews.Author: Batchacre1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for our first stay in Paris and has such a lovely weekend. We would definatlety go back, if we are lucky enough to stay in Paris. The service is beyond helpful, and we found every staff member really lovely. They offered many suggestions on where we went for supper and how we got there. Do not hesitate to book this hotel, you will have a great stay in Paris. This hotel made our trip. Would love to go back, maybe at Christmas!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jeffgc
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon, in Paris. It's a wonderful hotel is a great area of Paris. The rooms are tastefully decorated and quite comfortable. All of the hotel personnel are friendly, helpful and considerate. We will, without doubt, stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming French hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nankypool
Reviews.Content: Went here for the 2nd time and Hotel du Pantheon is consistently excellent. I love staying in the Latin quarter. The location is convenient to the RER B Luxembourg, the beautiful Luxembourg gardens, and walking distance to all the Latin quarter has to offer - dining and shopping. I booked on-line for a better rate, which included breakfast. I requested 2 twins to have more room for sleeping than a double bed. I was so pleased when I arrived that they gave us a free upgrade to a superior room overlooking the Pantheon. I had mentioned that this was our 30th wedding anniversary. The room was charming. It's also good size by Paris standards but maintains the quaint atmosphere of a real French hotel, with the exposed wood beams in the ceiling. It really is the best of both worlds, the larger bed and room size you might get with a boring big chain hotel, but all the atmosphere of a boutique French hotel. Also an exception for a French hotel, it has air conditioning. I am used to having to leave the window open and hearing all the street noise. It was quite warm when we went there and it was great to cool off in an airconditioned room.The staff is SO friendly. Breakfast was so-so, but service was friendly and the cave has a nice atmosphere. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was large, and conveniently separated from a separate toilet room. I would absolutely recommend staying at this hotel and plan to stay there again next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh-la-la Tres Charmant”
Reviews.Author: HyRose
Reviews.Content: Great location, across from the Pantheon. Our room was small but utterly romantic and charming. We had a balcony which was quirkily accessed through the bathroom, but wonderful to sit outside on, with a view of Sacre Coeur.

Reviews.Title: “Charming central hotel”
Reviews.Author: johncherylb
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely surprise for our first accommodation on a long trip. The location is excellent, really close to the Pantheon, and Luxemburg Gardens, metro and bus stops. The room was charmingly decorated and we were very lucky that staff were helpful when we arrived at 8.30am, they had a room ready for us at 10.30. Staff were very helpful and we would love to revisit this hotel. I think we had to pay for wifi, but it was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful views, helpful & knowledgable staff.”
Reviews.Author: Roadking124
Reviews.Content: Much better than you might expect from a 3 star-hotel. Rooms are small, but tastefully appointed. Good breakfast buffet, served in the cellar. Great Location: St. Germain, Sorbonne, etc. are only a short walk away. 5th & 6th floor rooms with great views!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Delight!!”
Reviews.Author: hamburgrubin
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience at this charming hotel. The staff, especially awesome Genna, was terrific. Our view of the Pantheon was breathtaking. Although our room was small and there was no bureau, the view, staff and location made up for this slight bump. This little hotel is a great value. There were many cafes and bistros throughout the area. It was a delight to come back to our cozy hotel each evening after sightseeing all day. Merci beaucoup, Hotel du Pantheon, for a memorable stay. Kathi & Wendy

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: georgiaRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: We visit Paris regularly and were very pleased to stay at this hotel for a variety of reasons: great location, lovely and friendly staff, lovely room with a great view. The hotel deserves another star: the price and hotel quality ratio is excellent given then Paris hotels, for the most part, are quite expensive and can be (in some cases) rather disappointing. Our room was a good size with a large bathroom, great view of the Pantheon, furnished in a pretty country style - very homey. The location is well serviced - metro and bus take you to most important tourist locations. The Luxembourg garden is down the road - 5 minutes. As the area is home to some of the finest departments of the Sorbonne, hence full of students, there are many interesting restaurants to choose from. Thank you to the staff who speak several langauges and were always very helpful, no matter the hour.

Reviews.Title: “CONTINUES TO CHARM AND DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: jeromeoconnor
Reviews.Content: From the first stay in the 1970s to the current visit in September this lovely boutique gem on the illustrious Place du Pantheon is a Left Bank delight and a genuine value for the money. Front desk greeting, especially from sweet Genna, is friendly and helpful. Largely North American clientele. Extra bonus is that RER B from CDG has a station at Luxembourg, about 5 minutes walk, and a big savings over taxi. Excellent, low cost restaurants in the area, and with the Sorbonne directly across the Place, expect many bars as well. To be frank, the rooms are on the small size, but typical of almost all three star hotels in Paris. The lighting is rather dim, but to be positive, it also adds to the charm. New HD flat screen with BBC and CNN another plus, although small-sized in company with room size. Baths are bright and surprisingly spacious. Genna graciously changed noisy room on the ground floor directly on sidewalk to a wood-beamed room facing the Pantheon. Viva la difference! Ask for higher floors, but remember that the hotel is small and rooms confirm quickly. Continental breakfast not included is served in an appropriately cave like basement, but also part of the charm and fun of staying in a venerable building that had its rooms and appointments refreshed in about 2008. (The immediately adjacent Hotel des Grand Hommes is owned by same management and appears as welcoming as the Pantheon.) Highly recommended for the value, location, friendliness, and true Parisian charm, even including daily International Hearald Tribune in lobby. Beds

Reviews.Title: “Family, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: VandVplus3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a one night stop as a party of six (we took two rooms, the romantic and family room), a great place to stay as a base for exploring. The view from both rooms was amazing (and couldn't believe that we could park for free outside!) Staff were friendly and spoke excellent English, thank you for making our stay so lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: elaine&ivan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, hotel is in a fantastic location overlooking the Pantheon. Rooms are lovely, although not huge they are more than adequate and very clean with safe and mini-bar, however tea and coffee making facilities would have been a nice touch. Continental Breakfast – good selection, cereals, basket with fresh croissants and bread, great little pancake maker just pour your mixture on and you have fresh pancakes, fresh fruit and preserves, although a little pricy at 13 euros each I don’t think it would have been worth trying to find anything else in the area around the hotel as Paris isn’t a cheap option as with most capital cities. Walking distance to hotel from RER/Metro, so easy to catch train from Charles De Gualle airport and walk from the luxembourg station even with luggage about 10 minutes if that. 15 minutes walk from hotel to the Notre Dame, you can then walk from there to the Louvre in about the same time. Close to bars restaurants and as its near the Sorbonne student area drinks are cheaper and quite lively. As with any capital city it is expensive you can pay anything from £3.5 to £8 for a small bottle of beer so look at the menu board before you buy if you don’t want to pay a fortune for a drink. Overall great hotel, with courteous staff in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Jack D
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It's in a great location near many bars and restaurants so there's plenty of choice. We stayed in a corner room on the front of the hotel and enjoyed a good night's sleep. As we were leaving early to catch a train we didn't eat breakfast there so can't comment on the quality. If you want to stay near the Boulevard St Michel and within walking distance of many of the left bank's attractions this is the place to stay: very friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean and comfortable rooms. What more could you want? Yes the rooms aren't large but if you want large rooms in Paris then you have to pay the extortionate price charged by the more expensive hotels. For my wife and I it was "just perfect".

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: PMurray
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 20 (superior with view). The view of the Pantheon from the large windows was great. I like staying in hotels in which when you wake up you know which city you are in. This hotel did that as the decor was French. Comfortable bed and pillows, tastefully decorated. The room and bathroom are small but as others have said that's pretty normal. The location was great - just a short walk from the RER B station (40 mins from C de G airport) and Luxemburg Gardens. Also short walk to Notre Dame and the buzzy Latin Quarter with good restaurants, cafes, bars. We thought breakfast was expensive at 13E so went elsewhere. The only slight irritation with Room 20 was that it is right next to the lift and we could hear it pretty much all the time while we were in the room although were not disturbed at night. Helpful, welcoming staff. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, dumpy hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOSTravelHound
Reviews.Content: After reading the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor we booked a room here for 3 nights of a week-long trip to Paris. What a mistake! We were so disappointed in the quality of the hotel. The decor is outdated and worn. Our room was musty and often smelled of cigarette smoke. The bathroom smelled of urine. The shower was broken with scalding hot water. Beds were uncomfortable. And the wireless internet connection in our room was spotty. The location is also quite a distance from a Metro station. We took a chance on this 3-star based on positive reviews, but from now on we'll only trust 4-star and above. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “So much more personality & soul, than the big hotels”
Reviews.Author: sundboell
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Pantheon is a beautiful, little hotel, right in the heart of Paris' 5eme and 6eme arrondissements. The location is perfect - and if you get the right room, the view also doesn't get much better anywhere else in Paris. Pros - close to Rue Moffetard; beautiful, quaint little neighbourhood - my favorite in Paris. Experience the early morning market stalls in Rue Mouffetard and at Place Monge - and have a coffee and a Perrier at Place de la Contrescarpe, while you read the paper - close to Jardin du Luxembourg - to be enjoyed summer and winter - right on Rue Soufflot - plenty of cafe's - impressive view onto the Pantheon and the square. I was lucky to get room 42 (rooms 40 and 41 are equally good) - and couldn't help sleeping with the windows open ! Cons - can't think of any serious ones, thus far - didn't try the the breakfast, though - preferred to eat out - rooms are cozy, but small - great, if you're on a romantic Paris weekend, less so if you prefer your American-sized rooms...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ana maria w
Reviews.Content: we stayed twice in August and we had two rooms. Great location close but in a quieter area, awesome view of the pantheon from street room. Most important a very helpful staff. We will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good scenery with silence and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Nonchan E
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was delicious. From our room on the top of the hotel, we could see Pantheon and Basilique du Sacre Cour. The hotel is in front of Pantheon near Jardin du Luxembourg. It was quiet and comfortable in the room. But the shower curtain was not large enough to prevent water from scattering.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: livetoeat86
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff. Jenna and nicholas are great. Clean and quaint. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, Left Bank....”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLaSalle_Canada
Reviews.Content: We always said that the next time we were in Paris we would stay in the Latin Quarters on the left bank, and we are so glad we did and in doing so we found this hotel. A very short walk from the Metro, and at the side of the Pantheon, this is a little gem. Reception small but staff so very friendly and helpful. The lounge and bar area, adjacent to the reception, is a comfortable and peaceful place to sit and have a coffee or glass of wine , any time of day or night. A small elevator takes you too your room. Our room was on the 3rd. floor overlooking the Pantheon, lovely bright room, average size for a French hotel. Good size bath and shower, separate toilet. Not too much closet space. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast as served in the basement, fruits, cheese, meats, cereals,eggs to cook if you asked. Great location for getting around, not quite as busy as the other side. We found some wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood, a couple of really top notch places.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique Du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: NIKTAS
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Du Pantheon for 10 nigthts.First of all it's very clean and comfortable.We had a baby cot in our room and we had no space problem(two adults+20m kid). The staff is more than helpful and polite.Every time we asked something from the reception or the breakfast staff they were ready to serve us even late at night. The location is perfect.Luxemburg RER and gardens 5min,Metro station 8min,Rue De Moufftard 5min,Notre Dame 15min,Botanical gardens15min walking distances from the hotel having a stroller. Another thing about the location is the Pantheon opposite the hotel.It gives a very nice ambience to the hotel and the hole area.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FamGundestrup
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at this hotel but not the last!! We stayed in room nr. 2 at the ground floor. It was quite big comparred to normal Paris standard. With aircondition and a very nice bathroom. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We look forward to coming back another time.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: lanaQueensland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Du Pantheon , I had an enjoyable stay at this wonderful little Hotel . The check-in very friendly and professional, and for those of us lacking in language skills, the reception staff are multilingual, and willing to go the extra mile for their guests. A special Thank-you , Emilie for all your kind help, during my stay. The rooms are clean , very French and very charming , not huge, but roomy enough with comfortable beds, a good sized bathroom with room to move in the bath/ shower , and my favourite a make-up mirror . This Hotel has many rooms with a direct view of the Pantheon, with a good Brasserie / cafe "Le Comptoir du Pantheon "just a few steps away. Closest metro station Maubert Mutualite , also RER station Luxembourg , a direct trip to and from CDG airport, the price approximately 13 euros . With a short stroll to the Jardin du Luxembourg . This hotel ticks all the right boxes.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris! | Mon hôtel préfèré de Paris!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkorbust
Reviews.Content: Charming, beautifully decorated, impeccably clean hotel with very friendly and attentive staff. When I'm in Paris for an extended period of time, I've stayed with friends or rented an apartment, but if I must book a hotel, I stay at the Hotel du Panthéon. It's a bit far away from my usual haunts, but it's absolutely lovely and, of course, overlooks one the most wonderful sites in Paris. Charmant, propre, avec un décor très elegant. Le personnel est sympatique, professionel, et attentif. Normalement, quand je suis à Paris, je reste avec des amis ou je loue un appartement, mais si je dois trouver un hôtel, c'est toujours le Panthéon.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: NancyO130
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We had two rooms and both were very comfortable and clean. There were four of us and each enjoyed our stay. The staff (especially Jenna) was extremely nice and helpful. They were always willing to help. If we ever go back to France I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel & Central location -can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: L T
Reviews.Content: The hotels room was beautiful, with loads of Parisian charm (which I hoped for). We were told our room had been upgraded when we arrived - The view from our room was superb! The staff were excellent and a credit to the hotel. The Hotel is centrally located and was well within walking distance to all the attractions - you do need good walking shoes! Next time we will bring our children & would not choose any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, boutiquey hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Clare L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last week and can't rate it highly enough. The staff were extremely accommodating and friendly from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. The rooms are boutique in style and the ones at the front have excellent views of the Pantheon - no feeling of being crammed in as in many hotels in Paris. Excellent location, walking distance from a number of restaurants, bars and sights. We'd definitely stay here again, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with good staff”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey p
Reviews.Content: A typical French hotel but with better ammenities than usual and very helpful staff who spoke good English. It is in a beautiful building. Both times I stayed I enjoyed the rooms with a nice bath. It is excellently located next to the Pantheon on a grand square and close to the Jardin de Luxenbourg. The free internet was a boon as this is usually excessively charged for in European hotels. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiologyChick81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the hotel du Pantheon. We stayed in a corner suite after being upgraded by a booking miscommunication by the staff . We were so lucky to have a small balcony, three open windows and a view of the pantheon right outside our window. The staff was friendly and helpful, the petite dejouner was delicious and we loved. Things to change: tiny elevator, small room even with upgrade and leaving key at front desk every time...but I think these are just common all over Paris. One of our top 5 hotels of all time and would definently go back in a heartbeat to our wonderful honeymoon suite.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Junebugg19
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon while on our honeymoon. The Hotel du Pantheon was a fantastic place to stay! From Charles de Gaulle, it was easy to take the RER. The hotel was right around the corner from the Luxembourg station. the hotel is very convenient to getting around the city. We used the metro quite a lot, and it was a short walk to Notre Dame and other sites. The staff were friendly and willing to help with anything we needed. Even before we arrived, I had emailed the hotel with a few questions, and they always sent back a prompt, helpful response. We had heard Paris hotel rooms were small and weren't sure what to expect. At the Hotel du Pantheon, we found our room to be of adequate size - not huge but very efficiently laid out. The bathroom was quite large - it even had a tub! (We did not expect this) We recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quaint hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Pantheon and really enjoyed it. Decoration, staff, views of the Pantheon, location - all lovely. Room size is OK, not especially small for Paris. Only disadvantage: The shower was not too convenient for tall people, afterwards the bathroom floor was completely wet. Looking forward to coming back when in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: RandK510
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. The hotel is right next to the Pantheon and we could see the great historic building straight through our room window. Our room was big enough for two and was beautifully decorated. The area was calm and silent at night. We were able to use the wi-fi easily which made our stay easy. The hotel is a bit far from the metro station, but not too far to walk. Also the bus stop for 84 is really close. 84 will take you to le bon marche, concorde (next to Louvre) and so on. Luxembourg bus stop and RER station is not too far as well. You can easily visit the Marche Mouffetard as well. And what I would like to recommend most about this hotel is the kindness of the hotel reception staffs. They speak good English. We love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL DU PANTHEON MADE MY PARISIAN DREAM COME TRUE”
Reviews.Author: ParisianAtHeart_14
Reviews.Content: I lived around the corner from the Hotel for almost 3 years. Family and friends stayed there while visiting me. This was my first time back as "a tourist" and the hotel (location and rooms) and its staff (Emilie, Jena and Patrick) made me feel at home as well as the romantic tourist I longed to be. Because we just walked in to book, after a terrible night at another hotel booked by friends, we had to move 3 times. We loved it, since each room had something special and gave us special memories. Number 52: The View of the Pantheon!! For once we saw it from above and the Marie du Vème as well as the Sorbonne Law school looked like a perfect theater stage, illuminated at night. Number 63: Breakfast on the tin roof looking at the Sacre Coeur. Priceless!! Number 14: Sweet decoration and incredible bathroom. The hotel's location could not be better. It's in the heart of Paris. From here one can walk everywhere. Many buses available as well as the subway (RER) to the Charles De Gaulle airport. What else does one need in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel - loved it”
Reviews.Author: Forbrugeren
Reviews.Content: The location, the accomodation and the breakfast (yummi!) was really really good. It's a really good couples hotel. The rooms are quit small, but that's the "Parisian Way". There's lots of good restaurants in the area, and You live conveniently close to close to the Seine, the islands and Boulevard St. Germain, but conveniently away from the tourist masses. We loved it, we have recommended it for and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingerdramaqueen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, very quiet and clean yet only a few minutes walk to the cafes, restaurants abd shops. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was lovely with a very large bathroom with bath. It was on the ground floor opposite the reception area, so I could hear some people coming and going. Next time I would ask for another room if possible. We didn't have the breakfast at the hotel but found a lovely restaurant nearby which serves a continental breakfast for 6.50 euros. I would recommend this hotel, it was worth the money and I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDiane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating a big anniversary and loved staying at the Hotel du Pantheon. The location is wonderful, just a few blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens. The hotel staff was fabulous, particularly Emilie and Patrick. We were always greeted with smiles and everyone was very responsive to our questions and requests. The room was lovely, even though it was a little on the small size, and it overlooked the Pantheon. We thought it was an excellent value and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Visitor50_11
Reviews.Content: I do not typically write reviews for hotels. I travel often for business. This trip was for pleasure. I am a reasonably hard critic when it comes to hotels. I decided that I would indeed write a review in this case. The staff was very helpful. They took care of everything I needed. They were very friendly which - I don't care what part of the world you travel to or how nice the hotel is - that is not always the case. The room was very cute. I judge alot on the cleanliness. The room and the bathroom were extremely clean. When you travel as much as I do...that is the key to the entire trip. The only negative of the entire experience was upon arrival. My flight arrived very early. The hotel was booked the night before so I had to wait a long time for the room to be ready. So if your flight arrives early, plan on being tired and having to walk around a while or sit in the lobby a while. But it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of Everything”
Reviews.Author: NomadicPatoux
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 6 days. It is very quiet even though it is so close to the Patheon and the hordes of tourists.We found the staff to be helpful, friendly, attentive, and full of good recommendations for places to eat. The staff mention a couple of places behind the hotel that we found to be very good after having some "misses" at other locations. Great location-close to the RER B that takes you to CDG for 9.10 euro-within walking distance from the hotel at the Luxembourg station on Blvd St. Michel. Would highly recommend this hotel and will likely return in the near future. G&C Calgary, Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Such friendly, helpful staff, we loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine44
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Pantheon is a gem. Staff were wonderful, every member! Great location, excellent value, charming rooms. Would love to return next time we are in Paris. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jasminrose
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Du Pantheon is a nice, modestly priced hotel with character in a lovely setting. It is not only situated directly across from the Pantheon, but there is also a view of the top two thirds of the Eiffel Tower from the square in front of the hotel. Several reasonably priced cafes are very nearby and it is a short stroll to the Luxembourg Gardens. My double room was quite comfortable with more space than usual for an older Paris hotel. The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. The only negative was the buffet breakfast at 13 euros. I thought the coffee and croissants were poor quality for Paris. However, there is a cafe nearly next door with great croissants and grand creme. I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel du Pantheon and do not hesitate to recommend it. I had stayed at their sister hotel, Jardin d"Odeon in 2007 and really liked that one too.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay couldn't have been nicer....”
Reviews.Author: MrSiv
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near plenty of local restaurants, bars, shops and places of interest the Hotel du Patheon was an ideal location for our fleeting visit. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was spacious and quaint - in keeping with the hotel's retro charm. We didn't have breakfast so I can't comment but I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Find in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: easter2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel du Pantheon for 1 night while in Paris and could not have been happier. Not only is the hotel the epitome of charm, it is clean and the staff that we met, Emily and Patrick, could not be kinder or more helpful. Its a short walk to the heart of St Germain but very quiet over at the hotel in front of the Pantheon. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel in great locale.”
Reviews.Author: julie27705
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Du Pantheon. It is located in a great area. The Pantheon, where Victor Hugo and other many great Frenchmen are buried, is located minutes away. Also close by is the metro and RER (easy to get to and from CDG airport), St. Germaine Blvd (awesome shops and restaurants), and Notre Dame. The hotel has a European charm but is still clean, quite, and the staff was very friendly. I did not eat the breakfast at the hotel because minutes away was a lovely crepe stand where I got crepe filled with nutella for a fraction of the price of the hotel breakfast. The only draw back was the hardness of the bed. I am accustomed to softer beds and wished that there were more pillows. Maybe this is a cultural thing but the bedding was not as soft as bedding in American hotels like Marriott or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jollyangela2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Hotel du Pantheon in June for our honeymoon. We choose one of the upgraded rooms so that we would have a view of the Pantheon and it was so worth it! The view was great. We had a double window that opened to a small balcony where we could step out and watch the happenings below. Our room had a queen size bed, shower w/ tub, two small closets, table and two chairs, small chest, tv, and minibar refrigerator. The room was small but comfortable and the a/c worked well. The staff spoke some English and along with our limited French we communicated pretty well. The hotel offered breakfast for an additional 13euro but we skipped it and enjoyed the cafes nearby. The hotel is a few blocks from the nearest metro. There is a great wine shop, a fromagerie, and many cafes nearby. We saved a lot of money by reserving our room on the hotel website. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: unluciole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our second trip to Paris recently, and were very satisfied. We had lovely views of the Pantheon, and the location to the most important sites is perfect! You are within walking distance to all the major museums, the Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, etc. The room was tastefully decorated, and really exuded French-country style. The hotel and room was very clean, and everyone on the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. I would certainly recommend this hotel without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was outstanding!"”
Reviews.Author: CindaZ
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific - we looked out at the Pantheon! Each staff member we encountered went out of his/her way to help us - all were extremely courteous. The breakfast is superior to other hotels'; the lobby/bar area is cozy & inviting. After I returned home, I contacted the hotel due to confusion regarding my credit card statement, & management was attentive, swift, & helpful ~ the issue turned out to be MY confusion about another establishment, not Hotel du Pantheon, & they helped me figure it out. BTW ~ the A/C was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great first night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wharfsuggestion
Reviews.Content: After a horribly delayed flight from the USA we arrived and were very relieved to be at a wonderful hotel with efficient, English speaking staff. We had viewed the pictures and comments on line with Trip Advisor. Easy walk to cafes, quick taxi ride to train. Rooms are very well appointed and the front rooms have an awesome view of the Pantheon. Quiet, comfortable and clean. Great for a good night's sleep and breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic”
Reviews.Author: Marc1950
Reviews.Content: For the price, a good value. It's an old style European hotel ( with much better plumbing) that emphasizes simplicity and charm. The staff were very accommodating, and more than happy to book reservations and transportation. The rooms are fairly basic, but you're in Paris so enjoy the city and not the room. Breakfasts are best eaten in one of thousands of nearby cafes rather than their dungeonous breakfast room. If you require a good hair dryer, this is probably not the hotel. All in all, an OK experience, if you as long as you are not expecting a 4 or 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely left bank hotel”
Reviews.Author: teampamandpaul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming and beautifully decorated. We stayed for six nights in a superior room on the 4th floor, which had a comfortable king bed, two large windows overlooking the Pantheon, and a well-appointed bathroom. Particularly helpful for us was the small refrigerator that we used for storing yogurt, fruit, and beverages. The location is great, and although we are both over 65, we were able to walk almost everywhere (including the Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, the Sainte-Chapelle, Ile St. Louis). The room was very quiet at night with the windows closed, although it did get a bit stuffy--we had the sense that the air conditioning was not working very efficiently. A minor quibble is with the breakfast: We would have liked to see more fresh fruit, like oranges and bananas. We found the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: normplante
Reviews.Content: Small, clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Close to shopping, tasty restaurants, and bus services, nice view to of the pantheon, would stay again at this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tubbs1957
Reviews.Content: The location, room comfort and cleanliness and hotel stall were all outstanding. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dturner99
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Hotel du Pantheon and had the most wonderful Paris Experience. The hotel location is great, close to attractions, metro, and bustling Rue du Moufettard, yet surprisingly quiet at night for a downtown hotel. Being close to the Sorbonne, the neighborhood felt safe and it was great just to look out the window and take in the city. The staff here are the most helpful you could ask for, with advice, directions and going out of their way to accomodate. We will be back next time we are in Paris, and we felt the price was very fair considering the location. If you are going to Paris for the first time, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff with great English”
Reviews.Author: jrd65091
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in room 621 with a great view of the Pantheon. Really great location--close to lots, but quiet and removed from much of the noise at night. great wine, cheese, bakery, chocolate and grocery stores within a block or so. Very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful new homebase in paris”
Reviews.Author: boudin
Reviews.Content: the venerable small hotel faces the Pantheon, one of Paris's iconic masterpieces and within a 3 minute walk of the Luxumbourg Gardens. if was, however, the wonderful staff; Stephanie, jenna, roman and the others who worked there who made our stay so memorable. they REALLY made us feel welcome and we'll be back to Paris and the Hotel du Pantheon as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: nofusscioppino
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and really enjoyed it. Staff including Patrick and Jenna are excellent and speak wonderful English. I used them extensively for tips on how to.enjoy Paris. Rooms are small but tidy. It has the ubiquitous cramped and creaky "charming" ancient Parisien elevator. Breakfast downstairs is pretty simple, but be sure to order an omelette which is not part of the buffet. I would say this hotel is expensive, but not once you consider the location. You can walk to many important sites including the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in terrific Latin Quarter location by the Pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: cmelon
