Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a fantastic spot. The rooms are typically small for Paris, but gorgeously decorated, and service is friendly and very helpful. Rooms facing the Pantheon have an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: aloha999
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here twice and fell in love with everything about this hotel, our room looked out to the Pantheon, very awesome staff Parick and Jenna who reccomend ed the best dining experiences close by,very quiet at night; loved it thank you all

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant area, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: davidkillip
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a short city break and stayed in this hotel for three nights. It was situated in the lovely Latin Quarter of the city and our room had superb views of the Pantheon, the area is a very nice part of the city with plenty of cafes and restaurants not far from the hotel, the metro and RER stations are also closeby. Our room was beautifully decorated in a typically french fashion but complete with necessary mod cons; free wifi, TV with international channels etc. The bathroom was clean with a good shower but a bit on the small side and there was plenty of closet space for clothes and shoes. There was also a small safe for storage of any valuables. Breakfast was not included in the rate but we decided to use the hotel anyway, the restaurant was small but charming and the breakfasts were continental but eggs cooked in a variety of ways were also available to order (at an additional cost)! Basic breakfast cost €13, for a selection of cereals, croissants, bread, yoghurts, hams, cheese etc. The restaurant does not serve any other meals. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating and spoke very good english. We were able to print boarding passes the night before we left and could store our luggage after checking out on the day of our departure. Overall a brilliant hotel, very clean and comfortable in a charming area of Paris. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacquelynrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for three nights. We wanted a quaint hotel in a great location and were not disappointed on either count. The front desk kindly upgraded us, and even though we arrived a little early for check in we were given our rooms right away. The view from the room was more than I could have hoped for - overlooking the amazing Pantheon. The staff were endlessly helpful, the room absolutely spotless, so we simply could not have asked for more. We would return in a heartbeat. The location was perfect - loved the Latin Quarter. Walking four minutes to Rue Descartes where every conceivable artisan baker, chocolatier, fromagerie etc etc was there to be enjoyed was all I hoped for. All the major sights were either walkable or easily reached by the metro. A perfect holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: klsrd
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here. We stayed for 4 days, then left for Provence for 6 days, and returned for 2 more days. They were very accommodating, held our luggage for us, gave us 2 rooms next to one another, and could not have been nicer. Location is great, but is a bit of a walk to the metro. Rooms are small, as noted by others, but are very charming, immaculate and have all modern amenities. Internet In rooms was spotty, but fine in the lobby. If you stay, it is worth it to have the breakfast included in your package.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: alwayswithfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris and the Hotel du Pantheon was a perfect place to stay. The staff is friendly, helpful and multilingual. They offered great tips when asked and always welcomed us back from our day with a smile. The location was wonderful - across from the Pantheon, just a few minute walk to the RER station and Luxembourg Gardens. A short walk around provides many new treasures to view and a great feel for the area. We had two rooms - one with a view of the Pantheon (superior room) and one with a view of the side street (classic room). Both were nicely decorated and comfortable. AC worked well and the bathrooms were quite nice. Only complaint was that there was no way to take a shower in the classic room without getting the floor all wet. However, that was a very, very small issue. Breakfast was a good value - 13 euros per person for a nice little buffet with coffee, tea, juice and hot chocolate. The drinks alone made the breakfast worth the cost in Paris. We would definitely stay here again. A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best ***-hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinnnnnnnn
Reviews.Content: What a beauty! Everything was just excellent: the room (on the 6th floor, you have an amazing view over Paris), the location, the hotel itself and the staff. We took our dog with us and our arrival was never seen: immediatly a bowl of water for the dog. In case you want a ***-star hotel in one of the best neighborhoods of Paris, do not search longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service, cute rooms”
Reviews.Author: Manasi29
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was outstanding, being right next to the pantheon..we could see it right outside our window!! The reception staff was very friendly, the breakfast was good. The rooms were a little small but very french and cute. Overall a good experience, would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: onthegotraveler2011
Reviews.Content: I first got a room which wasn't so good because of the pedestrians noise, moving next to our room windows and the hotel guests at the lobby. My husband and I asked for the staff to move us to another room. They moved us to a bigger room, upstairs, very comfortable with a nice view. Very clean and spacious. I really felt the French style all around! The price is great and the location is excellent. I would definitely stay in this hotel next time I travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: David628
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 2 nights in late May and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The location is great for exploring the Latin Quarter. Our room was fantastic and overlooked the Pantheon. The staff was outstanding, with excellent customer service, especially the young lady originally from the Loire Valley. Every suggestion she gave us was spot on and definitely added to our value experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrisTattoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights May, 2011. The location was perfect. Had a view of the Pantheon from our room and a view of the Eiffel Tower just outside the hotel. The staff were polite and accommodating. Breakfast was outstanding and very French! Recommend this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: etower
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for two weeks. The hotel and rooms are very clean and the rooms are a bit larger than many that you will find in Paris. The staff is bilingual (English and French), very friendly, knowledgeable and extremely helpful. They helped us with directions to various sites and in arranging bus tours and restaurants. The breakfast area is very nicely appointed and there is a good variety of breakfast food available The hotel is very well situated in an open, sunny location immediately across from the Pantheon and very close to the Sorbonne. There are many students and families in the immediate area and it is very safe and comfortable to walk around. There are many restaurants, coffee shops, small grocery stores and pharmacies within easy walking distance. There are bank machines around the corner and two Metro lines within easy walking distance which makes the hotel accessible by train from the airport. There is also a small elevator for those who have difficulty with stairs. We had a lovely room with a great view of the Pantheon and found that it was quiet and very comfortable. I believe that all rooms are equipped with private safes and mini bars. Our room had air conditioning which was quiet and easy to adjust.

Reviews.Title: “Great Latin Quarter Location”
Reviews.Author: jkwalkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon based on Trip Advisor reviews and as per usual we were not disappointed. The desk service was very good and the location was outstanding. Even though we speak little if any French we had no problems communicating with the multi lingual staff. The hotel is directly across the street from the Pantheon and you can see the top third of the Eifel Tower from the front of the Pantheon. We stayed in room 1. It was lovely, clean, well deocorated and the bathroom is large (huge by European standards). That said, the room gets all the noise from the lobby and the street - not a big deal but next time we would ask for a room upstairs on the inside. The breakfast was very good. The breakfast room is in the basement but is well lit and brightly decorated. There is plenty to eat and enough to keep you for the day. We would not hesitate to stay here again. We would also not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends

Reviews.Title: “Solid, French styled, small-mid sized hotel by quiet Pantheon in Latin Quarter close to Sorbonne, Mouffetard & jardin Luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: chinstrap
Reviews.Content: Ending off our trip tonight here. It's been great. The hotel is in the left bank off of busy Saint Michele an close to La Sorbonne and Mouffetarde. Can walk to notre dame in 15-20 min. Cafes in St. Germain also 15min walk on rue seine and buci.. Restaurants on Mouffetard more bohemian than St germain. We got upgraded to a superior room with a Pantheon view. Hard queen sized bed that we slept well on, tv, hairdryer like a vacuum for my wife.. Jenna and Patrick at the front desk have been great to us. If This hotel comes up in your search and it's the right price, I would recommend. There are tons of hotels in Paris but at least you know this is a solid hotel an we would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: anonymous186394
Reviews.Content: We had read other reviews on this website and on that basis booked this hotel. We were not disappointed and could not have been happier with our choice. We were upgraded to a room with a view which was a good size especially as we had read that rooms in Paris tend to be on the small side. Decor very French and homely which added to the ambience. Staff really helpful and friendly despite us locking the safe without remembering the code. Location nice and central but as it was away from the main street nice and quiet on an evening, even with the window open. We would definitely stay again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tazmansd
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. I select the Hotel du Pantheon based on Trip Advisors' reviews regarding this hotels "friendly staff" and the location. We were not disappointed in the least. The ladies at the desk were extremly helpful and friendly. The location puts you in the heart of main attractions. The rooms are small and lack AC, but we knew that going in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cafes and people who enjoy walking”
Reviews.Author: FBFTo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a classic room for 5 nights facing the courtyard and found it to be quiet, charming and comfortable. The rooms right next to the elevator are literally less than a foot away from the elevator so I don't know how quiet they would be. The front desk staff were all fluent in English and very friendly and helpful in terms of making arrangements and providing directions. We like to walk and appreciated the fact that there were so many tourist sites within walking distance of the hotel (Luxembourg Gardens - 5 minute walk, Notre Dame - 15 minutes, Louve and Orsay Museums (20 - 25 minutes), Eiffel Tower (45 minutes) etc.. ). The area is quite young and vibrant as it is near the Sorbonne and there are many cafes within a few minute walk. The closest Metro stop is about a 10 minute walk. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as we felt 13 euros was expensive for what was served (although everything is expensive in Paris). We bought cereals, fruits, milk and lovely pastries from the local bakeries and ate in the room. The mini fridge came in handy in that regard. Changes I would have liked - it would have been nice to have been able to make a cup of tea or coffee in the room; and no matter how much we tried, we could not take a shower without getting the floor wet as the glass door on the shower only ran about a quarter of the length of the tub.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: hatul_10
Reviews.Content: we had a nice stay in the superior room- the view of the Pantheon was perfect. the hotel is located in a nice neighborhood with lots of students and locals. its a walk from the center and if your into the Latin quarter I can't think of a better location to stay. we hang out a lot at the Le Comptoir du Panthéon and after 2 or 3 coffees there felt like locals.. -its nice to have a place like that just down the street... rooms are not big but pleasant with a lot of sun light, there's no self making coffe & tea in the room (a bit disappointing for this high priced hotel) but that's the only remark I have. we have sweet memories.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: TimP12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel du Pantheon. The staff was very friendly & helpful. The location is within walking distance to Notre Dame & the heart of Paris... but you may drift into one of the numerous cafe's, restaurants or pastry shops before you get there. We loved exploring the neigborhood. The room was very quiet with modern windows and was generous in size for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A "Little Slice of Paris"”
Reviews.Author: allioops03
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 adult daughters stayed in 2006 in a triple corner room facing the Pantheon for a 4 night stay and were SO PLEASED that I had to look no further for accomodations for my 21 yr old granddaughter for our visit last week for 6 nights. I requested a Superior Room facing the Pantheon.We were in room 61 on the top floor with 2 windows that opened facing the Pantheon with additional views of Montmartre/Sacre Coeur Basilica. Our room had a split bathroom with sink and tub/shower on one side and bathroom on the other. Worked well with getting ready each morning. The bathroom has a hair dryer but no outlet for flat iron or curler. Had to use outlet in bedroom area and propped up my mirror by the TV to use flat iron. We had twins pushed together but made separately and very comfortable. I have been to too many hotels with awful mattresses. Slept great each night. There were 2 chairs and a table, corner cabinet for fridge and TV. Amvoir for hanging clothes but no dresser but we just left our things in our suitcases. Also, it was nice to have a safe in the room. The room was decorated just as I had pictured a room in Paris. Very cute and reminded me of a very nice B & B. Walls were covered in cloth and had painted white beams on ceiling. Not large but great ambiance. Cleaned nicely everyday. Service was wonderful. From check in to check out. Jenna and Patrick were especially helpful each day and evening and speak several languages effortlessly. Somenone is always on duty 24/7. Please believe the "lift" instructions!. My granddaughter and I got on and another couple decided to test the weight limit I guess and guessed wrong.The 4 of us got stuck in the lift for about 15 min, which to a 63 yr old seemed quite long. It was fixed the next day. The lobby is very quaint and usually empty. They will serve you a drink ( for a fee of course) if you would like to relax there for awhile. That would be my one suggestion to the hotel, is to have complimentary Tea or Coffee in the lobby. Would be a nice touch. We did not take breakfast but the room was quite lovely with stone walls. We had made arrangements for our own shuttle to and from airport, but did notice they can do the same for you for 17 euros p/p. As everyone mentions, the location is wonderful in the Latin Quarter. Not so much hustle and bustle as closer to the attractions. But only a 15 min walk to the Seine and ND. Just several streets behind the hotel is a Square with narrow streets with several cafes, restuarants and ice cream spots. Very parisian. I believe are room average was about 200 euros a night, which is not cheap but nothing in Paris is. Would defintely recommend to friends and family and would ourselves stay again. If you want a little slice of Paris....... Hotel du Pantheon is the place for you! ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, good value and well located in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Pat23917
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Hotel du Pantheon in May 2011. Excellent value for the money in Paris. The front desk staff were all extremely helpful and all spoke fluent English. Emilie at the front desk was especially helpful and booked an excellent restaurant for our wedding anniversary and printed our boarding passes for our return trip to the US. The rooms are well decorated, very clean and adequate size for Paris. We prebooked a "classic" room which was an interior room but it was very quiet. We spent little time in the room so a view wasn't important. The hotel is well located in the Latin Quarter across from the Pantheon and the Sorbonne, and a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. Breakfast is extra at 13 euros per person but still a good value for Paris. We would highly recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: mdibden
Reviews.Content: the staff of this hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. The location is great. We faced an inner courtyard and so it was wonderfully quiet. the only down side was that the room was very small for two people. It would have been fine for one person but not for two. The rooms were clean and wam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very efficient and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DiMiTo
Reviews.Content: We got our room at a reduced rate of €169 a night, which didn't include breakfast (€13 extra each). The usual rate for the room was €280 which we wouldn't have paid. Unfortunately, everthing in Paris is very expensive (€7 - €9 for a pint of beer), so we were quite pleased to get such a good hotel at a reduced rate. Staff were very friendly and knowledgable, rooms clean and air-conditioned, although bed wasn't that comfortable. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room would have been good, though. Excellent location. Watch out for (presumably) would-be pick-pockets (men and women, young and old) pretending to find a gold ring on the pavement in front of you to distract you (especially near Notre Dame). We just ignored them and carried on.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great view of the Pantheon from our window”
Reviews.Author: Macclesfield_Comment
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with great view of the Pantheon from our window. Friendly staff and room very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGHC
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to stay in this area. Latin Quarter become my favorite place due to its super & genuine local cafe and restaurant, ethnic shop and student bookshop. The previous visit, we stayed at its sister hotel located beside this hotel. The similary among others are stunning Pantheon view and beautiful room. The different is quality of breakfast, which I believe this hotel has room for improvement, however the quality of staff was outstanding, Emily is charming and helpful. We definetely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for your Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: OATEK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel, facing the Pantheon in the 5th Arondissement. Access to RER B (a few stops from Gare du Nord and direct link to CDG ariport) and several metro stations nearby. Luxembourg garden down the road, the latin quarter for shopping and bistrots. Our second stay here, and hopefully more to follow.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: M4R1_11
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hotel du Pantheon. I wasn't that optimistic as when you travel with very young children you expect it being difficult. On the contrary, everything at the hotel was perfect even if it is not tailored for children. We had a triple room where the staff put 2 cots for my babies (which is a difficult compromise to reach in Paris)...although the room was in this way filled with beds, there was still plenty of room for the girls to play and for us to be comfortable. The view was stunning,6th floor exactly in front of the Pantheon. The staff was "super". You'd think we spent a fortune on this but we didn't as we had sort of a 2x1 nights fee (it was end of march).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well appointed, friendly, well situated and delightful in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: MargaretinLondon
Reviews.Content: My room was decorated in Provencal materials - and it was quaint but very comfortable. The bathroom was excellent: a lighted magnifying mirror (all girls love these), and a nice shower. The staff was friendly, and breakfast was excellent. I particularly liked the "do it yourself pancake/crepe maker". The location was superb, reasonably quiet and close to the Luxembourg Gardens and the buzz of St Germaine. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “As romantic as it could be”
Reviews.Author: Anita1952
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect! Metro was very near. Fantastic wiew from our room! Looking at the Panthéon and over the rooftops Sacré-Coeur in a distans. The room was very romantic with woodenbeams in the sealings. Wonderful breakfast, and very, very helpfull and friendly staff. We can really recommend this hotel for a romantic carefree stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownswekile
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow, wow... Amazing hotel. Its in a good location, a few minutes walk from RER B station (direct link to airports). Its directly opposite the Pantheon and University which is an added bonus. Check in was a breeze, the lady who helped me was pleasant and spoke very good English. She helped me with directions around the city as I needed to collect my Paris Pass in some appartment building close to the Eifel tower. I got a room with a view of the Pantheon (added bonus). The room deco is cozy and pretty if you like the grandma cottage kind of look. The room was clean, and serviced well daily. It was warm and the heating worked perfectly. I found the idea of a seperate toilet and bathroom interest but odd. What I loved the most was the fact that you don't pay extra to have your food brought to your room for you. Another surprise was the fact that you can make international calls from your room for next to nothing compared to other hotels. You pay for the cost of the calls, nothing extra. You need something like that when you've been out of touch with family for a long time. My only problem was that they didn't have a single English channel where I could catch up on the news. I went to enquire at reception about this and I did not get any help. I just lived with it, cause my experience other than this was good. All in all, would recommend this hotel to anyone. Its a comfortable hotel on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly pitched!”
Reviews.Author: fhbaker
Reviews.Content: I spent hours trying to find the right hotel, in the right location at the right price for our trip (partly a birthday present for my husband) to Paris this past weekend. Hotel Du Pantheon seemed to be a good choice so we went for it. We chose the variable rate on a room - I think it was the superior. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and warm, welcoming, and relaxed. I had emailed the hotel with some questions ahead of time and I always got a speedy and warm response. When we asked for help they were very quick to give us it. they were chatty and - well - lovely! It's a little Parisian hotel in a typical old Parisian building, so you have to expect that the stairs will be rickety and the lift a bit small and shaky. I don't consider this something to complain about. The room was immaculate - and very clean. No weird hotel smells or anything. It was always immaculately cleaned when we arrived back in the evening. The comments about the shower are well founded, but we just learned to stick an extra towels down - a small price to pay. I reckon that unless you pay top dollar for a hotel, you'll find a few things that aren't quite right - that's life! We had a corner room (room 53). The room had two floor to ceiling windows with french doors and the bathroom had one so you could step out on the balcony - and get plenty of fresh air in the room. One thing I would say is that I could hear other people in other rooms although it was faint. The windows shut out the street noise really well. We did not go for the 13 EU breakfast because we didn't want to pay 13 EU each for breakfast! I suppose I did feel that the room was a bit pricey for what it was to then have to pay for breakfast. I guess it was about location though and it suited our budget/plans this time round. Our favourite place for a normal 'French breakfast' (bread, croissant, jam and coffee) was Cafe Au Soufflot at the top of Rue Soufflot in front of the Pantheon - a short walk from the hotel. We walked a lot around Paris - it is definitely a walkable city if you are reasonably fit - but the metro and RER lines are a ten minute walk from the hotel so everything is very accessible. The hotel recommended Le Berthaut (Rue Vallete) for dinner as had friends of ours. It's a five minute walk from the hotel and it is indeed lovely. Across from it you'll find ZigZag bar which is lively and hoaching with students, but really great. We loved stopping there for a night cap! I loved staying at this little hotel - I felt very welcomed and at home by the staff and loved our little room. The area is fun and lively - doesn't get too touristy until you get closer down to Notre Dame. One piece of advice: check if anything is happening at the Pantheon while you are there. Our last day coincided with a high profile event which included President Sarkozy being there, so all the streets leading up to the hotel and the Pantheon were closed. We had quite a time trying to get through to get our bags (tagged and in the luggage room) so we could leave for our flight. The hotel had issued us with a document and told us to have our passports with us - that this would get us through the security to the hotel during the event, but the Secret Service and Police wouldn't let us until we begged a Policeman who had us escorted to the hotel!!! This resulted in a mad rush to get to our flight. It was bad luck as we arrived just as Sarkozy arrived. Also, this was NOT the hotel's fault - just bad luck with timing... and, if I am honest, it was an adventure and I consider that all part of the package of travelling! Loved this hotel and would return. Big thanks to the staff who were brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Bradlock
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our needs, and we got a great room rate by booking 3 months in advance. The standard room we had was pretty small, but not cramped by any means, and the bathroom was particularly nice (huge sink). The location, overlooking the majestic Pantheon (and 5 mins walk from the Jardins du Luxembourg), is pretty incredible - a landmark on your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent staff - wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: SWTH
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff is outstanding - very friendly, helpful and enjoy meeting everyone. (speak english) They read when I was arriving and were able to provide a room as soon as I got there about 1030a which was perfect so I could take a nap after the long flight. Can't say enough about the staff! Loved the location. The hotel is located directly across from the Pantheon so easy to find. It's near a train station that has a direct train from the CDG airport. It's also near a metro line. It's a about a 10 min walk to the river and Notre Dame. I felt safe walking around the Latin Quarter alone. And it was easy to get around. There are always people around since the university is just up the street. Good restaurants nearby. When you walk up the main road to the Pantheon - turn around and you can see the Eiffel Tower! It's a long walk away so take the metro. The Museum Pass is good value so you can get into many places and sometimes have shorter lines. You can buy them at museum desks - closed to hotel is Musee de Cluny. The Metro visitor pass was very helpful - got a 3 day pass for regions 1-3. Bought this at ticket counter at St Michael station. Had 4 days in Paris and loved it all! We'd pick up cheese and bread and have snacks in the lobby as they have wine available. Great way to spend the late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: CDG183461
Reviews.Content: The hotel overlooks Place du Pantheon, and is very centrally located to the Latin Quarter, and Notre Dame, just steps from Metro and RER stations. The staff was incredibly helpful, with suggestions for restaurants and the best ways to get around Paris. Rooms are small (by North American standards) but very clean and efficient. A very enjoyable stay, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeTraiteur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to beat in central Paris. It faces the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter, just five minutes walk from Notre Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens. Reception and other staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and were keen to speak fluent English, despite our willingness to speak French. Our room was fairly small but really comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was copious and perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouiseWlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a special birthday treat. The hotel is very tastefully decorated, and well situated. There is a metro station 100 metres away which links to Charles de Gaulle airport, and the journey takes about 45 minutes. Train fare is 8.70 euros, compared to a 70 euro taxi fare! Our room looked onto the Pantheon, and was very pretty. The bathroom was quite spacious, separate toilet, and the shower head was temperamental. I would suggest you take some coathangers, and your own hairdryer, despite there being one in the bathroom I found it rather slow and not very powerful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We chose to have breakfast out at one of the many cafes in the area and chose a French breakfast - good value at approximately 6 euros for a croissant, fresh tartine (lovely fresh bread with butter), fresh orange juice and a coffee or hot chocolate. There is a tiny Italian restaurant literally just round the back of the hotel. Considering the situation of the hotel it was very quiet. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is about a 20 minute walk to Notre Dame Cathedral and about 40 minutes walk from the Louvre. Quite a walk from the Eiffel Tower, but the metro trains are reliable and cheap to get around. Toward Notre Dame there is a lovely area with some great pavement cafes and bistros, as well as the obligatory touristy shops. All in all a good choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely quintessentially parisian hotel next to jardin luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: hannahhannah_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the area for 20 years and found this hotel excellent. I booked on a special price deal, and that made it great value for money. The rooms are small but well appointed, classic decor, comfortable beds, high windows. good shower - hot and plentiful water! Good breakfast in the atmospheric converted cellar. would stay again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very good”
Reviews.Author: Michael12309
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay with your hotel. The location was excellent and the staff was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, ideally located hotel with great service and great value”
Reviews.Author: efj222
Reviews.Content: This charming, well-located hotel is a very good value - fairly large room by Paris standards, modern bathroom, great breakfast, and found a great deal on the web. I highly recommend it. The staff was very helpful, providing maps, suggestions about places to go, etc. They speak excellent English as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Ray13_and_Jane10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel - it was clean although the room was small and a little bit expensive - but that's Paris unfortunately! The staff were excellent and very helpful. The location is excellent - right by the Patheon and about 15 minutes walk to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: JMR57
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting sights around Rive Gauche. Minutes from Luxembourg RER- only 30 minutes to CDG. Very helpful friendly staff. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, Quiet, great location and stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: JimmyPie
Reviews.Content: Really loved this place, handy location within walking distance of Notre Dame with the St-Germain quarter very close by (worth a stroll around). The area surrounding the hotel is quiet. The interior of the hotel is really stylish in a French country kind of manner. Really helpful staff too which makes a big difference on the quality of your stay. Completely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a truly lovely hotel and area, we were very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: mbmckenna1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quaint, quiet, very clean, and updated. The staff is friendly, helpful and bilingual. We chose the superior room and found it to be a very good size for two. The bathroom was well appointed with updated fixtures. The hotel offers breakfast which seemed nice though we did not take advantage of it . It was very easy to commute to and from Charles de Gaulle airport using the RER. Using public transit to explore Paris was simple from this location and it is only a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame. The hotel is located in a very nice area across from the Pantheon, and a few minutes walk to rue Mouffetard, which is a lovely street with fruit and cheese markets, crepes, shops and restaurants. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute joy”
Reviews.Author: Goldengirl123
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year old son for his first visit to Paris and we stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon, after reading favourable reviews on Trip Advisor. Got a great rate by doing an advance on-line booking. The hotel is gorgeous, really cute. its basically a very elegant town house, with the most amazing spiral staircase running through it. We were on the 5th floor and it was cool looking down the middle of the stair-well (easily amused!) The room was just gorgeous, beautifully decorated, rich sumptuous colours, cosy, spotlessly clean, plus small balcony overlooking the Pantheon. It was just stunning. We were only there for one night, but I will definitely return and recommend to others. We walked nearly everywhere. At the bottom of the street is the Jardin du luxembourg. Walk through the park and you arrive at Rue Bonaparte which is the start of St germain de Pres. Visit Pierre Herme on Rue Bonaparte, best macaroons in town. From here, walk straight down Rue Bonaparte and you will hit the river in about 5-10 mins (passing the magnificent church of Saint Sulpice on the way) and you'll then be opposite the Louvre. So you can walk easily to lots of great places. We jumped on Metro from here, although there is a Metro near the hotel, and a couple en route, if you don't fancy all that walking, so much cheaper than London! One more thing, there is a restaurant, le Comptoir du Pantheon, just by the hotel. We went on our arrival, as we'd missed lunch, it was about 3pm, we were starving and it was the first restaurant we hit, which can be a bad idea, but not this time. Go there. You would think it would be a tourist trap, but it is so not. Packed with Parisians, food out of this world, I had Duck with Sauteed potatoes, it was so delicious, my son had a burger, but it was a great burger. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Ueti
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a long weekend and had a really great time! This is a really nice hotel in a great location. Rooms have beautiful decor and are very well maintained. Hotel staff is very pleasant and was very helpful with giving recommendations and making arrangements. We will definitely be back! A bientot!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that has a great location”
Reviews.Author: Diver80
Reviews.Content: I would recommend satying here the staff as friendly and the hotel is clean, quiet and the rooms are a good size for Paris

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, well run hotel. Couple of minot negatives only...”
Reviews.Author: Adrian9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in room 64, which had a balcony (room 63 has one too). The balcony had a table and chairs and you could see as far as the Sacre Coeur. I would recommend asking for room 63 or 64. The room was decorated to a high standard and was immaculately clean. We paid 119 euros a night for Friday and Saturday and 102 euros for Sunday night. There no bar as such, but the receptionist serves drinks in the reception area. Negatives: The only English language channels are two news channels, there's no movie service. There was no ironing board or iron in the room, there is an iron available for use in a cuboard in reception, the ironing board is fixed to the wall. It's adequate but not ideal. Positive: The location really is excellent, it's two walk minutes to Luxembourg Metro and there are many excellent bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk. You could happily spend a weekend without moving more than a block. The windows were double glazed and it was very quiet at night. Sleep quality was excelllent. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AJAponte
Reviews.Content: For the second time, we have stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon - and we were very happy. We tend to choose 3 star hotels based on budget, and we like the smaller hotels. The location is quiet yet central. We like the superior rooms for the view. The rooms are very comfortable and decorated in charming french style and modern bathrooms. The staff is very friendly. In the evenings, we enjoy having a glass of wine in the small lobby before or after we have been out.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service - Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: wbloechle
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say I never got the chance to experience the Hotel du Pantheon. This review is in regards to their poor customer service. My husband and I were set to go to Paris for 10 days last October and were very excited. We were also looking forward to staying at this hotel since people have said so many wonderful things about it. Unfortunately we had to cancel our entire trip to France because his mother was diagnosed with breast cancer. She was going to watch our daughter during the trip but was required to start treatment right away. At the time of booking, they require you to pay in full for your hotel stay. They offer a 24 hour cancellation policy which was stated in their confirmation email. I am not disputing these terms. However, I was allowed to cancel my reservation through their web site and received confirmation via email of a credit. If you are not allowed to cancel a reservation, this hotel should not allow that option in their reservation system. Or at least they should provide a notice that the cancellation is not allowed. In this case, I received an email confirming my cancellation and credit so I assumed everything was fine. The hotel has said they will not provide a refund or even allow us to use the money for a future trip. So my advice to you is BUYER BEWARE. I was hoping that would make an exception due to the sad and unique circumstances of my cancellation. I believe it is unreasonable and unethical for a company including hotels to take 1,600 Euros (approx $2,000 US) without providing a service of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 4 Nights”
Reviews.Author: Pipr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our 18 month old daughter, had 4 nights at the Hotel du Pantheon as a short break. We were a bit apprehensive, although the reviews were great, but we had no reason to worry. We had a top floor room looking out to the Pantheon, which was lovely and quiet with a gorgeous view. There was a room for all of us (with our daughter's cot in the corner), and the decor was lovely. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and the location was fantastic - walking distance to lots of sights. We bought a ticket on the Batobus 'hop on hop off' Ferry, and the jetty where we had to board was only a short walk from the hotel. The only criticism I would make would be that the breakfast was overpriced. We had this one day when it rained - but there are plenty of cafes close by for better value food. All up a fabulous break and we have terrific memories of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: Nany2877
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Pantheon Hotel. This is a small hotel which has the private feeling of a hotel with a warm touch of a B&B. Is extremely clean, nicely decorated with a charming style. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. Our room was quiet and comfortable. It was more of what I expected for a 3 star hotel in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: ctwynne
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel ,we will be back again, staff coulde'nt do enough for you very pleasent indeed.Thank you for all your help . Mark and Anne

Reviews.Title: “Fab French flare”
Reviews.Author: EBR28
Reviews.Content: Great, quaint boutique hotel ! Our room was nice and clean, with a fab French flare! Loved the FREE WiFi and pleasant staff!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: DarcyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel having booked a special winter rate online. We were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who speedily checked us in and told us we had been upgraded to a superior room on the 4th floor. We took the tiny lift and found our room was overlooking the Pantheon at the front of the hotel. The room was a reasonable size with a very nice bathroom and separate loo plus a safety deposit box and a television and minibar enclosed in cupboards so that the Louis XVI style was not spoiled by modern facilities. The colourful fabrics and exposed ceiling beams added to the ambience which was so different from some other 3-star Paris hotels. The room was surprisingly quiet considering its location and the traffic which died down during the evening. A lot of thought had gone into providing a comfortable room and a very modern bathroom and efficient heating/airconditioning system. The only extra we asked for was a blanket which was brought to our room whilst we enjoyed dinner at the nearby restaurant Le Berthoud in rue Valette (recommended by the receptionist) which offered two courses for 17 euro and had a mix of local people as well as tourists. We had the buffet breakfast in the renovated cellar for 11 euro per person which was good value for money as it included a well-presented choice of hot drink, cereals, juice, fruit, yoghurt, bread, jams, pastries, cheese, ham and a pancake hotplate. We very much liked this friendly and charming hotel which is in a prime position within easy walking or travel distance of major attractions. It is an easy stroll down to Blvd Saint Germain and Notre-Dame. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: myholiday44
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at Hotel du Pantheon and it was very nice again. All of the staff, (especially Jenna) were welcoming, friendly and so helpful. We had 3 adults in the room with a double and a smaller bed (which was big enough for my adult son). We had a plenty spacious 6th floor room facing the Pantheon with a view of Sacre -Coeur. The room was very comfortable and clean with a large modern bathroom. The location is excellent, near Rue Mouffetard and tons of restaurants, and also walking distance to St Germaine area, and Notre Dame. We mainly used the Maubert-Mutualite metro stop, but Luxembourg RER is right around the corner to get to and from the airport. We had the staff arrange a shuttle for a trip back to the airport. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: JayHSanJose_CA_
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th stay at Hotel du Pantheon, and as always, it was a wonderful experience. We love the location, and the service is always terrific. Initially had a problem with our TV, and had to call the front desk. There was someone at our door within 2 minutes to have the problem corrected. Staff is always attentive and cordial

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with reasonable price and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: ohwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights in Paris recently and I have found a charming hotel in the 5th district in Paris. I have chosen the area mainly because it is closed to RER B, which is direct train to the airport. Also the Pantheon landmark makes it easier for the taxi drivers. The room is lovely and quaint, with nice wall papers and very clean toilet. I have stayed in other hotels in Paris and this hotel really exceeded my expectations. The room size is adequate and there are huge windows for my room. I had a comfortable stay throughout and never had any disruption from the staff or fellow guests as we all know that the buildings in Paris are not sound-proof. I would strongly recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: kjell_svensson
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and great location. Stayed there with my wife for a week during new year 2010-2011. Very romantic and quiet room with a nice view over Pantheon. Friendly and very nice staff. The breakfast buffe was allright, but not included in the rate, which seems a bit greedy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: JLB456
Reviews.Content: This place has it all, the location is superb, the service is impeccable and the rooms are perfectly French and gorgeous. The breakfast is lovely and you can even make your own small pancakes. We had a lovely stay here and would recommend it to everyone,

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: skd1305
Reviews.Content: This hotel was out of our budget and is on the expensive side but we got a very good deal last minute by pre paying for our room. Very nice and clean hotel located right next to the Pantheon. Not very well located metrowise. The closest is the RER Luxembourg which is also a bit of a walk. The main area where it is located is very commercial but we walked around a bit and stumbled upon Rue Mouffetard which is a non touristly quaint little street with tons of good restaurants, cheese shops, chocolate shops an creperies.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: reisarynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over Christmas this year and I must say the hotel is one of our favorite things we like about Paris. We actually moved from another hotel which fell far short of our expectations to Hotel du Pantheon, and we were not disappointed at all. The room is lovingly decorated and the bathroom (with a nice tub!) was spotlessly clean. One of the best hotels we have stayed in on this trip. Location-wise, the hotel is situated a short walk away from the metro station and its location just next to the Pantheon is breathtakingly beautiful. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris. Thank you for your wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quiet and attentive”
Reviews.Author: Mista_vee
Reviews.Content: This was an online pick that turned out to be just right. The location and staff, plus the quaintness of the hotel, made this an ideal place for me to stay. Rooms were simple and clean, plus the hotel was very quiet. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nasty receptionist spoilt lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: FranceMollyLyons
Reviews.Content: I had relatives staying here and was at the hotel everyday to chaperone and arrange hotels. On their first evening December 18 2010 they were met by a lovely girl who could not have been kinder or nicer. From then on until they left on December 21 there was a redhaired girl on reception who was deeply unfriendly and at times just plain rude. She seemed to go out of her way to be unpleasant and at one stage started to shout when we asked for a taxi for four people. The hotel was lovely and it was such a shame that she spoilt it and confirmed their impression that people in Paris are rude.

Reviews.Title: “For reasonable budget in Paris, surely a top one, amongst the best”
Reviews.Author: mauricio_costa
Reviews.Content: I have lived for years in Paris area for 3 years and I go for Business travel for more than 10 years. I have serious problems with allergies and therefore clearness is a must. My budget for hotels in Paris is on the range of € 100 to € 140 and this hotel is one of the three that I choose for my stays. If you can afford this price range do not think twice, this is real a pearl, full of charm. M. Costa

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel - charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: Hertshopeful
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay in this hotel and it was just as good as the first time. My husband and I travelled with my elderly mother in law and our two teenagers. We had stayed here in July and particularly requested the same room for my mother in law as she particularly enjoyed staying in it and it is always nice to go back to somewhere you know. The hotel is in an excellent location being close to the many restaurants around the Sorbonne (which tend to be cheaper as they are in the student area) and also close to many sites. The 84 bus stop is 20m from the hotel which goes across Paris to Concorde, Madeline and Haussman which also ticks all the boxes for shopping, site seeing and eating/drinking, We slept very well as the hotel has great sound insultation. The bathrooms are compact and don;t have natural light unless you get rooms with a 3 or 4 at the end ie 53 and 54 on the fifth floor. Rooms 0 - 3 have views over the Pantheon ie 50,51,52 and 53. All the rooms are well decorated with coordinated furnishings which are charming. The staff are very helpful and all speak good English. There is no bar or lounge area in the hotel although there are two tables with soft chairs around in the lobby, which we used to meet before venturing out, but this area is not the type of place where you would spend any time - so if you wanted to just chill in the hotel, you would have to do this in your room, We will definitely go back to this hotel and have and will continue to recommend it to our friends,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: smcnern
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was smaller and comfortable. Bathroom is a large with a bathtub. Room was a little dark. Wireless internet was sometimes slow in the room and was good in lobby. Breakfast was terrific. Location is good with lots of shops and restaurants that are close. Will stay here again and you will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TACRamsbottom
Reviews.Content: We booked the special winter rate at this hotel which was really good value, we opted for a room with a view which was well worth it. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: martin271055
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and friendly. The room was very comfortable and clean with a traditional Parisienne style and the bathroom was also clean and a good size. The rooms were quiet. The location next to the Pantheon on the left bank was close enough to the river. The area was quiet at night. Breakfast was plentiful and good value for money. We loved the spiral staircase and used it each day except when taking luggage up and down. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location- godd price/value”
Reviews.Author: Chamb0n
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights over the weekend. The location is fantastic, our room had a view on the pantheon which we didn't expect to have as we had booked the "normal" double room at a very fair rate (130€ in average/night) and rather expect it to be on the "backside". Staff was extremely helpful and nice upon arrival, and so during our whole stay. Room/bathroom was very clean. Can't say anything about breakfast as we preferred to have it in one of the cafés nearby. Our room was next to the elevator (actually the bathroom was next to it), which of course brings some annoyance late in the evening. But we were tired enough to fall to sleep rapidly! So we didn't bother much.

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another great stay at our favourite Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keith_mcintosh
Reviews.Content: Just a short 3 night stay this time and in a prematurely wintery cold Paris. Room as usual very comfortable and warm!! Service excellent, as we have come to expect, with staff very welcoming and attentive. Excellent breakfast. This was our fourth stay at Hotel Pantheon and we would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice quality, good value hotel in a superb Latin Quarter location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful staff, great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gavin1904
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully helpful staff at reception, room was cosy and very comfortable, lovely breakfast. Excellent location, close to RER for easy access from CDG and Metro a few minutes' walk. Represents great value for money-would highly recomment

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shirley048
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel du Pantheon was really quaint. The location was excellent and we could easily walk to the venues we wanted to see and public transport was also quite close.There were plenty of local restaurants which we enjoyed using in the evening.The staff were always very helpful with any enquiry. The only slight criticism that I had was that the cupboard where the luggage rack was I found it difficult to see the contents of my suitcase as I felt there was insufficient light in there. We liked the breakfast room and the staff were very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Traditioal Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patricia H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 4 or 5 occasions over as many years and keep coming back. We paid 468 euros for 2 people 4 nights classic room. The room was spotlessly clean with a loo separate from the bathroom. It had a view of the Pantheon and was very quiet. The staff on reception were as pleasant and effecient as ever and even did our on line check in for us a service not provided in many more expensive hotels. We find it particularly easy to access the airport as you can get the RER from GDG without changing trains and the hotel is straight up the hill. I think that the price we paid represented excellent value for the quality and comfort of this hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic French style in a vibrant and central location”
Reviews.Author: SydneySwans66
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel du Pantheon on the recommendation of two different friends in Australia, due to the location and its traditional French stule and character. We were grateful for the assistance of the staff, especially Jenna, who helped with bookings and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Paris . . . provided you've booked at a discount”
Reviews.Author: SnailspaceToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked an off-season rate directly off the hotel's own website that was actually cheaper than the usual suspects (Hotels.com, expedia, etc.). At 130 Euros, this was exceptionally good value for a Paris hotel. The posted room rate was 270 Euros, and that would have been excessive. For the money, you get a cozy (read: small) well furnished room with either a Place de Pantheon view or an inner courtyard view. The former is full or Parisian charm to the hilt (waking up to a view of the Pantheon dome in the sunlight is definitely a high point of any trip), but you'll have some street noise. The courtyard-facing rooms will afford and guarantee and uninterrupted night's sleep. The rooms, though small, are equipped with a mini-bar, a safe, flat-screen tv, and clock-radio/telephone. The bathrooms are spotless and proportionally large, and the showers feature both over-head and hand-held attachment. Water pressure was excellent and hot water was steady. Welcome was warm and efficient - we were checked in within 2 minutes and the desk staff all speak excellent english, though we conducted our transactions in french. An airport shuttle service is also offered at 17 euros/pp, though paying 16 euros to the desk staff in advance, and the remaining 18 euros to the driver means that when you hand him a 20 euro note at the airport, he is guaranteed 'not to have 2 euros' change. A rather sneaky manner to pocket an extra tip, though certainly not something the hotel controls. There are several boulangeries just a short walk away behind the hotel, so breakfast options abound. As well, you'll not be stuck for dinner options; walk in any direction and there are dozens of lovely restaurants - check reviews for the area. One that I can personally recommend is Perraudin, just a 2 minute walk away. Overall, a pleasant little Parisian hotel, close to much the Rive Gauche offers (Jardins du Luxembourg, Rue Saint-Germaine, etc.) but do try for a discounted rate, especially in the off seasons. Paying full rate for the room would just leave you jaded. Anything under 175 Euros for a room there is as good value in Paris as you're going to get for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StefaniaAR
Reviews.Content: I really liked it! Rooms are cosy and breakfast is delicious, you can even have it in your room without any extra charge!! Perfect Wi-Fi connection both in the room and in the lobby. The position is great and if you are lucky you have the Pantheon view! Very close to the tube with very nice restaurant around, one of the the Comptoir du Pantheon! I strongly suggest it! Stefania

Reviews.Title: “Adore this hotel ~”
Reviews.Author: TheInspiredTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times & each visit is more impressive. The staff is very accommodating, the decor is lovely & the location is perfect. It is close to the Luxembourg Gardens & the lively Paris left bank restaurants, markets & coffee houses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller027
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel du Pantheon from October 4 - 8th. The hotel staff were most friendly and helpful assisting us with questions about the area, helping with a unexpected piece business that came up and being completely understanding about our poor grasp of the french. Our room was very nice, having a window that looked out to the right hand side of the hotel to the street. The area is fairly quiet at night. The bathroom was quite spacious. We used the wi-fi and had no issues. We did not use the breakfast service, as there are a number of restaurants very close and a pasterie just behind the hotel. The Pantheon is right outside the door, Jardin du Luxembourg is within a short walk and Notre Dame was also a 15 - 20 min walk (for those able bodied). Our only problem was the shower temp control was too hot, so it had to be turned down to the minimum setting. Great neighbourhood, lots of students from U of Paris nearby.

Reviews.Title: “absolute bliss”
Reviews.Author: worshiguchi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Du Pantheon three times over the span of 15 years and have never been disappointed. The staff are wonderful, the hotel is ideally located, and the rooms are gorgeous. Our latest stay (Oct 29-3 Nov) demonstrated again that there is no better place to stay in the Latin Quarter. And if the hotel is full, their sister hotels look equally enticing, Grand Hommes is literally next door and Sorbonne is two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: gemmatt23
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get a better location, perfect for exploring but you don't feel like you're in a really touristy area. We were only there for one night but managed to walk most places and see most things. Staff were very helpful and freindly, rooms were small but perfectly formed - very clean and awesome shower! Great breakfasts. Lovely little wine bar in the street behind. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You're gonna meet some gentle people there”
Reviews.Author: CEMonteiro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, quiet, with nice rooms. Above all, it has a helpful and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest, friendliest Place we have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Loriette
Reviews.Content: A wonderful first stay which was made all the more special by how friendly and welcoming the reception staff are. Nothing was too much trouble. And it was immaculate. Only critism is that our room (number 10) whilst really lovely was next to the lift shaft so I was disturbed a little by the lift motor. Probably wouldn't happen if you are higher up or further along the corridor. The views, rooms and decor were all superb! Would not hesitate to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!! Warm and charming hotel and staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: publsiher43
Reviews.Content: What a perfect stay my husband and I had!!!! We were in paris for business and a bit of pleasure too. The hotel is charming. Decor very French and so nice. Super clean with nice size rooms! Good shower and large enough bathroom. Breakfast was included and fantastic served in a lovely breakfast room that I was sorry to leave when breakfast was over. Great coffee too!!! I can't say enough about the wonderful and very helpful staff!!! I would recomend this hotel to all!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific First Stay”
Reviews.Author: Goose54
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and as every first timer I did not expect much from a European hotel. Especially normally staying in upscale U.S. Hotels. The Hotel du Pantheon really put my perceptions to rest. It was above and beyond excellent I had a terrific stay the location, quietness, cleanliness and staff were above and beyond. We dealt with a number of front desk employees who greeted you and answered each and every question. The rooms are a nice size for two and have a great deal of charm . We had a room on the 5th floor with its own tiny balcony, from which we overlooked the Pantheon. I highly, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place with old-fashioned charm”
Reviews.Author: entian
Reviews.Content: left bank romantic set up just opposite the Pantheon and the law faculty. Close to the famous rue Mouffetard, the Mosque with the Hammam (a must), between the jardin des Plantes and the jardin du Luxembourg where everyone does their open air keep fit - from tai chi to jogging, painting and just ambling. Good foot wear recommended - I walked everywhere, even to the musee Jacquemart-Andre on the rue Haussmann. The hotel has an old rickety lift and a spiral staircase from top to bottom. Breakfast is ample and there are many bistros, restaurants, cafes just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, impeccably clean, fabulous safe location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: lucelou72
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend a stay at Hotel du Pantheon when next in Paris. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, Hotel du Panthéon was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lpestell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before and it was a no-brainer to book again for this trip. The highlight of our stay this time was the assistance and friendly service we received from the staff, particularly Emilie. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value for money, nice place”
Reviews.Author: aromans
Reviews.Content: i asked for the cheapest room in the hotel and was amazed to have a balcony with a killer view in the afternoon sun, wooden beams in the room, nice air, mini-bar, no hastle wifi, etc. great value for money in a town that can be very expensive for crap. I find the decor in the room to be slightly "grandma's underwear", but if you want Hotel Coste you should be prepared to pay for it. I was in town on business, but when I come to Paris I always make sure it is a memorable experience and the hotel was great. PS, I think it just fine to take a woman there. Andrew Romans

Reviews.Title: “Location and room size are the major plus points”
Reviews.Author: barneybear66
Reviews.Content: To keep some perspective on this hotel is difficult. I find myself easily getting caught up in the wave of enthusiasm from the other reviews - and our memories of Paris are always positive as it such a great city to visit. Plus we stayed here in August so paid a rate which was a bargain (ie. about £80 a night). So it would be easy to just agree with all the other enthusiastic comments and hit 'submit'. But what else is there to say? Yes, this hotel scores highly on location and the fact that the rooms are slightly bigger than the average (which for Paris is always welcome). But the side street is noisy, especially early in the morning, so bring your ear plugs; the shower will wet the floor so put down some towels, and the wifi may not reach your room so be prepared to sit on the staircase (amusingly my wife said it looked like I was on the naughty step for using my laptop on holiday). Overall, we will return when the price is right as the location is just too good to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vadraw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for a few days in August on our first non-business trip to Paris. We thought it was a delightful hotel in a wonderful location. I’ve attached some pictures from our Room – Number 31. Great base for exploring central Paris. We took the RER from the airport – short walk up the hill to the Pantheon and there you are! Very romantic hotel, friendly and accommodating staff and great location! We tried the breakfast one morning and believed it was very nice, convenient and good value. We definitely plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Always an absolute pleasure to stay in the Panthéon”
Reviews.Author: GrayandBron
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Hotel du Panthéon on numerous occasions over many years. Mathieu, Stephanie, Emilie, Will and all of the team at the hotel are simply superb. Their welcome is always warm and effusive and, despite personnel changes over the time that we have been going to the hotel, the service has been consistently of a very high standard indeed. The rooms are quite small but beautifully furnished with gorgeous fabrics and bed linen. The icing on the cake would be upgraded air conditioning so that windows could be closed at night during warmer months. The views of the Panthéon are fantastic. We would highly recommend this hotel for a warm and relaxing stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Greekwife10
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night in Paris for a 2 night stay with a friend. The hotel staff were waiting for us and had room ready immediately. They gave us a gift of some lovely little tapenades. The only negative at this point was that they did not offer to bring the luggage up to the room for us which would not bother me normally but we were v tired and had just got soaked in the walk from the RER to the hotel. The room was lovely - twin beds as we had asked for and v clean. The room was at the back of the hotel and although we did not have a view - it was v v quiet and no traffic noise. Bathroom v clean and great shower. We did not have Breakfast in the hotel but did have a look at the lovely Breakfast Room in the Basement. On the day of Check-out the female receptionist on duty was v obliging and helpful. My friend had forgotten her flight details for the flight home (we were going to different destinations) and she allowed us to use the computer in reception to confirm them and also to check in and print our Boarding Cards. She booked a taxi to the airport for us as the RER B line was undergoing some works that day and looked after our luggage for the day. The location of this hotel is excellent - v close to the RER B for CDG and close to several restaurants in the Latin Quarter. Would happily recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again if in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great view”
Reviews.Author: Ulysses01
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here and really enjoyed the hotel and nearby rests and pubs. We never made it up before the 10:30 breakfast time but you can pick from a plethora of places to eat right near by. The staff was more than accommodating. We got a room on the third floor overlooking the pantheon. We went with another couple and the informal bar turned out to be where we spent all of our down time. We weren't the only group to hang out there and it became a meeting place for a bunch of guests to routinely be in touch. Rooms were really clean quiete and comfortable. Great bar nearby is Wide Open Spaces or WAS. Had great singer on Monday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nancy_siesta_key
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel along with another couple and were very pleased. The hotel had a great location, we walked almost everywhere. The rooms were comfortable, and the people at the desk couldn't have been nicer. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon in paris”
Reviews.Author: keridea
Reviews.Content: perfect honeymoon, cosy hotel in a wonderful location. lovely staff and a gorgeous room and fantastic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: monkeyland
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and the great ratings are certainly justified. It is a small quiet hotel with just 64 rooms and sits right next to the magnificent Pantheon in the Latin Quarter. It is is in a perfect location to explore the rest of the city and is only a couple of minutes walk from the nearest Metro. Our room was quite small but perfectly adequate and very clean. The only thing missing was a kettle! We had a special deal which included breakfast which was very good. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small friendly and inviting hotel in a great location and we would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: happytotravel52
Reviews.Content: Great location!!!! Very cute Hotel right near Pantheon and Luxemburg park. Great vibe near the hotel,because of the young people of Sorbonne.Near Subway s lines and Good restaurants.We did not eat breakfast in the hotel( it was too expensive )So there are great places nearby.The staff was very nice and helpful.Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: emdio
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a different hotel, spent one night there and checked out as fast as we could! Someone recommended the Pantheon and we were delighted with it. The location is wonderful, the views great and the staff knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. They needed to move us to a different room for our last night and the transition was seamless. We packed our bags, left them in our old room and when we returned that evening they were in the new one. It was a bit pricey but the value is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaTraveler1950
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous location. A short walk to the RER and Metro lines. Two blocks from the beautfiul Luxembourgh Gardens for a stroll or sit in the sun. Good restaurants near by. The room we had was very small, but had a nice modern bath. All the things we needed were there. We went from laughing about the room size when we first entered the room to concluding it was a charming place to stay. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Would definitely do it again!”
Reviews.Author: adftravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in Paris and the staff was very helpful in storing our luggage and also calling around about an address we were having trouble looking up as well as making reservations for us for a show and giving great food recommendations. Only trouble we had was trying to intially find the hotel from the metro. We ended up getting somewhat lost with all of our luggage in tow. If you can get to the Pantheon...the hotel is right next door! The staff was very nice and helpful and our room was very clean, with a fairly large bed. Our two favorite places to eat both ended up being a half minute from the hotel. Only complaint (and likely more our fault than the hotel's) was that we didn't realize breakfast would be charged...and ended up being pretty expensive (13 euro each).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in a Wonderful City!”
Reviews.Author: ogieone
Reviews.Content: We took a quick sabatical to the City of Light for 4 nights with the purpose of discovering a city we had never been to. Since this was planned last-mintue between a couple of other planned vacations, we decided to make this a value-driven trip. What we got with this hotel was exactly that. The value we received for the money paid (especially with the Dollar doing much better against the Euro) was EXCELLENT! The hotel staff was courteous and helpful, breakfast was included and our room looked directly upon the Pantheon. The room was a tad small, but by European standards, the room was quite spacious. What more can one ask for? Our only slight complaint was that the elevator in the hotel did not give the impression of stability, forcing me to send my wife down with the luggage by herself while I walked down at checkout, but this is a minor issue at most. The hotel was located right near the Jardin du Luxemborg and not far from St. Germain. However, we could have asked for a better location since we didn't feel central to the sights we wanted to see, but that is not the fault of the hotel, and besides, we weren't that far away anyway. The relatively close location and the quality of the hotel itself mean that I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially to anyone looking to visit Paris at a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: BTMNSP
Reviews.Content: This is a great location - nice property. Clean and comfy. We didn't do the breakfast (so cannot comment on that aspect). The rooms have mini bar w/ wine opener - which is handy in Paris:) The bed was extremely comfy - and bath huge for Paris! We had an interior room - which was really quiet (but not much of a view). Fine for us because we were out and about most of the day anyway. Staff were really very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a great way to start in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sianah
Reviews.Content: WOW This really is as good as it sounded. I booked this using Trip Advisors reviews and was not disappointed! It really is fabulous and clean! The location is perfect for a great nights sleep as it is quiet but you wake up to this view of the Pantheon that is not exagerated. It really is fantastic! There is a laundry mat around the corner open til late which is handy and the best meal we had all trip was in a little 'family' French restuarant opposite the outback bar on the corner. I will have to see if I can get the name.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - but not "amazing" as some say”
Reviews.Author: stephso
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel du Pantheon was fine, but it was least luxurious of our hotels on a recent two week trip to Europe. The balcony view was great (facing the Pantheon) and we had no issues with noise. The size of our room was fine, not too small. Our disappointment was that this was the most expensive of all the hotels we stayed in. After extensive research, we chose to stay here, splurging slightly above our budget. Rather than finding a luxurious room, we found slightly dated decor and a less than luxurious bed. We were happy that we were able to check in upon arrival (around 10:30am), but suspect that some cleaning may have been rushed in the process. Check out the other hotels in this line - they might be a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Peter_and_Mia
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel and really enjoyed it. The hotel is quiet, clean and the staff was very friendly. They had a good price for in-room-breakfast that we can recommend. The location is also very nice, close to Luxenburg metro station where you can catch the train to/from CDG airport, and walking distance to the area around Notre Dame. Plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. On the minus side was a lose toilet seat and a bad shower head, but that wasn´t a big issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel excellent staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mcdrthom
Reviews.Content: The room was spotlessly clean and airy with a great view over the pantheon.The location is exceptional,the latin quarter,the metro and an easy trip to the airports.The staff were always pleasant and helpful.This was our second stay and will remain our preferred hotel in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Fosdick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Parthenon is a rare "best buy" in Paris hotels these days. We stayed there for 10 days and the price fluctuated almost daily, but the average cost, including breakfast delivered to our room, was $200. The service is very congenial and the place is clean, well-located and extremely clean and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ewismer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the beautiful Hotel du Pantheon. The staff was very accommodating, the good sized room and bath spotlessly clean, and the location the best in Paris. We loved the sites and restaurants in the Latin Quarter. From the beginning of our reservation to the actual trip, everything about the hotel was wonderful. We had a change in the number of our party (our daughter joined us at the last minute) and we were graciously given a roll away bed. We all loved the decor of the room, the view of the Pantheon from our window, the comfortable bed, the unique breakfast room (like a cave beneath the hotel), the luxury touches like the heated towel rack in the bathroom, and even the reasonable shuttle service from the hotel to the airport.
