The rate, using their internet site, was very competitive with other nice hotels. We have stayed at a number of hotels in Paris, including several 4 star hotels, and this is definitely the best. We will be returning in October, and will no longer stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dinnersaur
Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel in an excellent location. Booked it for a short break in Paris after a friend recommended it and I was not disappointed. Great attention to detail and wonderful service from the moment you step through the door. The bathroom was a good size and the room was clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Will definitely return on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: judithdrj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very pleasant, small and intimate, and overlooks the Pantheon and is near the Luxembourg Gardens. It was fun to look out our window and see young people gathering on the steps of the Pantheon, sometimes a little noisy at night but not a real problem. Our room was small yet adequate, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was pleasant and had good choices, either continental or a full breakfast. The staff was extremely helpful and willing to help tourists. For us, the price was right and we had arranged for a room about two months ahead. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Melmusic
Reviews.Content: We Picked this hotel from tripadvisor. Location was good to transport, attractions, cafes. lovely area of Paris. Our only downside was we were given a very small dark back room with no views and the bathroom window opened onto a ground floor courtyard used for meals. So If you don't plan on spending much time in your room it would be Ok. The staff were great and very helpful. I would stay again but request a room with windows that have a front view.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: SukiKunitz
Reviews.Content: Excellent property - pictures on websites were accurate. Room was tastefully decorated, bed very comfortable, location ideal. The elevator was extremely small, but we worked around it - and the stairs were always an option. The staff were helpful and friendly, and we had a generally great stay. Our daughters' were also quite happy with their room. The views from the windows of our bedrooms were beautiful. The standard double has a very small closet, but it was suitable for my husband and I. Our daughters had the superior room, which had two closets. The wi-fi was spotty at best, and there were few english language choices on tv, but we didn't come to Paris to watch tv. The breakfast was okay, nothing special, lots of better options a few minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: keith_mcintosh
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay and the quality of accommodation and service remains very high. The location is simply stunning - across the road from the Pantheon and at the top of Rue Soufflot with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. A superb base for exploring the Latin Quarter and close to restaurants and shops. The staff are very attentive and patient. We will be back next Spring!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliveCarson
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this charming hotel. The location is impressive with views of the Pantheon. I was upgraded on arrival to a beautiful room on the third floor with magnificent views of the square. The decoration is pretty and floral (although sufficient stripes too for male guests) and the room was a good size. A decent bathroom which was clean, although a little mould above the bath leant it a slightly musty smell. Othwerwise I would note that the room smelt gorgeous - they have some distinctive reed oils which pervade the entire place. Breakfast was fine with a range of cheeses, meats, cereal and so on and an exceptionally helpful member of staff. I would recommend this hotel for location, friendliness and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: clj91
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be ideally situated for all the major tourist attractions in Paris. The hotel itself was of the highest standard, the decor traditionally Parisian, which stands it out from the other modern day hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LynneB52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location overlooking the Pantheon. Although this is a tourist site we didn't find the location to be noisy or particularly busy as traffic is limited by a large pedestrian area. We got the room at a summer special rate which made it good value for the money. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and the room comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lee087
Reviews.Content: Chose a Superior room with a view. Glad we did, the room was beautiful and was situated on the 3rd floor at the corner of the hotel. It had dual aspect with a fantastic view of the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tmaxxx
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and stayed at the Hotel Du Pantheon. Hotel and staff were great. Good location in the Latin Quarter. Rooms well decorated with good A/C. Hope to be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Like being at home”
Reviews.Author: AnaPaulaB_Rio
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in an excellent location. Confortable rooms, well cleaned, silent and with two big windows. The ones with a view to the Pantheon are perfect. The bathrooms are big enough to have a bath. Nothing like a bath after one day walking around! The breakfast is delicious: orange juice, coffee, milk, tea, chocolate, yogurt, three different kinds of cereals, fresh pancakes, different kinds of bread, "croissants" and "pain au chocolat", cheeses, ham, honey and jellies. The staff is helpfull and nice. Quartier Latin is full of small restaurants and cafés offering menus at reasonable prices. There are subway and RER nearby this hotel. But if you enjoy walking, you can go easily to Jardin du Luxembourg, Saint Germain, Pont Neuf, Saint Chapelle, Notre Dame and Île de St Louis. Paris is a beautiful city with so much to do. At the end of the day the tourist use to be really tired. The Hotel du Pantheon is very cozy. It's a pleasure to stay there, like being at home!

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeccaDT
Reviews.Content: Good location. Comfortable, clean and polite and affordable. Air con so we could keep the windows closed. Good sound proofing so no problems sleeping. A very good option. The staff were not particularly helpful but not rude at all so no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: hotshowbag
Reviews.Content: Another trip advisor gem . We had room #1 next to reception , it was huge by Paris standards , bathroom was also huge with a very nice bath . Just the thing after a long day of walking and sightseeing . The staff were very very good with assistance . We didnt worry too much about price as we booked a bit late and wasnt much left but I still think the price was reasonable . It is a little far from the river but the walk was interesting with plenty to see . Restaurants nearby and the fantastic Pantheon outside the front door . Plenty to see in walking distance and the hop on bus is a couple minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarolynPod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, right across the road from the Pantheon, and right beside the Sorbonne. The room was small and chintzy, and the bed was too soft and on the old side, but everything was clean and safe. There is an elevator, but it is in rough shape -- I would not trust 2 people in it. The bathroom was nice. The lobby of the hotel is elegant. The breakfasts were quite good. For the most part the staff was friendly and helpful, but we did have one really terrible and rude clerk, who called a taxi half an hour early for us when we were checking out, then made us wait to check out, moved like molasses, yelled at the taxi driver, and all the while we were paying the taxi's running metre. But the three other clerks we dealt with at the hotel were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: em57373
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Pantheon is lovely, well located, and the staff was great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyDunlopez
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff were friendly and accomodating, and the room was clean and tidy with a good sized bathroom. Proper size bath too. I would definately recommend Hotel Du Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, lovely hotel in great location - the quintessential Parisian stay”
Reviews.Author: trvlrfromMA
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very cute, Parisian feel. Quiet, comfortable beds and great air conditioning. Would stay again! I stayed for four nights with my teenage daughter in July. We had a very small room (#25) which is to be expected in Europe with only an internal courtyard view which mainly consisted of the air conditioning unit and other buildings although a view downward showed the tiny courtyard patio of the hotel. However, we spent very little time in the room and I purposely selected not to pay for a room with a view. I knew from experience that we would spend the vast majority of our time in the city - especially in the summertime when it is light out till well past 9pm! The room was lovely with fabric covered walls in a quaint, french provincial style: colorful prints, white painted dollhouse sized furniture and lovely painted beams across the ceiling. My daughter loved the room and I am now fending off requests to remodel her bedroom at home to look just like this hotel room - fabric walls, furniture, beams and all! The bathroom was also small but very clean, modern and well appointed. Common to almost all European hotel rooms I've been in recently (which is many) is a small glass panel that only extends about 1/4 of the length of the tub to block water from the shower (no shower curtain or full glass door). This is a bit troublesome as water poured down the glass panel and underneath this panel and drenched our floor every time we used the shower. The poor maid must gather a lot of sopping wet towels from each room every morning. A nice touch though was the etching of the Pantheon on the glass panel. Be prepared for a tiny TV and I mean tiny - maybe 12 inch - smaller than my laptop screen. No modern flat panels here - but again - you don't come to Paris to stay in the room and watch TV. The hotel did have free wireless internet but it was an extremely slow connection but enough to check emails and verify a flight online - with some patience. Also the lift is claustrophobic (again common to hotels that are in original buildings in the heart of the city). The winding staircase is the best bet for reaching your room. We were only on the second floor so it was an easy climb for us but rooms on the 6th floor might be a bit of a workout! We did not avail ourselves of the breakfast - there are so many great cafes where a croissant and cappuccino is so much less that it just didn't seem to make sense to spend money on the hotel breakfast. we did venture down to view the breakfast room - it seemed like a great breakfast and nicely appointed - even rather bright for a little cave room. We found a cute little muffin place on Rue Soufflot that had delicious homemade muffins with fresh pressed orange juice - delicious! The best part of this hotel is it's location. It has fantastic views of the Pantheon and the Luxembourg gardens which are just down the street are stunning. We spent many an hour lounging there and people watching - get a sandwich from the vendor across the street and enjoy a little picnic here. There is discount shopping on Rue Saint-Jacques and you can walk easily to most major Parisian sites (Notre Dame is very close). The Latin quarter is lively and in the heart of Paris. The metro is steps away - we actually took the RER stop which is just down Rue Sofflot and to the left and connected from there to all other Metro lines quite easily and it was a breeze to find the hotel from the RER from Charles De Gaulle airport. I highly recommend searching out Cluny Square (stroll down Rue St. Jacques and when you hit the metro at Boulevard St. Germain cross the street and enter the quaint cobblestone walkway to a great pedestrian only area with souvenir shops and tons of restaurants with some great fixed price menus of appetizer, meal and dessert. Also wonderful was Rue Mouffetard. Here you will find a great mix of restaurants of various cuisines (Greek, Parisian, Japanese, Lebanese, etc) mixed with some very cute Boulangeries and shops. To summarize - a cute hotel with a real Parisian flair, a great location, a quiet night's rest (not easy to find in the heart of the city) and air conditioning that worked! I recommend this little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Esterace
Reviews.Content: One of the loveliest small hotels we've had in France. Cheerful, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Excellent facilities and amenities. Great location. Nice breakfast. Good air-conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holah
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights at this hotel at the end of a holiday in France. Unlike other hotels we have stayed in, the rooms actually look like they do on the website! Beautifully and individually decorated, our room had the promised Pantheon view (a fascinating site and well worth the 8e entry) and was really quiet. The location is excellent with most of the major sights within walking distance inc Notre Damme, Eiffel Tower, Musse D'Orsay and Louvre as well as the Eglise Sulpice where they filmed Da Vinci Code. It is also a great place for finding your own special "side-street" restaurant for dinner - and we found 2 greats ones, Perraudin and Le Vin qui Danse, both within a 5 min walk. This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in and would certainly want to stay here again if we return to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in charming and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: jsn_chiaro
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this hotel during a hot and humid early July 2010 at E134 per room per night excl breakfast, which I had booked on the internet about 6 months in advance. The hotel is situated in the square in front of the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter (5th arrondissement). It is a charming and stylish place. The rooms (I saw 4 altogether, numbers 10, 22, 34 and 64) are relatively large by Paris standards, quiet, beautifully appointed and well-airconditioned. Some have views of the Pantheon; others of the internal courtyard or adjacent street. The staff are extremely obliging and helpful. I mention in particular M Hicham who not only changed but upgraded my room at no extra cost when I found that the shower didn't function properly. The area around the hotel is very lively, and I would recommend that one spends less time in the Rue Soufflot in preference to the smaller and more interesting streets at the back and around the sides of the Pantheon, especially those leading to the Rue Monge which are less touristed. Lovely restaurants and cafes in the area in addition to the most charming Luxembourg Gardens. Breakfasts freely available outside the hotel if you wish. The closest metro is Cardinal Lemoine, and the RER station, Luxembourg (with trains direct to both Orly and C de Gaul airports) is also nearby. The best news is that Parisians seem now finally to have conceded that they are also members of the human race after all; a very kind man in a bar spontaneously offered to assist me with my map; English is no longer frowned upon, and even a pathetic effort at speaking some French will attract not entirely cynical smiles. This hotel presents a worthy challenge to those in the Marais (eg the Duo, the Beaumarchais, the St Merry and the de la Bretonnaire), where I have usually stayed in the past, to get their act together .... Just one very minor quibble: the hotel recommends and arranges the "Nice Shuttle Service" which we took for the return trip in preference to shlepping luggage to the RER station. Be clear and adhere to the terms of payment as agreed. The driver (not employed by the hotel as far as I know) is a rather graceless man who claimed that we had agreed to E34 when in fact it was E17. I was quite happy in the end to pay E34, and did so, but that was not the arrangement as per the hotel desk. This criticism should certainly not affect your opinion of the hotel at all. It was excellent in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable, classy hotel in a lovley area”
Reviews.Author: lovestoexplore50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 5 nights. We had been to Paris 3 times previously and always stayed in the St. Germain des Pres area. Our former hotel recently did a major renovation, and their rates went up dramatically in price, so we searched anew. The Hotel du Pantheon was recommended by a friend and it exceeded our expectations. We had a very lovely room on the 6th floor with a balcony, and large bathroom. The French Provincial decor is warm and stylish. We enjoyed the breakfast ( at an extra charge) 3 mornings. The breakfast is generous in its choices and delicious. From the minute we entered the hotel we were met by courteous, helpful staff. Additionally we enjoyed the hotels location, and its convenience by walking to cafes,shops, internet places, and restaurants. The Metro is also 10 min from the hotel. We will certainly stay at the Hotel du Pantheon on our next trip to Paris. One piece of advice. If the hotel arranges a cab for you, you will be charged from the minute the cab gets the call to come pick you up until you arrive at your destination. We learned this the hard way when a cab took us to the train station, and when we got into the cab, we already owed 8 euros. So, keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: NickTobs
Reviews.Content: The location is great - this part of the city has character and is a great base for the evenings. There is a better choice of good restaurants in this left bank sector and it is nice to stroll around in the evenings. You can still get to all the attractions via RER, bus or walking (30 mins to Louvre, 20 to Notre Dame. Lovely view of Pantheon. We didn't take breakfast, there are loads of local choices where you can sit out. The only minor problem was a lot of shouting from the square on the Friday night - the windows are well insulated but I am a light sleeper (went on 'till 4am) - not sure if this was unusual as it was ok on saturday night and there are no other reports here of problems. The staff were very helpful and pleasant - overall an excellent choice, best yet in many Paris trips.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but it is Paris ! Veryclean...”
Reviews.Author: Ozejim
Reviews.Content: Small room, but it is Paris ! Veryclean and good views of pantheon from our window. Good locaton although a fair walk up Jill from either the metro or the rer.

Reviews.Title: “A Lucky Selection for a First Time Visitor to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Orion14
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris on business and had no recommendation or assistance from my French client regarding a lodging choice except that they said: "Stay somewhere in the City". After spending about an hour checking hotels on Travelocity and Expedia, I found several positive reviews for this hotel. The price range was in the moderate range and the hotel offered several reduced cost lodging alternatives - one of which I used. My room was small, not particularly well lighted, but comfortable. The air conditioning actually worked. The mini bar was a standard dorm-style refrigerator so it was possible to keep additional cold drinks inside, if desired. Breakfast was typical of French tradition and quite sufficient. Most importantly, the staff were very pleasant, helpful and good English speakers. The biggest negative for me was the inconsistency of wireless Internet - it varied room-to-room and floor-to-floor. As far as location, the hotel is within short walking distance of the Pantheon (just outside), Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame. It is also close to an RER station, so travel almost anywhere in the city is quite easy. There are also plenty of shops and cafes close by. One interesting surprise was that it was possible to see the top 2/3 of the Eiffel Tower from the front entrance to the Pantheon, so it was nice to take a stroll across the street and watch it sparkling in the middle of the Parisian skyline at night.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fashionista_08
Reviews.Content: A few of us stayed at Hotel du Pantheon in May 2010, when we were in Paris on a girls' trip. I am an avid traveler and I travel often for both work and pleasure - I don't think I have ever had such an amazing experience. I should start by emphasizing what a picky traveler I am...any and every detail never goes unnoticed: location, cleanliness, decor, staff, service, neighborhood (safety), etc. First we got a complimentary upgrade upon check-in, without even asking - we stayed in room 61. Top floor, amazing view, charming decor (all pink which us girls loved). The hotel location is central and perfect for a traveler seeking a somewhat of a local experience...right next door to the beautiful Pantheon and in a neighborhood full of academics. Much like elsewhere in Paris, a great number of cafés surrounds the hotel. Metro station is steps away, although we walked everyday to the Louvre and other historic sites. A very safe neighborhood - we felt comfortable even walking back to the hotel late in the evening. All in all, a superb boutique hotel, very good value and an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: reiziger_1963
Reviews.Content: Very polite and helpfull staff. Beautiful room with a divine view. Very quiet situated although you are in the middle of St.Germain and walking distance of Jardin Luxembourg. High standard hotel with a very serene atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: tannoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an ideal location, near the Pantheon and handy for the RER to the airport. Our room was recently decorated and a good size with a well-appointed bathroom and although it was on the ground floor, very quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was excellent with a good choice, even for someone who is Coeliac like me and requires gluten-free food. There are plenty of good restaurants within easy walking distance and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Bill.Nes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights,very quiet location at night.Plenty of choice for dinner and well priced,all within walking distance.Excellent location for the Metro to explore Paris and to and from the airport.No problems in recommending this hotel to anyone.Very clean and very French.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: funkrye
Reviews.Content: Good size bedroom and bathroom if a little old and tired. - the safe didn't work and the sink in the bathroom didnt clear. Night staff unhelpful and had a noisy reception. Best thing about this hotel is its location. Straight off the main line rer when arriving from the airport. Surrounding area is quiet but has lots of nice restuarants and the pantheon is right on the doorstep. Lots of major attractions within walking distance. View of the sun setting past the effiel tower from infront of the pantheon is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Solo Traveler”
Reviews.Author: MagsRDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel as a solo traveler. Had lovely single room on 6th floor, with balcony and great views over Paris. Not large, but for single room in Paris had all requirements. Very clean, with fresh towels & bed linen each day. Quiet at night. Excellent & helpful staff. Got train in from the airport & a short walked up from the Luxembourg stop. An easy hotel to find, as it is facing the Pantheon. It is a great area for cafes & restaurants, all within a safe walking distance. Would definitely stay there again. Mags R.

Reviews.Title: “It deserves my first Tripadvisor review”
Reviews.Author: Lara8800
Reviews.Content: I have been using tripadvisor for years to check where to stay but this time I will write a review as this hotel really deserved it. We stayed at the Hotel Du Pantheon for one night at the end of May, persuaded by the Tripadvisor's review. We had room no. 62 at the top floor and from the bed we could see the Mont Martre and the Pantheon. From the main square you have direct view to Tour Eiffel. Something to try at sunset...unbelievably romantic. Lovely designed rooms and very helpful front desk service. For breakfast we had freshly squeezed orange juice and we could make your own crepes. Overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite”
Reviews.Author: aajk
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. I have stayed all over paris over the years but found that staying by the Pantheon - in such a peaceful place, lovely in all ways, was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Paris, Mother/ daughter get-away”
Reviews.Author: GLANNEY
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Very, very clean hotel in a quiet area. Neighborhood felt extremely safe and in addition hotel has 24 hour desk coverage. Just steps from many cafes, shops and restaurants - had most meals near hotel. Taxi stand across from Luxembourg Park at bottom of Sofflot or hotel will call for taxi pickup. The hotel will order a van when leaving for the airport, which was low cost and ontime. We got one of their special bargain rates by paying in advance on their website, Wifi could be better. Had trouble most of the time getting a good signal. Got e-mails off OK, but very poor reception. They need to upgrade their service. Beautiful hotel overall, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back”
Reviews.Author: RedExile
Reviews.Content: I don't really do long bits of prose but this is what you'll need to know: - We booked two rooms - one single and one for a couple with three year old - Both rooms were spacious by Paris standards - Our room had a main room with a double bed (really two single mattresses but in a way that "worked" (if that makes sense!) and room for a small single bed for the little one, a separate toilet and a bathroom with a decent shower in the bath - Child bed was a proper (small - but that's what we asked for) bed not a camp bed as we've had elsewhere - Shower was a good one - a proper head of water with temperature control that worked - decent towels if a little small (but isn't that always the case?) - Hotel has six floors with four rooms on each - We read of other hotels where guests were kept awake by functions being held on the floor below - we saw no sign of any function rooms here - its really too small - There is a bar on the ground floor but its really a few fancy sofas near the checkin desk and the staff bring you drinks - nice and casual - Rooms nicely decorated and all in good condition - Staff friendly and helpful - Hotel is within easy walk of the Luxembourg metro and a short stroll to Notre Dame - A few nice non pretentious restaurants within 100m with lots of locals. Much better than the better looking but disappointing restaurants near the river - Not relevant to this hotel but went to EuroDisney, paid for two days but never used the second one - avoid it like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sarenebyrne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days. The staff is very helpful especially Emilie at the desk who helped us with cabs and advice. Our room #15 was very pretty and quiet. The hotel is near transportation, schools, cafes and the beautiful Luxenborg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ponponette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel du panthéon with my husband and liked it very much; the rooms, although quite small, were clean and nicely decorated, also very quiet. For the same price, 13 €, you can have your breakfast in bed! there is also free wi fi available. It is a great location, in a very charming area, le quartier latin. I would definetely recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romatique pure”
Reviews.Author: kajras
Reviews.Content: and great staff to - i loved this place - nothing to claim about - i will be back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable venue in a good location, with good value, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ThreeSeven47
Reviews.Content: Well situated a short walk from the Luxemborg RER station in the university district, surrounded by a host of places to eat. We stayed in a "Superior Room" on the 5th floor overlooking the Pantheon which was nicely refurbished with a good bathroom with shower over bath and seperate toilet. The bedroom was small by our standards but most adequate with suffiecient storage and a comfortable QS bed. Other amneities included TV, safe, airconditioner, and bar fridge with the usual extremely high prices for items. The little supermarket around the corner solves that problem. Being a light sleeper the thing I appreciated most was the dual glazing and no noise at night. For those who enjoy a walk, the Seine and Notre Dame Cathedral are a just a pleasant stroll up the Rue St Jacques Along the way are a host of 2nd hand book shops and stalls with vinyl records for the collector. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute & sweet kind of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaroseHongKong
Reviews.Content: The room is very cute and sweet at very quiet location! Only the internet was out of service for two days....makes me feel so disconnected!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Every Time”
Reviews.Author: MAWander
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the lovely, small hotel (or its sister Hotel des Grands Hommes next door) for the past 8 years or so but, for some reason, have never posted a review; perhaps it's because I want to keep the hotel for myself? In any case, I spent 5 nights in March and another night just two days ago and love this hotel so much. Many of the other reviews highlight the plusses and 'not so plusses,' and I will briefly do the same. First off, fantastic location. Close to everything I want and like in Paris, accessible to Metro and RER, great restos and cafes in the neighborhood, just great. Desk staff is consistently friendly and helpful. This year, Emilie, Carine and Christophe were at the desk and couldn't have been more polite, professional and kind. The food service staff that brought hot water for tea in the AM, and the cleaning ladies were also friendly and cheerful. This kind of service goes a long way and makes you feel happy to be staying at the hotel. Rooms are lovely, cosy, spotlessly clean and very well maintained. The Pantheon view rooms are, for me, perfect; you feel quite special to have such grand views just out the windows. If you have a lot of luggage, space might be tight. To me, however, this is charming and, as a single traveler, doesn't really bother me. The building is an older one; as such, you understand that the elevator is small, the rooms can be small, and there may be small noises traveling between walls. Again, to me, this is part and parcel of staying in a smaller, older hotel. I would add that over the years, updates and renovations have been made to keep things fresh and up-to-date. Suggestions? I did notice that the mattress in my room the other night was a bit soft; of course, every mattress is different, and I did not notice this at all in the room I had for 5 nights in March. I cannot think of anything else, actually - and suppose this is why I love this hotel so much. If you're looking for a well-located, small, charming hotel that's spotlessly clean and staffed by friendly and helpful people, this is the hotel for you. Picture attached is of Room 41, a superior room facing the Place du Panthéon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Character!”
Reviews.Author: meg51577
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I frequently travel to Paris and the Hotel Du Pantheon has become the hotel where we always stay. Before we discovered it we had problems in other hotels with bed bugs plus several other issues. Hotel du Pantheon is so comfortable and charming, it is very clean and the breakfast is very good. The staff members speak very good English. It is centrally located so it is right near many museums and other sights. The train station is nearby and there were lots of good restaurants in the area, which I was thankful for after a long day of working! I am looking forward to my next stay this fall!

Reviews.Title: “lovely, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ameliav
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this lovely hotel. The location is great for sightseeing, walking and public transportation and a few steps form Luxemburg Garden. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The hotel has a great deal of charm with many amenities including wonderful views, very clean rooms and a comfortable lobby. This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inger_7
Reviews.Content: Would like to recommend this charming hotel i latin quarter . Small , cosy with exelent location in one of our favorite parts of Paris. We stayed in a superior room with view of Pantheon from the window . Very nice and also very calm . No distrubing sounds. If you lika a small, countylike hotel instead of big ones with a lot of facilities ( that we usually never use ) this could really be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Charming in every way.”
Reviews.Author: NyRube
Reviews.Content: When two life-long friends decide to leave everyone else home and finally take their trip to Paris... this is the hotel, and the area, for you! The hotel was clean, elegant and full of charm. Every view was magnificent, the help was friendly, extremely helpful, and very accommodating. The rooms are all beautiful and very comfortable. This hotel is located in an absolutely perfect area, the Latin Quarter, with lots to see, great and affordable restaurants on the next street behind the hotel, and walking distance to famed Rue Mouffetard. Great cafes on your way to the 1 block walk to the metro. And you can reach out of your window and basically touch the beautiful Pantheon. Tell Karin and the staff that the girls from NY say hi!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well priced for Paris, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Reisgids
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well run, clean, quiet, the decor is old style, fitting to Paris; staff friendly and helpful, rooms clean, free wireless internet which any self respecting hotel should offer. The price is in line with this category of hotel in Paris, not overpriced Located opposite to the Pantheon, the hotel is is in walking distance of most of the main attractions of Paris, and the restaurants and night life of the latin Quarter make it an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Keithy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel du Pantheon for 4 days. It is very centrally placed, about 1 km from the river. Plenty of bars and restaurants near by and the area has a nice feel being close to the Sorbonne. About 1/2 km from the nearest metro station with a direct link to Gare du Nord. A good base for getting around the city. If you don't mind walking many of the sights of Paris are reasonably close by. Room was on the ground floor and on a quiet side street though this did not cause any noise problems for us. Room was clean and spacious though the heating was not great. Breakfast served in the cellar was nice with plenty of choice. One other resident was allowed to bring a couple of dogs down into the breakfast room. Whilst they were impeccably behaved this was a bit off putting. There were only about 6 tables though and I could imagine that if the hotel were busier there may be times where you would need to queue for breakfast The hotel has a comfortable reception area with windows out onto the Pantheon Square. We did sit there one afternoon having returned early from our sightseeing and it was a bit cold, but then it was February. I have no experience of other Paris hotels so I don't know how it compares at all. It certainly did nothing to offend and the price via Expedia seemed reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Styranki
Reviews.Content: With my experience of Paris hotel selection, this hotel belongs to one of the best. Ideally located at historical square of Pantheon you will be able to enjoy unique view of Pantheon mausoleum and its environ. The rooms are very neat and even you can feel and see the history you don't need to smell it. Wallpapers, furniture and bathroom are well maintained and clean. Staff is very polite and discrete.

Reviews.Title: “A very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Gurnee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent eight days in this lovely hotel at the beginning of December. It is located right next to the Panthéon. The closest metro stations are Luxembourg (RER) or, on a different line, Maubert Mutualité. Both stations are within a five- to ten-minute walk from the hotel. The area feels safe and is never deserted, no matter what time of night or day. There are a number of little restaurants nearby, many of them frequented by Sorbonne students. Rue Mouffetard is really close as well, and another good place to find numerous restaurants (some better than others) and little shops. Hôtel du Panthéon is adjacent to another hotel (Hôtel des Grands Hommes), owned by the same group of hotels.The area is calm, and our room was extremely peaceful. We had asked for a quiet room, and our wish was granted. Our room, number 64, had a view of a little courtyard on one side and of a little street that runs along the side of the hotel on the other. This was actually a wonderful feature and I should elaborate: When we arrived in our room, we saw the nice bed, the warm decor, and a little armoire that was adequately sized to hold enough clothes for a period of 8 days for 2 people. We were not expecting a huge room, since this is Paris, and it was not a huge room, but it was just fine. It was cozy and lovely, and very comfortable. From the window in the bedroom, we could see roof tops, a little courtyard, and even part of the dome of the Panthéon. There was a safe in the room, and a TV that had a built-in alarm clock which we did not discover immediately. A door in the bedroom led to a pretty spacious bathroom, rather elegant, that was equipped with a large sink, a tub with shower (not the kind in which you have to kneel in the tub and “hose” yourself! The tub actually had three knobs: one to use the shower head attached to the wall, one to use the “hose” if so desired, and one to fill the tub), and a toilet. The other amenities were a hairdryer and a towel warmer. The toiletries were nice and the towels fluffy. At the end of the bathroom was a large window that amost reached the floor. When we opened it, we were delighted to discover a small balcony with plants, geraniums in bloom, and a little round table with two chairs. From there, we could see the Sacré Coeur. It was lovely, and although we did not use it as we could have, had we stayed in this hotel in the warmer season, we still liked opening it every morning to enjoy the fresh air and the lovely view. Our room and bathroom were impeccably clean. The sheets were not changed every day, but probably every other day. Some evenings we found candy on our bed, other nights, we did not. Some days, our toiletries were replenished, other days, they were not. It did not really matter. What mattered was that the room was clean and pleasant, the bed comfortable, the hotel pretty and convenient, and the employees friendly and helpful. It is nice to see a friendly smile in the morning, and it never failed when we walked by the front desk. One of the gentlemen at the front desk reserved a shuttle for our trip back to the airport, and that worked out very well. The driver was on time, and we arrived in Charles de Gaulle in less than an hour, despite three stops to pick up other customers. If you decide to use the shuttle, make sure you reserve a few days in advance. I cannot comment on breakfast, as my husband and I decided to make other arrangements. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel. Next time we come to Paris, I fully intend to stay there again. If anyone working for the hotel is reading this, I thank you for making our stay (a late 50th birthday celebration) very pleasant. This is a well-run hotel with friendly and qualified employees. It was a delight to stay with you!

Reviews.Title: “No regrets, a nice, well maintained hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Dan_from_LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Christmas 2009 for 6 nights. We were very happy with the hotel. We heard so many stories of Parisian hotels that cost more but very rundown with dirty rooms. As we see it, this was the classic Parisian hotel, expect small rooms and elevator by American standards due to the dimensions of these original traditional Parisian buildings. The rooms are in good shape with modern remodeling of the structure (ie plumbing, thermostat, windows) though furniture is simple. Our room was very quiet. Never heard a neighbor or creaky floor and double glazing kept outside noise out. Staff was very friendly and spoke English (not necessary, but nice to have). They will quickly recognize you if you stay a few nights. They are customer oriented in a way I did not expect in Paris. Eating well is not a problem. A ridiculous selection of independent restaurants are 5 min walk to the east on Rue Descartes. More conventional cafes to the west towards the RER Luxembourg station. If you have the option, don't include the breakfast, but get it the days you want it. It is worth the price (13 euro) compared to eating at cafes. It is simple but fresh, and you self serve, getting just the food you want. However, some mornings you will be moving fast to beat the lines at some tourist site, so you will miss breakfast. As a side note, the neighboring hotel, "Hotel Gran Homme", is the same management. In short, easily a place I would stay again, especially for the price we got. Price matters, but assuming prices change with the season everywhere, I don't think you will find many places better, and lots of places that are worse for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NoLeakHere
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in agood location, about 10 mins from the Luxembourg RER station which make the trip from the airport easy. Cost for two of us was E17. The hotel do offer a shuttle service to the airport which costs E17 per person and takes about 1 hour. We stayed over the new year for 5 nights which means we saw the abismal celebrations in Pariswhich consisted twinkling lights on the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was very comfortable with a nice big bed and decent bathroom. Our room was on the ground floor and was very peaceful with no noise from the street. What the room did lack was coffee making facilities and english tv. At the start of the trip we had one channel, BBC world, then we had two days with no english tv, and then, one new years eve, CNN came to life giving us a channel once again. Most of the other 24 channel were french which is fine if you speak the lingo. Breakfast was included, which was just as well as I wouldn't have paid a supplement for it. Usual selection of bread, cheese and processed meat with one slow toaster for all the guests to use. Overall, I think it was okay for the price, provided you want a room only sort of hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: thewayIseeit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights Dec. 14-16 and had a superior view room. It was superior to any and all ideas I had. We had a corner room (43) with the best view we could ask for. Everything was great! I recommend this hotel to couples or mother daughter trips! Very elegant for the right price. I would not be surprised if they become a 4 star in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: AroldoSilva
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed for 9 nights in August/09. We chose this hotel based on another reviews from other Tripadvisor members, and they not disappointed me. The hotel has a good value for price. What is remarkable: 1 - The staff is lovely and very helpful; 2 - The atmosphere is romantic, a good choice for couples in a romantic trip, but could be enjoyed for families too. Also, the breakfast room is remarkable; this location is under the ground (but with good ventilation, very comfortable), in a medieval style. I found very interesting! 3 - The location is perfect! in a quiet place, near from metro and Jardin du Luxembourg, plenty of restaurants and other stuff nearby, also near from Quartier Latin's nightlife (but not so near to hear the noise); 4 - They offer high speed Wi-Fi Internet. In fact, sometimes we experienced some slowdowns, but in average, the connection speed was ok for the basics (e.g., accessing e-mails, browsing pages). Trully, this hotel is really a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in December 2009. The lady at reception was the friendliest and warmest French person we ever met! (some French staff can be very cold and brusque, particularly if you speak English). She was the honourable exception. Her English was excellent and she immediately made us feel at home. We booked 'superior' room which means, I think, a room at the front of the hotel looking directly onto the Pantheon. I think the non superior rooms look onto a quiet sidestreet. That’s just my guess. Luxembourg Metro station is only about a 10 minute (albeit up hill) walk, and the RER B takes you directly from CDG Airport in about 30 mins. The room was nice but small, but all hotel rooms in Paris are small. We have stayed in smaller rooms than this, e.g. Hotel Cluny Sorbonne which is nearby. It was perfectly adequate for us. We had a magnificent view from our window..out onto the Pantheon and beyond that we could also see over the roof tops, Sacre Coeur church. At night it was a stunning view. The bathroom and toilet were very clean, but the flow from the shower was more of a dribble than a flow. However we were on the 6th floor so the pressure may be better lower down. But the flow (as my wife pointed out) was more then enough to wash what's left of my receding hair. There was also a hand held telephone shower unit which appeared to have much better pressure. Traffic noise, even though fronting onto the road was barely discernable. But maybe on a lower floor it may be a bit louder? Someone pointed out paper thin walls and hearing people talking in next room. Every hotel I stayed in Paris is like that. Most (in the older centre Paris area) are converted from a prior domestic or commercial use and a lot of walls are partition walls. That's the nature of these types of old hotels in Paris. However we slept soundly each night. If you are a light sleeper (as I am) bring your earplugs with you, and you won't hear a thing. Overall the hotel and the surrounding area was extremely quiet, which we like. It has a very limited public sitting area on the ground floor and no bar as such. You can order a drink at reception, and they will whistle one up for you from somewhere! So there are no large public sitting areas or in house bar, if you are looking for that type of thing. However there is a lovely local bar/restaurant behind the hotel which was very pleasant to sit in and have a drink or tea/coffee. Out the front door, turn left..up to junction and left again..just after the Pizza joint. This bar seemed to be heavily populated by locals, which is always a good sign. But it tends to close up ship shortly after 10.00 pm. Obviously believers in early to bed and all that. Overall I can highly recommend this hotel to people who want a good location, friendly staff, and a great view (superior room) and who are not looking for a large lobby area, with sofas, bar etc. We are already planning on returning in May. We WILL stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marjando
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect place to stay during a trip in Paris! We were here for the second time. Both stays were very good. The rooms are very pleasant and romantic redecorated with all the flowers. They are renovated in the old style of Paris. Location, near the Panteon is very good. You can walk to the Seine and the centre of Paris. Metrostations are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Morelos
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a lovely room with an amazing view of the Pantheon. At night I heard no street noise, the bed was very comfortable and the room charming. The staff at the front desk were helpful and gave suggestions of good places to eat in the area. The location was fantastic, with great food shops only minutes away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: cagey_a
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose this hotel based on reviews here, and they were spot on. The hotel is quite lovely, quaint and charming, and the hotel staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. They were most gracious to use their own computer to check our return flight status, and to look up certain addresses for us. When we returned from a tour to Champagne with champagne bottles, they delivered an ice bucket and two flutes to our room, free of charge. We had the superior room with a view of the Pantheon, and although this room was still quite small, we were comfortable. Just not much room for suitcases, etc. The standard rooms must be tiny! I would recommend the superior room as it is still smaller than most U.S. hotel rooms. We took the RER B train from the airport to Luxembourg metro with no problems except one flight of steps exiting the metro station. Once we were out though, it was not too much trouble to roll our suitcases to the hotel. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay here, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: laurendavis
Reviews.Content: My favorite part about this hotel was definitely the location. You are within walking distance to the amazing restaurants of the Latin Quarter, the Seine river, and Notre Dame. My least favorite aspect of this hotel is the paper thin walls. You can easily hear the person in the room beside you on their telephone. The staff was average in general and helpful if you had questions. We arrived at 11am from a long plane ride and had hoped to check in early (since check in starts at 1pm), however we were told a room wouldn't be ready until 2pm. The bathrooms are spotless and the rooms for Paris are a decent size (although, we did upgrade to the room overlooking the Pantheon, so I think these are slightly larger than the standard rooms). We found the shower water to be an extremely light flow and also the hairdryer in the bathroom is probably one of the worst I've ever used. You really can't beat the location though and for that aspect alone I would probably recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Tracy2808
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a colleague and we had a great 4 night stay. It's in a great location, good value and the staff are amazingly helpful and friendly, not always the case in Paris! As mentioned before, the rooms are a tad small and our air conditioning didn't seem to work too well but it was spotlessley clean and quiet. A great hotel, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sense of Paris - and what a bonus getting a room upgrade with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: ToniAB
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris many times but I feel we have finally found the place we will hopefully come back to again again - when we are lucky enough to return. The ratings cover most things so I will just say that you can stay in super luxurious hotels and lose all sense of what country you are visiting, and of course other end of the scale,but this hotel made you fee great about being in Paris. The staff have all the professionalism of a long standing establishment and obviously they set themselves high standards. Finally, though the rooms aren't huge they are well thought out and of all the places we stayed on this trip from Barcelona to Dubai, this was the one place we put all our things away and were extremely organised. Thanks again to the staff and especially the front desk staff. p.s. Triple glazing we think, so very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Find”
Reviews.Author: FleecityFirkin
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. I did lots of research for a hotel before selecting du Pantheon. It was recommended by a friend of a friend. It is a very charming hotel in a fantastic location. It is literally in the shadow of the Pantheon, very quiet at night. Rooms were smallish but not tiny. Very clean and well decorated. Seperate loo was a convience for someone else wanting to bath in the good size bathroom. Exposed ceiling beams and long windows that opened in were quaint. Staff were extremely nice and helpful. It's a hotel I would stay at again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming cosy older hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocci
Reviews.Content: This small cosy hotel is located opposite the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter in Paris. A short 2 mins walk from the metro it's really quite convenient to reach other parts of Paris. The hotel itself is quite old, the rooms are dated with floral wallpaper. But it is all rather charming and the beds are pretty comfortable, and the rooms are reasonably sized so it is really quite a nice stay, and good value for the amount we paid. The front desk reception were all very helpful in helping us with directions and cabs. There is free wifi in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “charming, great location. perfect place in paris!”
Reviews.Author: stephhatchman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August and got a discount by booking through their website and prepaying. This hotel is charming and perfectly situated in the Latin Quarter just a few minutes walk from Notre Dam, Luxemburg Gardens, the metro, restaurants and shopping. The staff were very helpful, the room was clean albeit small but perfect for one or two people. There was even a little balcony with a table and flowers! I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charmant”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Pantheon is just that -- next door to the Pantheon in the wonderful Latin Quarter of Paris. It's a charming "boutique" style hotel....be sure to ask for an upper floor with a view of the Pantheon -- which we got, complete with tiny balcony, from which we could watch the sunset over the Pantheon. The room itself is small, but beautifully decorated. Bathroom modern and everything works. Breakfast is terrific and well worth the extra charge of 11 euros. The only drawback is that it's not terribly near a convenient metro -- the Luxumbourg is just around the corner, but it only goes to Chatelet and then you have to walk forever to get your correspondence. But it's a small price to pay to walk through the Garden to a more convenient metro.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, with fine location and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMolo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well run and gives the visitor a good location, a fine view, plenty of nearby restaurants and a good nights sleep. The buffet breakfast (included, if you want) was very good. Our room was on the 5th floor and overlooked the Pantheon. Throwing back the curtains was a great way to start each day. There is a metro station (Luxembourg) nearby and the Paris metro is a fast and easy way to travel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Newie_Girl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 3 nights in October at the end of a 10 day holiday in France. We chose Hotel du Pantheon on the recommendation of our daughter who had stayed there 18 months previously and from the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were certainly not disappointed. The hotel lived up to every expectation we had of it and exceeded it in many ways. We were pleasantly surprised to be given an upgrade as our room wasn't ready so our room looked straight over the Pantheon. Whilst the room was a bit small by comparison with Australian hotels, the charm and character of the hotel, the decor in the room, the services available more than compensated. The room was very clean and they also provide a very good breakfast at a reasonable cost given it is in Paris. The two outstanding features for us were its location close to the centre of Paris, the Latin Quarter, the Metro etc and we loved being able to walk around the streets in the evenings which were alive with people eating and celebrating. probably the most outstanding aspect of the hotel for us was the quality of service provided for us. The staff could not have been more helpful whether it was in giving directions, providing advice, making reservations, speaking in English when my school days' French let me down or in their overall friendliness. It was a pleasure to stay there and we would recommend it any visitor to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location, friendly and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rose162017
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The hotel was beautifully decorated. Our room was beautifully decorated and much larger than we expected, we did ask for a superior room with a view, which we definitely got. The hotel is in a great location, close to RER and the Metro probably about a 5 minute walk. It is directly opposite the Pantheon and is very quite at night. Easy walk to Notre Dame and Luxemberg Gardens. All the staff were an absolute delight, very friendly and very helpful. If we every return to Paris we will definitely be staying here again. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: gustavm
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel du Pantheon! It is nicely located near the Parc de Luxembourg (with the RER-station for the train to Charles De Gaulle Airport) and with the beautiful Pantheon church just next to the hotel. The rooms are clean, adequate size and country style furnished. The mix with pink wallpapers (made of textile) and a red carpet is absolutely adorable. Though, everything is a little bit "shabby" and the carpet in the rooms and the staircase, needs to be change. But everything feels ok - nothing to argue about. A problem with the Parisian hotel rooms is noice. But the rooms are well sound-proofed. The value is "ok", rooms are expensive in Paris in Hotel du Pantheon is no exception. We booked an "early booking rate" via the hotel's own homepage. Breakfast is also quite expensive, but you will get feed up. Behind the Pantheon, there are many nice restaurants in slope towards Boulevard Saint Germain. Meny menus with decent food. If you are looking for a true French hotel - stay at the Hotel du Pantheon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: KME54
Reviews.Content: This is a sister hotel to Hotel des Grande Hommes right next door - they are both lovely hotels with great service - and the Pantheon is on your doorstep - literally across the street. Walking distance to Notre Dame and the Seine. The rooms are small but beautifully appointed - picture perfect Paris. Although we had a room with a 'water closet' on one side and the bath/shower and sink on the other. A bit odd, but not all rooms are configured like that. We opened our window to view the Pantheon - lovely, but more expensive. I would opt for no view next time with slightly larger square footage.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really is like the pictures. For us the location could have been better though”
Reviews.Author: Redrated
Reviews.Content: We ahd never been to Paris before and after doing lots of research booked this hotel. It was recently renovated. We stayed in one of the superior rooms overloooking the pantheon. The room though small was beautifully decorated as per the hotel pictures. The staff were generally very friendly although dont expect help with suitcases (i dont think they have enough staff for that). My only critcism is that for me the location wasn't great. This is in the latin quarter which is studenty with lots of cheap/ shabby restaurants/ cafes. I know some like this but I would have prefered somewhere a bit more chic/ trendy to save travelling time. In future I would stay west of the jardin luxemborg but this is purely personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service and location”
Reviews.Author: canoe23
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris fairly often on business trips, and like to stay at different smaller "Parisian" hotels. The Hotel du Pantheon is now at the top of my list. Perfect location, with a 3 block walk from the RER B line (Luxembourg) to/from CDG, and right on the Pantheon Square overlooking the Pantheon. A short walk one way to a lively Place de la Contrascarpe, and the other way to Luxembourg Gardens and St. Germain. A tremendous restaurant, La Coupe-Chou, just on the other side of the Pantheon. Very nice room and comfortable bed with newly remodeled bathroom, larger than most. Outstanding service, and nice helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced by $200 per night”
Reviews.Author: reisman18
Reviews.Content: The lobby can speak to you about the quality of this hotel.The carpet on the stairs is worn through to the stair treds.The paint is chipped in the rooms , hallways and in the undersized elevator.Normal baggage can not fit in the very small room. The price is the worst part,210E per night + 22E for breakfast=$323.... Courteous staff,good location

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pdxtraveler77
Reviews.Content: Great location, short walking distance to Luxembourg garden and metro, St. Michel street with lots of cafes, Notre Dame. Very friendly and helpful staff who speak english very well. Clean rooms, small but bigger than I expected after reading all the reviews on Paris hotels. We could move around just fine. We had a room facing the side street and noise was not a problem. Our first time to Paris and it was a lovely experience. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: haganrj
Reviews.Content: Thank you all those people who gave good reviews of this hotel.We spent 3 days there 5-8 September.it wasn't cheap but was worth it-great location,lovely room and bathroom with balcony overlooking the paris rooftops and quiet at night.We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AllanaLondon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time in Paris and loved the Hotel du Pantheon + Excellent location + Friendly and polite staff + Lovely room / decor + Free Wi-Fi + Not noisy at night

Reviews.Title: “"Once again, Hotel du Pantheon provides a great experience"”
Reviews.Author: DennisDykau
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel previously and had a wonderful experience. Once again, we were not disappointed. The location is ideal for visiting a number of nearby sites. The Latin Quarter is busy but fun. The front staff were very helpful in making suggestions, assisting in booking a shuttle to the airport for the four of us. And the breakfast in the hotel is really very convenient. The hotel is quaint and, of course, its location across from the Pantheon was really a delight on Bastille Day when the area fills up with people looking off toward the Eiffel Tower (in the distance) and the fireworks. We booked directly from the Hotel website and this provided us with an excellent rate. I've done this before and would highly recommend doing so. They have various specials and it is worthwhile to check these out.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: loverofmonet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in Paris at the beginning of a trip of a lifetime. I chose this hotel based on trip advisor rating and the classic french decor. The hotel exceeded my expectations. We had booked a standard room online and were upgraded to a deleux room with a view of the Pantheon at no extra charge. Found the staff to be helpful and knowledgable. The room was very clean with floral fabric wall paper. I would not recommend booking for hotel's breakfast as there are many good continential breakfast places in the area for 4-6 euro per person. The hotel is close to many restaurants snd shops. The closest metro station is about 2 blocks away (RER). We enjoyed walking from our hotel base to sights like Notre Dame and Muse d'Orsay. These sights are about a 15-20 minute walk. Overall excellent experience and would stay there again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Paris.......”
Reviews.Author: Lincolnchap
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Hotel and delivers just what you'd expect of a Paris hotel with a particularly good view over the square of the Pantheon. The rooms are good and staff very friendly. The breakfasts were as filling as you needed them to be ready for a long day in the city. There was no evening dining at the hotel, but because just two streets away there are 100s of bars and restaurants, this was not really a problem. We will definitely be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ntigah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Du Pantheon for 2 nights. The location is fantastic and the hotel is truly lovely. Front staff were really friendly and always helpful (they even catered for us when we didn't arrive for breakfast until an hour later than due). Made our stay in Paris really memorable. The only downside to our stay was that we were in Room 1 which was next to reception and although not too busy, we were woken by people moving around in the morning. Overall a great hotel in a beautiful location

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: giotto2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, from 12 to 16 August. We were extremely happy with our choice of hotel. It was like a quiet oasis in the middle of the busy city. The square, while filled with tourists coming to the Pantheon during the day, was very calm and quiet at night. We had booked a room with a view over the Pantheon and when we arrived we got room 50, with a little balcony, from where it was lovely to people watch. All the things other reviewers have said are true: the room was smallish, but not impossibly so; the shower screen over the bath did not prevent the floor from getting soaked. But it was beautifully decorated and the bed was big and comfortable. Most importantly, it was very clean. Room 50 is right beside the lift but the noise from the lift was not intrusive. It was a lovely room to come back to after a busy day of sightseeing. Although we never needed to ask the reception staff for help, they were all very friendly and we did hear other departing guests thank them for their assistance with various matters. They have a luggage room, where we were able to leave our baggage upon checkout until it was time to catch our evening flight home. The only negative I can think of was breakfast. We had booked the room only and at 13 Euros it was quite expensive for what was on offer. There was orange or grapefruit juice; choice of hot drink; croissants and what the French call “viennoiseries”; bread and jams; yoghurt, some cold meats and cheese. They also served a little dish of fruit salad. This may sound like a lot but the fruit salad was in some kind of sweet syrup, which we did not like, and the croissants were slightly stodgy. Also, the breakfast room was in the basement – obviously no windows. For 6 Euros 50 we had a really lovely breakfast at the nearest cafe on Rue Soufflot, just round the corner – the Comptoir du Pantheon. We had orange juice, choice of hot drink, tartines and croissant or pain au chocolat. Both the croissant and pain au chocolat were bigger and much lighter/flakier than at the hotel and since the weather was absolutely gorgeous while we were there, it was great to sit outside breakfasting in the sunshine, with the Pantheon on one’s right and a view of the Eiffel Tower to one’s left. This hotel is conveniently situated for cafes on Rue Soufflot, or just a little farther away at the Sorbonne square. Five minutes walking takes you to Rue Mouffetard, where there are lots of restaurants. You are not too much further away from the St Germain area, which seemed to have plenty of eating places to choose from. It was easy walking to Sainte Chapelle, Ile de la Cite and Ile St Louis and not that much further to the Louvre. We enjoyed the Jardin du Luxembourg at the bottom of the street. We also liked the fact that the hotel was so near the Luxembourg RER station – very handy for the train to and from CDG and also for connecting with the metro to get about the city. We would love to stay at this hotel in future. Its central but quiet situation is great and we really liked our room. We have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best all round for quality, price, location and friendly front desk in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anthony5
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for a family holiday because of the location but was then very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms and bathrooms. We had two rooms at the front overlooking the Pantheon which is surrounded by bars and restaurants of a good standard (we liked the Place de la Sorbonne). Mini bar/lobby bar and hotel breakfast excellent (although we tended to eat breakfast in pavement cafes) and the teenagers made full use of the Wifi connection . We had driven to Paris and the Place du Pantheon is relatively quiet and easy to unload. I parked in the nearby underground parking for three days at a cost of €75 (!) and next time might try to occupy the spaces above ground in front of the hotel at much less cost. The location is handy for Jardins de Luxembourg (and nearby taxi rank) but not good for Metro. Lots of Velibre bicycle locations nearby and its downhill in every direction so many excursions made by bike.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: eponadeb
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a 4 night romantic break based on TA reviews, and are so very glad we did. We got a great rate via the hotel website becasue we were staying in August and so it was excellent value! We were in Room 52, with a balcony - not big enough to sit on but we could stand on it with our drinks, and sit with the tall windows open in our room looking outside. It was decorated in pretty pale blue, with fabric covered walls and white wooden roof beams. Everything was spotlessly clean. Of course the room is a little on the small size but we'd expect that anyway and have stayed in smaller ones in London in higher starred hotels. The view of the Pantheon is amazing, yet it is such a quiet spot to be. Convenient to walk down to to most of the places you want to visit, we never used the metro once, and only got one taxi when we were very tired! We ate all our evening meals within 5 minutes walk of the hotel too. Sitting in the one of the bars on the street leading from the Pantheon, Rue Soufflot, on an evening with a drink, you can see the Pantheon to your right, and the twinkling light show of the Eiffel Tower to your left - wonderful! The only negative point for us was that although there was room service for continental breakfast there did not appear to be room service for coffee/tea - and so on an early morning that was not good for us! However, if we had taken our own travel kettle this would not have been a problem, and it was our fault we forgot it. Also, one night we decided to have the half bottle of champagne from the minibar, and there were no flutes, and we had to go downstairs for them ourselves (quite a way, and not good when you're already ready for bed!). But these are very minor points, and I only mention them so that you are forearmed and can prevent them! The service at Reception was inpeccable, very helpful and friendly. Very highly recommended, and when we go back to Paris again in 18 months we are already wondering where on earth we could stay to get such an excellent combination of things, even though our budget will stretch a to something more expensive then.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, romantic, great value Paris hotel. Just stay here.”
Reviews.Author: mikesydney2008
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Paris a number of times in hotels with more stars I was a bit concerned booking into Hotel du pantheon but as soon as we arrived and were welcomed by Michael my concerns were put to rest. It is a wonderful little hotel and in a brilliant position so close to St Germaine area and the Luxemburg gardens. I trusted trip advisor comments in booking this hotel and I can honestly say it was the best decision of our honeymoon (so far!). We stayed in room 61 on the top floor with a great view of the pantheon in a beautiful red wall papered room. The room itself was well appointed and of average size for Paris with lovely little touch's and a clean and new bathroom. The room is well designed with a separate bathroom and toilette and lovingly decorated. I ordered flowers through the hotel and they were beautiful and well worth it (and lived the entire week!) The area is great for well priced food, walks in the park, and basically having a wonderful Paris experience. We took the metro and taxi's (about 12 euro to Montemarte, 10 Euro to arc de triomph etc) so if you are travelling as a group cabs work out better than the metro. I also really appreciated the free wifi... a big tick given the cost in most hotels these days....I could say so much more but I think the best thing to do is trust people's opinions on here and just book it. We will be back, in room 61, I just don't know when!! As for the local area there are some great little coffee shops for breakfast so we decided against the hotel breakfast. I enjoy sitting outside in the morning and watching Paris go by too much. The pick of the bunch is the first cafe on the left hand side as you walk down from the hotel to the gardens (cafe ? du pantheon) with great salads and cafe food, and the three cafes in the sorbonne square (a short walk away).

Reviews.Title: “A winner!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel - charming French ambiance. It's in a good location, with great views of the Pantheon from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Paris, bar none”
Reviews.Author: yankinuk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in various hotels in Paris, from five star on down, and Hotel du Pantheon is by far our favorite. The staff is very pleasant, the rooms are beautiful and charming, and the location is perfect for sightseeing, shopping and eating. It is great value for money, and we're more than happy to make it our home in Paris whenever we visit. I really can't recommend the location enough. Despite being across the street from the Pantheon, the rooms are very quiet even when facing the Pantheon and we've always had a good night's sleep. It is about a 15 euro taxi ride from Gare du Nord (the Eurostar station) or an easy trip on the RER. Jardin Luxembourg is practically next door, the bistros and brasseries of St. Germain are a quick stroll away (as are the shops), and it's an easy walk to Notre Dame. The Louvre is a bit further but we also find it easy to walk to. The rooms are charming, decorated in country French style with toile print wallcoverings. On our last stay, we had one large suitcase, two small suitcases and several bags and the room didn't feel crowded. We loved the free wifi access which made planning our next day of sightseeing a breeze. The rooms are spotlessly clean. The staff are very friendly and accommodating, and speak excellent English with a smile. I can't recommend the Hotel du Pantheon highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Guzeppe
Reviews.Content: View of Pantheon across the street from the room. Close to many restaurants and to metro station. Friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the 5th”
Reviews.Author: sundogg99
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights in July at the Hotel du Pantheon during a winter special offered last February. We had to pay at the time and the charges were non-refundable, so there was some risk if our travel plans had changed. In any event, our plans did not change and we enjoyed our 4 nights in a surprisingly spacious (by Paris standards) room at an average of less than €100 per night. The hotel is located in the 5th Arrondisement at the edge of the Latin Quarter and within 10 minutes walk of Ile de France. The building is charming, housekeeping was efficient, and the staff were helpful. Our room was nicely decorated and both bath and bedroom were quite spacious. For the money we spent, an incredibly good value.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TKD09
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in July on a vacation with my 12 year old daughter. It was clean, comfortable, quiet, and the location was great. it was a two minute walk to the interesting part of the latin quarter. It was an easy walk to Notre-Dame and Ste. Chapelle, and easy walk to Jardin du Luxembourg, and for everything else it was close to metro and city buses. I would really recommend the city buses, which you can ride with the same multiday pass you buy for the metro. The buses are much cleaner and more pleasant than the metro, and you can see Paris as you ride. They come frequently, and go to anyplace you can get to by metro. As for the Hotel du Pantheon, I would definitely stay there again. No reason to stay anyplace else. I has great character. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. The room was a very comfortable place to come back to after a day sightseeing in Paris. If you prefer a big, sterile, corporate hotel in a busy location, this isn't a hotel for you. But if you want a smaller, friendly hotel with character, in a quiet location near interesting things, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and great value”
Reviews.Author: freyajane
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights in July 09 and were super-impressed by the quality. After budget accommodation in London and Barcelona, we were genuinely delighted to find this hotel markedly cheaper yet infinitely cleaner, prettier and better positioned than any of the other places we'd been staying! The concierge was sweet and patient when we attempted to speak appauling French, and he helped us refine our accents (in a helpful way, not a patronising way). It was a real treat and highlight of our trip - being in such quaint surrounds and having the Pantheon (BAM) right there in front of your when you walked outside each day. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a long weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Blueram
