Reviews.Content: Positives: • Beautiful decor in the rooms, although the room is tiny. • Location is excellent, next to the Pantheon and right near Luxembourg Gardens and the RER train station (Direct link to Gare de Nord for the Eurostar) • Good air-conditioning in the heat of summer Improvements: • The bathroom is poorly laid out. Every time you use the shower water sprays all over the toilet seat. • Our room was not cleaned even though we left the door tag on the door – Disappointing after coming back after a long day to find that we had to request towels from reception and go down and get them ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “great location,price,bigger rooms than expected,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 50thtrip
Reviews.Content: All was great--location, size of rooms, price, staff, views, accomodating, different breakfast levels to get--

Reviews.Title: “Really good offers”
Reviews.Author: Redeyed
Reviews.Content: Having booked online in advance we got a really good rate on a room with a view of the Pantheon. About 150 Euros a night I think, which for this standard of hotel in a good Paris location is pretty good by my reckoning. The room itself was very sweet, white painted wooden beams on the ceiling and pretty floral furnishings. A typically small bathroom and wc but all clean and fine. We weren't in the hotel much as we were out enjoying the city but as a clean, pretty, polite and well located place to lay your head it's ideal. The view over the pantheon is beautiful and the windows are double glazed and well sound proofed in case you were worried about traffic or people in the mornings. PS free wi-fi too

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadLa
Reviews.Content: I had to make a four-day business trip on a budget in June 2009. I didn't want a bargain-basement budget hotel as I needed a place that would reliably let me rest up and suit up for work, and also be central so I wouldn't spend hours trying to get to my appointments, but I also did not have the budget to stay at a top-class hotel. This hotel turned out to be a perfect solution. The room was small but clean and very nicely decorated. The breakfast was a good way to start the day and the woman who worked there was especially nice. The only minor issue is that, if you book the room online via Expedia, it seems like you have paid in advance in dollars, but in fact you have not. This can be an issue because, with the dollar falling in value, you may end up paying more (in dollars) when you actually check out because the dollar has fallen since you booked. This is a problem for Expedia, however, not the hotel; they could make this clearer in their booking. Otherwise, no complaints, and I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Another great review for a wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lgmiller
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the favorable reviews! This is a very lovely hotel. The location is fantastic!! Our room looked out to the Pantheon and the area bustles with a multitude of students. The room was charming and the breakfast room is really great..The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, polite, clean, great view, they give you umbrellas when it rains.”
Reviews.Author: leslielikestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights for part of our honeymoon. My husband speaks French but the staff also spoke wonderful English. The room was a good size, they give you great toiletries, and when it rained they had nice umbrellas you can use for free. The hotel had a beautiful view of the Pantheon and the room was appealingly decorated in a very European style. We are from NYC so perhaps our ideas of size are different from other people's, but we though the room was a very good size. And the little balcony was nice to get some fresh air, although we didn't really spend any time on it. You can walk to a number of little cafes and the subway is close by. Great!

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: skippip
Reviews.Content: a pleasant 2 night stay in a pleasant room with a fantastic view of the Pantheon. The staff were courteous,helpful and informative arranging taxis when needed. Breakfast service could be improved. No one enquired as to our needs other than tea or coffee. Would have liked bacon and eggs one morning but no one asked and you just helped yourself to a continental breakfast. Still, happy to recommend the Pantheon Hotel to prospective travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel - well situated and very good service”
Reviews.Author: DieMiez
Reviews.Content: The second time we stayed in this hotel, we reiterated our experience of a nice little hotel in the heart of Paris. We can fully recommend it - and also the helpful, friendly staff. Our first choice for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If you're traveling with older children, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: iaillini
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Paris with older children, you absolutely cannot match Hotel du Pantheon! We traveled to France this spring, and were fortunate enough to get what the Hotel du Pantheon calls their "Family Room" at a great rate. This Family room is described as being for "up to 4 persons" and is a "specially designed package made up of 2 rooms (double and twin), situated on the same floor, next or opposite to each other". For 279 euros per night, (based on their Spring Special rate) we had two BEAUTIFUL rooms for our grown son and ourselves, in a hotel with an absolutely superb location. I was amazed that I was able to find a hotel with this quality and value in the city of Paris. We were staying on the sixth floor, and were rewarded with marvelous views of both the Pantheon and the Sorbonne. The Luxembourg Gardens are a short walk down the street and fabulous for people watching, and the streets around the University and the Pantheon are full of delightful and reasonable cafes. Our son had his computer with him, and had absolutely no problem with the internet, which was far better than the internet in more expensive hotels on our trip. The only possible drawback is the tiny and rather slow elevator - - but the friendly and helpful staff more than makes up for it. I would book this hotel again when I return, and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rozalie
Reviews.Content: A quaint lovely and romantic hotel within walking distance of the Latin quarter, Luxembourg Gardens , the Metro and many shops , cafes and restaurants. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The decor was like something out a novel. It is even lovelier than the website pictures. If I were ever to return to Paris I would make a point of rebooking at this hotel. Rozalie Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Simply Charming and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: luciegoosie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were an absolute delight - great comfy bed and linens. Fresh and clean bathrooms. The view of the Pantheon is to die for. The decor was elegant and charming - much more Parisienne than a new Boutique Hotel. The staff were incredible - all spoke English very well, incredibly helpful in booking taxis and educating us on the use of the Metro and buses. Rooms were very quiet. HIghly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: CPM91
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris and we wanted to stay somewhere a little more traditional. We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 3 nights. Online booking was straighforward and the staff were very helpful with our arrangements for the first night as we had a late arrival at CDG. They supplied us with the names of nearby restaurants that serve food till late and made a personal response to our request for a late check in. The hotel is very close to the Luxembourg station (RER) so transfer to CDG airport is easy peasy (E8.60 each). The hotel is very well decorated and the rooms are of an excellent standard, considering the 3* rating. We stayed in room 24, which was quite small, but perfectly adequate for 3 nights. The decor is all very traditional and the exposed beams and beautiful fabrics used throughout make it feel very luxurious. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful and always very polite. The only little niggle I had was that the room wasn't serviced till about 4pm each day - by which time we had returned for a rest - so we either had to go out again or forfiet the room change. There are great cafes and brasseries nearby, I would especially recommend Restaurant Perraudin (157 Rus St Jacques) which is just around the corner. All in all, a great hotel, a splendid location and excellent value in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: portlandwire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, and the staff was incredible. I was traveling alone and the first time in this area, and the staff was welcoming, informative, and provided great tips sightseeing and errands I needed to do. The room was well appointed, very clean, and charming - and a great bathroom. Located around the corner from Luxembourg stop, it is easy to get to from CDG airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: LNarvaezMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location in the Latin Qtr. Our room was VERY clean and the housecleaning superb! We were in room 32 which had a great view of the Pantheon. This is our 5th time in Paris, we APPRECIATED the style, wood beams, fresh towels, clean carpet, super comfy bed! All day you walk about, then refresh in a nice, affordable room! Many restaurants in the area, make reservations! Would return again!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LLA-TMBA
Reviews.Content: This is a Lovely Hotel - Traveling with 80 year old Mother and three small children (7, 5, 2) - We were ALL happy at Hotel du Pantheon - All three rooms were beautifully decorated- Entire hotel immaculate! In heart of city but so peaceful and quiet at night - Many many choices for breakfast lunch or dinner within close proximity. WiFi in rooms - Attentive staff - Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tripadvisermember_9
Reviews.Content: Before making a final decision, I read the negative comments on this and several other hotels and found those for Hotel du Pantheon somewhat over reactive. Trust the good comments and you will find this hotel in a great location, full of charm, very clean and a helpful staff. The breakfast kept me going for most of my busy day and the deep tub was wonderful to come back to, along with towels on a heating rack. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ModdeyCloh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of April and it was as charming a place as I had hoped. Wonderful staff, so helpful and patient; terrific housekeeping, and a spotless bathroom; a small room with a large window looking out on the Pantheon; and Paris at your feet. What more can you ask? The location is fantastic. There's a safe in the room. There's free wireless internet in the lobby. There's a TV that gets a bunch of French channels and CNN if you can stand to watch it. But really, don't turn it on; turn out the lights and look out the window at the Place du Pantheon and the people drifting through the square. There's a winding staircase down a stone stairwell that takes you to a pretty little breakfast room, where the server remembered each day that I drink tea and my husband drinks coffee, and that we both take milk. We always had breakfast at the hotel, I'd rather not have to forage for the first meal of the day. I didn't think it was all that expensive, despite what some other reviewers have said--given that you can sit down at a cafe for two cups of coffee and pay 8 euros! I hope to go back to Paris, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. You will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel,Staff and Location We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: brythnoth
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to expectations and more. Room comfotable ,clean and quite spacious Staff extremely charming and helpful which made all the difference to our stay. Our room was quiet even though we looked out on to the Pantheon, a popular tourist spot. Location brilliant and enabled us to explore a part of Paris we did not know by foot . Good value hotel- spring time in Paris -what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Best location & Charming Stay”
Reviews.Author: whe2312
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. Unbeatable location right beside the Pantheon and in the latin quarter. Walking down the hill is the Luxembourg Gardens (beautiful tree blossom at this time of year). Straight ahead you can see La Tour Eiffel and to the right is the Notre Dame. Room is reasonable size especially for Paris and en suite had a bath. Tastefully decorated in provence style. Didn't have breakfast, lots of cafes near by. Close to St Germain de Pres for restaurants, Bon Marche etc. Very reasonable room rate. Much cheaper than Dublin or London. My 6th time in Paris. Will definetly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wish I was here!”
Reviews.Author: lemayo
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th hotel I have stayed in in Paris over the past 5 years and the one I will definitely return to! We had a standard room, no Pantheon view, but with a balcony from which you could see the Sacre Coeur! Very spacious room by Parisian standards, what a relief not to be tripping over things, and very spacious bathroom. Very clean and absolutely silent! Good breakfast, even better when included in price (who would pay Paris hotel breakfast prices with the current exchange rate?) and nice staff. Only one minor gripe which did not spoil our stay at all - we booked on the hotel's website, which took our credit card details and told us it would take 175 euros from us. At check out we pointed this out to the receptionist, but he said no, no money had been taken. When we got home we found out he was indeed correct, but I wish hotels would not do this. (Although in future we will check credit card statements more carefully). Oh, and I left my phone in the room which the hotel posted back to me. Merci Hotel du Pantheon, a tres bientot, j'espere!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in a great location with a high standard of cleanliness and charming staff.”
Reviews.Author: coral1954
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a good location, and after reading the reviews chose Hotel du Pantheon. We were not disappointed. When you walk outside the door you are literally facing the Pantheon. It is a short walk from the Boulevard St. Michel and within easy walking distance of Notre Dame. The Latin Quarter is a bustling, lively area with lots of places to get a good meal. It is easy to get to Charles de Gaulle airport on the RER from Luxembourg station a short walk away. The hotel itself is delightful. It is spotlessly clean. We had a "classic" room, which I think is their basic room, and although we didn't have a view of the Pantheon the room was very good. The beds were comfortable, we had plenty of storage space and in the bathroom there was a bath, a shower and a large handbasin. The staff are cheerful and friendly. I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: BABYFACEB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel. One of the reasons we chose the hotel, was on the basis of the reviews and photos posted on this site. I have to say it lived up to all expectations! We had a lovely room with a fantastic view of the Pantheon. The room was spotless, and the staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nancyrisser
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a small, clean romantic hotel. We have stayed in various Parisian hotels, and we found this to be the best yet! Our room, #60, was delightful with flowered walls. We bought some pink flowers to put on the small marbletop table to enhance the romantic feeling. Our windows overlooked the Pantheon-magnificent! My husband enjoyed making his own fresh crepes for breakfast, and we loved the croissants, juice and cafe au lait. The reception staff could not have been more gracious-they arranged tours, made dinner reservations, recommended stores, found me a teapot and printed boarding passes!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: nyme
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Pantheon has everything going for it in Paris - location, charm and service. I sort of hesitate to write this as since the last time I stayed there about 2 years ago, it has become increasingly popular and as such, the prices have risen a bit. Nevertheless, relative to a generally pricey hotel environment that is Paris, HdP still seems economical. Room decor remains fresh and charming, with soothing, classic color schemes creating a cozy atmosphere in the rooms, lobby and dining room. Compliments to the interior decorator chosen to create these spaces. I would echo what I've read elsewhere - cleaning staff is also superb. Rooms are spotless. I love the location of the HdP. It's very convenient to metro/RER stops, and a manageable walk to attractions depending on how much you like to walk, though this can be said of most hotels in the center of Paris. This time, we discovered Rue Mouffetard in the neighborhood, know for its gourmet shops. Oh for a stroll down that street today. Thanks to all staff and management at the Hotel du Pantheon, I will be certainment be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: konossos
Reviews.Content: If you looking for a great deal in Paris and do not want to spend a lot of money this is the hotel for you. I found it to be just what we were looking for. The hotel is small but I was not trying to book in a fancy place. The shower rooms have lot of room. Which is important to me. The views from the windows are great. The cleaning people do a top notch job. The staff that work there spoke excellent English and were very helpful. They told us where the stores are located, got us a taxi to the airport. They do have a shuttle service but tell them a day a head of time. The location was perfect for me. The people in the area were local French people. Which I prefer than the tourist. The night streets were quite. There are some excellent cafes near by. I really recommend "Comptoir Du Pantheon". One of the best places to just sit and watch people while sipping a coffee. Overall and comparable the hotel is perfect. Will stay there next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: atwatervillage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were actually visiting family in the Provence area but decided to spend a quick 24 hours in Paris via the TGV train from Aix. The hotel is three easy metro hops from Gare de Lyon and then a short walk straight towards the Pantheon. It is really very charming and looks as good as the pictures. Very clean and everyone was so nice! The breakfast was very good and the breakfast room is very nice too! (One tip though....the little bag of peanuts which is atop the "minibar" in between the water glasses is not complimentary. It was only 2 euro or so but just an fyi should you not want to pay for them) We had the room with view and it was a fantastic view of the Pantheon and overlooking the Place Du Pantheon. Lots of wonderful restaurants right in the vicinity as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: viennagrl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel du Pantheon last December. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. To begin with, they offered to upgrade our room for one with the view of the Pantheon at no charge. They were also great about giving recommendations for night life, restaurants and anything else we had a question about. The one thing I will say, the room did not seem as luxurious as the one on their website (homepage), I thought it was a little more simple in real life, but still, clean and charming. Can't beat the location either! I think we will stay there again on the next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Alanwhicker41
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and the accomodation is superb. The rooms are beautifully quaint and the stair case is a one off, but there is a lift. The location is ideal if you want to stay in and around the Latin Quarter; a short walk to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens and Sorbonne. We will certainly be back and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our stay in Paris stress free”
Reviews.Author: oldmac49
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel more than lived up to our expecations. The hotel had upgraded one of the rooms as we had requested twin beds in each room - travelling with sisters and mum, and could only get one superior room on line. Both rooms overlooked trhe Pantheon. The walk to Notre Dame taking only 8 mins. From the beginning the staff were very helpful - including tolerating my poor French! They recommended and booked resturants for us to suit budget and location, as well as giving excellent advice re transport and organising taxis when required. I could not recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Romance and Charm”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravels1000
Reviews.Content: We read tons of reviews in search of a clean, romantic room with European charm that would suit our limited budget, and Hotel du Pantheon delivered! Our "Superior Room with a View" was spotless. The red and pink flowery interior was surprisingly quaint. The Metro/RER, bakeries, restaurants, nightlife, and lively Latin Quarter streets were within a few blocks walking distance. The winding staircase was lovely. The front desk offered polite 24-hour service. The building had old-world character. The neighbourhood was quiet and safe. The view of the Pantheon was spectacular, and the romance and charm were worth every penny! Without a doubt, the merits of the hotel far outweighed anything else! It was actually very easy for us to disregard the small elevator, the limited room space, the bathroom without a shower or shower curtain, and the short walk to public transit and some of the busier Latin Quarter areas. Despite our pre-arrival worries, none of these things bothered us at all. We were extremely happy and relieved with our choice! After considering hundreds of places, we felt fortunate to have stayed in such a gem! Hotel du Pantheon definitely helped to make our trip much more memorable than we expected! We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_Taylor
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hotel du Pantheon 22 years after our first visit, and were not disappointed. This is a cosy small hotel, with good sized rooms, delightfully decorated and furnished. Take a 'superior' room on the 6th floor, and you will have a fabulous view across the rooftops of the Place du Pantheon all the way across to Sacre Coeur. We had room #62 and it was delighful, the only small drawback was a very small bath in the bathroom (one had to sit upright). Breakfast is OK by Parisian hotel standards, but for €11 you might be better off stepping around the corner to a cafe on the Rue Soufflot, or head for the Place de la Contrescarpe, and enjoy soaking up the atmosphere along with your cafe au lait. But for a good hotel, in a fabulous location in the heart of Paris, you probably could not find a better place at a better price! Oh, and, my husband commented that this is probably the only hotel that I was happy with in 1987 that I am still happy to stay in today (apparently my standards have risen over the years) - which is also an interesting perspective on a place which has a good standard of accomodation despite being affordable and only 2 star

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cooperi8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hotel du Pantheon, and can't fault it in any way. First of all, the location: the hotel reception gives out onto the Pantheon - a spectacular sight to walk out on to. Round the corner is a lovely neighborhood cafe (very local, good wines) and across the Place de Pantheon, any number of great restaurants to choose from in the Latin Quarter. Keep going, though, and you're, say, 5-10 minutes' stroll from Notre Dame. The hotel itself: the hotel is set within an attractive old building. You walk into a smartly decked out reception (where we were greeted in a really friendly manner), and up a narrow winding staircase to the rooms. Our room was on the first floor, small(ish) but cosy - it was, and needed to be, very well heated, as Paris was freezing - and very nicely decorated. (We were on the first floor looking out on to the street, but you couldn't hear a thing.) But it was the bathroom that really sealed the deal. My girlfriend's a bit of a stickler for bathrooms. And the photos of showers etc. in other places had scared her off. This one, though, was perfect: spotless white tiles, a bath and a shower with plenty of oomph to it... Final verdict: plenty of charm for a price where - in Paris, at least - you wouldn't necessarily expect it. A fantastic weekend in a fantastic little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: meddam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Patheon Jan 14-18. The room was cute - a decent size - and the bathroom was enormous, by Paris standards. We were in room 01, which was right next to the lobby. Unfortunately this meant we were woken up every night by the more youthful people going out at night or coming back from bars (sadly I'm 34 and I was in bed by 11!). I thought about asking to be moved, but since I was only paying 388 euros for 4 nights, I didn't bother. Plus, with my luck I would have ended up next door to one of those people & would have had to listen to them all night! Our room looked out on the side street. Not much of a view, but it didn't bother me. The room had cable TV (if you need an alarm to wake up in the morning, it's incorporated into the TV). I believe it had internet access since I saw people on their computers in the lobby. They had a copy of the Herald in the lobby each day, so it was nice to read an English newspaper while sitting & watching the world go by. The location was great. RER is just at the end of Sufflot. There is a boulangerie on the street right behind the hotel as well as a small supermarket. We ate breakfast in the hotel our last day & it was a little expensive IMO, but fast & good. The staff was very nice. Lots of restaurants in the area. We ate at Crepes a-go-go on Sufflot and Le Comptoir. Had dinner at Le Coup Chou and Le Petit Prince, which are in walking distance (make reservations if you can). I've stayed at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles and Hotel Jardin d'Odeon (a sister hotel) and I've liked all of them. A cute hotel, great location and great price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: SuaimhneasDe
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel in an excellent location. Spent three nights in the hotel - really great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: kmacirs
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with every aspect of our trip to Paris and with this hotel! We arrived early morning and found that we were allowed in our room... Very clean and updated bathroom fixtures. We found the room to be a bit cramped - but could walk around the bed and there was ample room for storage and getting your clothes/items out of your way... Room 32 had a great view of the Pantheon (go spend some time there) and great places to eat and drink within a short walk... Never got breakfast there - always walked behind the hotel for a pastry and cafe at the boulangerie behind... Everyone at the desk was welcoming and helpful... English not a problem and they politely helped us with our French!... Michael booked a tour for us with great ease... Not in the HEART of Paris, but a nice walk from everything and we loved walking in Paris most of all, anyway! We WOULD come back here of any of this company's hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sized room, very clean. Very nice front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: jamiestar73
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Very clean. Good breakfast every day in our room (extra $$, but worth it to get a good meal first thing in the day) Nice sized room. Not huge, but plenty of room for 2 people. Not super close to a Metro stop, but pretty close to an RER station. The hotel facade was under construction when we were there so there was scaffolding outside our window which wasn't great, but we weren't there for the view from the room. (which was nice of the Pantheon, through the scaffold) The phone calls to the US from our room were SUPER cheap. WAY less than using a cell phone. And nicer than standing in a phone booth using a pre-paid card. We missed our connecting flight to Paris so we didn't check in until almost midnight, but they were very nice. Didn't give us any trouble about being so late.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, warm, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PrescottPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Pantheon was a perfect stay for us. It is tucked away near the Boulevard Saint Michael and the area is quiet. We had a full view of the Pantheon. It was in December and the room was very pretty, extremely clean, and most important in the winter, warm. The room was cheery with big tall windows that let in lots of day light when you opened the drapes. The staff was kind and friendly. They helped us with all of our questions and needs. The breakfast downstairs was well worth it and the coffee was above average. Around the corner was the Pantheon Restaurant which we also loved. The staff there was very friendly and accommodating. The meals were delicious and very reasonable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiral123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night last weekend, and found this hotel to be amazing. In room 61 on the top floor we had great views all the way to the Sacré-Cœur, room and bathroom spotless. Would recommend to anyone on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “True Parisian Style”
Reviews.Author: OrchidScotland
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I loved the decor of the rooms which were decorated in a traditional style (very French/Parisian). I had need to contact the hotel prior to arriving on a couple of occasions and found the staff to be always courteous and polite. Our room had a fabulous view of the Pantheon and although it was a front facing view, we were never woken by noise on a night by people or traffic. The maid service was excellent, although we never actually saw the maids, our rooms were always nicely tidied and cleaned on our return. We had a lovely trip and would definitely stay here again! The only thing that would have made it better would have been tea/coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: craigandlouise
Reviews.Content: I was expecting good things after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and the hotel didn't disappoint. In times of ultra modern faceless hotels, this place offered true Parisian flair in a great location opposite the magnificent Pantheon. If your budget can stretch to it, go for a superior room with a view - you won't be disappointed. The rooms, although not huge, were very nicely done in pretty fabrics and antique furniture. They were spotlessly clean and offered an oasis of calm from the sometimes frenetic streets of Paris. The only really small complaint was that the shower was a bit disappointing and wasn't very powerful. Breakfast is served in a nice little room in the basement and was more than adequate. There are a few restaurants and bars close to the hotel and it is only a 5 minute walk to some of the busier streets and 10 minutes walk to St-Germain-des-Pres, famous stomping ground of Jean-Paul Sartre, Simone de Beauvoir, Juliette Greco, Ernest Hemingway and Albert Camus ( The Deux Magot, the Café de Flore and the Brasserie Lipp were particular favourites of theirs). Tip if you are going at Christmas - enjoy a glass of champagne (or a coffee) on the first floor champagne bar of the Galeries Lafayette department store on Boulevard Haussmann and wonder over the huge Christmas tree and amazing baubles suspended over your heads from the domed roof. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Memory for Life”
Reviews.Author: Taran78
Reviews.Content: Well other than the fact that I proposed to my girlfriend (and she accepted) at the hotel.. I have to say I was impressed with the level of service, the fresh and colourful taste of the decor and its location. We are a young couple so I would wholly recommend it for a couple of nights stay.. depending on your budget. Hotels in Paris are not cheap but this was a little gem of a place. The hotel website also offers great discounts! The fabric wallpaer.. the comfortable bed.. the great memories.. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: madamtraveller
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Good value compared to other hotels in Paris. The breakfast was another positive surprise . We were delighted to find cheese assortments , ham ,cereal, yoghurt and even crepe dough to cook our own crepe.(The usual continental breakfast you would get in Paris would be croissants,butter ,jam and coffee or tea) Our room was small but tastefully decorated and very clean.We had a standard double room with no view but were not even slightly bothered by that. The narrow corridors and the relatively small rooms are very typical for Paris Hotels and should not put you off when booking this hotel . It was an overall nice experience for us and would definetly recommend this hotel for couples and singles. Don't miss the famous patisserie Dallayou which is across the entry of the Luxembourg gardens and walking distance from the hotel.Everything was just delicous!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GottaGoHouston
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from our second stay at the Hotel du Pantheon. The hotel is located near the Latin Quarter of Paris and 2-3 blocks from Luxembourg Gardens. The Sorbonne and the Pantheon are across the square. It is a short 10- 15 minute walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. You will find a small grocery and a bakery just behind the hotel and around the corner, not to mention several restaurants and a movie theatre nearby. The area, "being off campus" is filled with college students and faculty. We felt very safe walking the area at night. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the decor is delightful. We particularly enjoyed a 6th floor room with a balcony view of Sacre Coeur in the distance. The front desk staff were courteous, professional and friendly. Having visited Paris several times I have found The Hotel du Pantheon to be the best quality, service and location for the money.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, intiminate hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Traveler99Mexico
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 2 year old son, recently spent 3 nights staying in the Hotel du Pantheon. It is a small, charming hotel set in what was undoubtedly a townhouse before its current incarnation as a hotel. We stayed in a small but extremely clean and tastefully decorated room, and the hotel was very kind about fitting a small bed into the room. The bed had an canopy, and the bathroom was quite spacious and modern. The hotel staff was extremely attentive and friendly; they always helped us with any inquiries we had and were especially kind to our son! The hotel serves a great breakfast, although it is not included in the basic room charge. We paid about 130 euros per night -- from what I can tell, that's a pretty good rate for a room in hotel right in the middle of Paris. Overall, I highly recommend the Hotel Du Pantheon for anyone who wants to stay in downtown Paris at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: francophileVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 3 nights and recommend it highly. Excellent location, walking distance form the RER staion from CDG airport. The room was clean, quiet and spacious. We have been in Paris many times, and we will stay here again. M and D Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: OATEK
Reviews.Content: We had two lovely days here, in a room overlooking the Pantheon. The breakfasts were good, the room very comfortable, and the staff very helpful. This is a great position, close to RER, short walk down to St Michel, St Severin and the Seine. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Du Pantheon!!!”
Reviews.Author: mobster21
Reviews.Content: Very cosy hotel...excellent staff...great location...incredible view... clean and cosy rooms...romantic atmoshere...what else are you looking for??? i wish we were here again...thanx!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RJNUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 delightful nights at the Hotel du Pantheon last week. We arrived via Eurostar and took the RER from Gare du Nord to the Luxembourg station, which is only the nearest station to the hotel and meant no changing lines. A friendly greeting arrival awaited us and we were quickly in our room on the 4th floor directly looking onto the Pantheon. The staff at the hotel’s reception desk were always very helpful during our stay. Much has already been said in other reviews about the décor and the cleanliness of the rooms and we were more than satisfied with ours. It was certainly the best hotel room we have stayed in during various trips to Paris over the years. We decided to have breakfast in local cafes as opposed to eating in the hotel. The hotel is well located with plenty of cafes and restaurants within walking distance. We would highly recommend two restaurants just round the corner in the Rue St Jacques – “Au Part Salut” and “Restaurant Perraudin”, both serving traditional French food at a good price. The location of the hotel itself is excellent for anyone wanting to discover the “Left bank” area, being just of the Boulevard St Michel and 5 minutes from the Luxembourg gardens and about 10 - 15 minutes from the Seine and Notre Dame. The famous street market in Rue Mouffetard is about 10 minutes away and worth a visit. In all a highly recommended hotel and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and well located!”
Reviews.Author: DannyBoy069
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here from Sept 30 to Oct 2 in room 33 (my favoiurite number!) on level 3. Everything was as expected. Modern bathrooms, good bed, excellent location (2 minutes from Luxembourg RER which goes direct to CDG Airport), 24hr reception, great views of Pantheon (if you take this option!). Others have complained about the size of the bedroom but for singles or solo travellers it is just right. Would be hard to fit in another large suitcase if more than one. Staff are very friendly and speak English. One negative: brekkie is a bit expensive at EURO 13 compared to other hotels. Others have complained about elevator being small ...but why use the elevator in a 5 level hotel? Lazy! Stairs were nice to walk on. Good variety of shops within 3 mins on Rue Soufflot (incl. great but exxy patisserie and 24hr internet cafe) and St Jacques and some good bars in back of Pantheon where students hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Loaction”
Reviews.Author: littlejSomersetUK
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from this fantastic little hotel where we went for my husband's 50th. We booked because the recommendations on Trip Advisor were so good and were not disappointed. We had a superior room with view and what a view - we could almost touch the Pantheon. The room was small but not that small at Paris standards. We were on the fifth floor and our room was slightly smaller as we had a balcony. The room was newly decorated with every attention to detail - plenty of shelf and wardrobe space (and I do not travel light) and enough space to store two suitcases without getting in the way. Separate loo to bathroom which was great and we even had a bath - a rare experience in city hotels - although it was rather small for my 6ft 4in husband! Minibar and tv and newly fitted bathroom. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was very good - plenty of fruit, cereal, cold buffet style although we only ate in the breakfast room once and had the other breakfasts served in the room. Less choice in the room but much more restful! The area is great - we visited all the sites and also went further afield to Montmatre and Canal du Midi and nothing was further than 20 minutes on foot or by metro (about 5 mins walk away). there are plenty of places to eat nearby as it is the university district they are quite cheap - not the type of place to get a 5-star meal but perfectly adequate and reasonable. I would definitely go back and we have earmarked the hotel for any time we fancy a break to do the things we ran out of time for.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant gem in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: brauksim
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old daughter and I stayed at this lovely central hotel for a week and we both wish it could have been for longer! The hotel is located very close to the Luxembourg underground station, directly overlooking the striking Pantheon. Our room with en-suite was immaculate, comfortable and quiet. Above all, the staff were extremely helpful, knowledgeable and pleasant - assisting us with directions to get to places eg Disneyland and Versailles, film developing and even booking us in for an excellent evening at Bobino's Cabaret when places were at a premium! The staff could not have been better. The hotel is a short stroll to the shopping precinct of the Boulevard St 'Michelle, Notre Dame Cathedral and other central Parisian sights.There are a number of good value eateries nearby, a laundromat and a 24 hr internet cafe making the location of this hotel even more appealing. We have no hesitation in recommending a stay at the Hotel du Pantheon and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LizzyBusy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day break in Paris. We were incredibly fortunate to have chosen this hotel - one of many we came across, simply from Googling 3* and 4* hotels in the Latin Quarter. This hotel stood out mainly for it cost, location and I have to admit, we just liked the look of it on their web page. The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter, directly opposite the Pantheon, therefore very straightforward to find. We caught the RER train into Paris from Charles de Gaulle airport, and got off at Luxembourg, which is a five minute walk away from the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at about 11pm, and we were concerned as we hadn't told the hotel we would be arriving late. However, this wasn't a problem and the staff were welcoming. Our room was no. 45 and situated on the fourth floor, overlooking the back of the hotel. So, no view of the Pantheon but it meant that the room was incredibly quiet. We liked the room and thought it was everything a Parisien hotel should be - nicely decorated and furnished - but probably not your cup of tea if you like modern and cutting edge design. The room isn't huge but it is more than adequate for a city break. No tea and coffee making facilities but not sure if that is the norm in French hotels anyway. The bedroom and en-suite bathroom were spotlessly clean. You can have breakfast in the hotel but we didn't bother as there are plenty of places nearby. The nearst metro is Clunny, which is about a 10 to 15 minute walk away down Rue St Jacques, where it intersects Boulevard St Germain - again there are lots of places to have breakfast, coffee, etc around here. Notre Dame is then about a five minute walk from here. In summary, I would definitley recommend this hotel. It is well located, spotlesssly clean and suited us perfectly for our city break.

Reviews.Title: “They went out of their way to make our day!”
Reviews.Author: eightysix
Reviews.Content: After reading some good and bad reviews about Hotel du Pantheon, we decided to try our luck. We were so impressed! The service was amazing, and the staff were extremely accommodating. We were given recommendations on dining, phone cards, transportation, and more. Someone was even available at the front desk at 4 am! We loved the romantic style of our room, and it had a very nice view. Though it lacked a shower, there was a large, relaxing bathtub. Our room, the stairs, and the main lobby were clean. Though the elevator was not huge, it could fit all four of our luggage pieces (overhead-compartment size) as well as both of us. We had no complaints about it. In fact, we liked the old-fashioned feel. The Metro/RER stations were within walking distance, and the area was quiet at night (but not too quiet). We felt comfortable coming home late. And the restaurants, bakeries, people, and nearby nightlife made our stay vibrant. In short, our experience was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: laurencarter
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for business and I could not be more satisfied with my stay. It was quiet and peaceful and very cozy. The staff was incredibly helpful and generous and the breakfast- tres bien! It is also close to many beautiful sites, affordable cafes and transportation. Two thumbs up! I hope to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JayHSanJose_CA_
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hotel du Pantheon, and as always, was a tremendous experience. We love the location of the hotel, plus the rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable. The staff always goes out of their way to assist us in any way possible, arranging shuttles, confirming airline reservations, etc. Our room was not ready upon our return from Rome, so we were upgraded to a Superior room on the 5th floor with a phenomenal view of the Pantheon. It was a fabulous experience. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone I know traveling to Paris, and look forward to staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “great location, super confortable,clean,helpfull staff,big rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: verocori
Reviews.Content: it's a cosy hotel with a incredible location...it's right in front of the pantheon with an amazing view from all their windows and its only two blocks of the luxemburg station.The luxemburg station is one of the rer b, a metro main line. just in front of the metro station are the luxemburg's gardens, one mac donald which is open till late night, and about four blocks from the all nights opens bars and food store. it has a market around the corner wich is very cheap and it's allowed to put food into the minibar fridge. it's a very safe zone, me and my 11 years old son walked till 3 am and nothing happend ever. the hotel staff was the best in all our trip across europe. they speak several idioms and they are the most helpfull people you can imagine. the are the 24 hs at your service even for getting you a spoon or an ice cube.always with an smile the hole day and night. you have free internet acces at the reception desk. they have a confortable receptiond desk with armchairs and soft light , etc. you can have also acces from your room but sometimes the signal wasn't good enough. if you dont have a laptop you can walk one block and go to MILK, wich is a 24hs internet center, the hour is about 3 or 4 euros, but you can buy 5 night hours by 10 euros. the hotel is sourrounded by differents bistro where you can have lunch or dinner not so expensive. but if you walk 4 blocks you can see beautiful streets seemed came out from a paint with dozens of cheap restaurants and shawarma offers. the triple room is very spacious and has two different closets, large space between the beds, three big windows, a plasma tv, its decorated in a very french style.the shower was incredible, with a lot and a lot and a lot of hot water. the clean was awesome, i realised that after i went to anothers hotels. I can't tell about breackfast because we take it by our own in another places. the room has a safety box. you have a view from the eiffel tower from the corner. they have the cheapest rate in international calls, i have called to argentina at 0,29 euros per minute. it's incredible cheap compared to the regular price. i will be back next year to paris and no doubt i will stay at hotel du pantheon again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrific hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: banditspikealfie
Reviews.Content: I booked an 8-day stay through the hotel's website about six months ago due to reviews on Trip Advisor. I was looking for a non-smoking hotel with air conditioning in a safe area of Paris - and I wasn't interested in spending too many euros! I got everything I wanted and more in the Hotel du Pantheon. We had a superior room on the fifth floor (great view overlooking the Pantheon, which is a surprisingly interesting museum) with plenty of room (and we had three large suitcases). The hotel concierge staff was unbelievably friendly, most spoke fine English (our French was mediocre), and were always efficient in getting us information or dinner reservations. Americans aren't really used to small city hotels like this, but please be assured that this is a great hotel with great staff and plenty of room if you plan well. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel (we are late sleepers, but we heard it was pretty good). Paris food is expensive, so be sure to budget for it! Don't hesitate to book with this hotel. P.S. Do yourself a favor and pick up a copy of Sandra Gustafson's Great Eats Paris. UNBELIEVEABLE restaurant suggestions (great food at great prices), and the hotel concierge was great about making reservations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JQWD
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the hotel's web reservation center and had chosen the hotel through the advice of a friend and reviews on Trip Advisor. The views were terrific from the 6th floor corner room overlooking the Pantheon. The Luxemburg RER station was close by and we very conveniently took it from CDG to the hotel. Considering it was our first time to Europe, it seemed a bit daunting to take the train in when in reality it was much more simple and less expensive then taking the shuttle or the taxi in to Paris. The rooms were very clean, the hotel staff very polite and helpful in arranging tours and providing directions. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Paris and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Stallion1973
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews about this hotel, we decided to book a room but for some reason the reviews are not in a bullet point format that will enable the reader to make an assessment if this hotel is suitable or not. So here they are: The good: 1- Outstanding location. Close to the Metro, the Pantheon as well as many small mom and pops type of restaurants. 2- Nice reception area. Renovated and has a beautiful front lobby that acquainted us while waiting for a cab. 3- Priced reasonably at least 20 to 50 Euros below other comparable hotels. The bad: 1- Very small rooms. The rooms didn't fit our luggage. Every inch of this room is utilized by a bed, a night stand or a hallway to that leads to the bathroom and the front door. The bathroom is split into two segments, a toilet on the left hand of the hallway and the shower on the right hand of the hallway. Even the toilet room did not fit me trying to close the door. I had to step along the narrow side of the toilet in order for me to be able to close the toilet door. 2- Management attitude. The day we arrived, we asked the receptionist for additional towels and the receptionist responded by “I am not sure if I can get you some”. I then later informed him that I had a baby and thus I am in need of at least an additional towel he then stated that he’ll see what I can do and brought few afterwards. On our second day, feeling the Jet Lag coming from San Francisco, we had to take a noon nap. The Hotel Staff kept continuously knocking on the door and sometimes forcefully entering the room while we were sleeping. We were so knocked out, we didn’t even care. When we woke up, we simply asked for some towels since we didn’t get ours replaced and the lady busted out impolitely blaming us for not opening the door for the cleaning staff. We simply had to hang up the phone and just continued using their previous day’s towels. The hotel has one elevator that was out at least two of the four days we stayed there. The stairs to the rooms are very narrow. We had a baby on a stroller but the staff seeing my wife going down the narrow stairs didn’t even care about the safety of the baby or bothered to help her out. See also item 4 about the elevator. 3- Breakfast was reasonably priced at 12 Euros per person but it wasn’t worth the money. We ended up eating at the local café down the street. 4- As indicated above the Elevator was down two of the four days we were there. We hopped on it on one of those days “with a baby” and once it got to the fourth floor, it started skidding down. The repair service person was there to fix it afterwards but I am not sure why would they even have that thing up and running if it was skidding down. I had stayed in small hotels like this where the rooms were small or some facilities weren’t working at their best but I think most importantly, management attitude is really what makes a difference in your judgment about how great a place is or not. Management, even on a smaller level such as asking for directions wasn’t very responsive. I think if I knew that by saving those 20 to 50 Euros a day would have avoided me the hassle of dealing with their ill trained management, I would have paid it. Yet, hey, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNasagirl
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I stayed a week in this hotel. The location was great, walking distance to the metro, RER and restaurants. The room was clean and quiet. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: JSGordon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following a reccommendation from friends and it certainly proved to be worthwhile. The location is good for much of Paris - close to RER and Metro, good cafes around and close enough for a nice walk to Notra Dame etc. The rooms are smallish (big enough for a long weekend but not much longer than that) but the decor is splendid and the staff are very curteous and efficient. All in all a very good small, authentic hotel in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 60spink
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my visit in Paris and the Hotel du Pantheon proved to be an excellent base-from comfort, friendly staff and great location-the Hotel du Pantheon has it all. I had room #25 which overlooked a courtyard. The room was nicely decorated and spotless. The bed was comfortable. I heard no outside noise and only minimal noise from the room above, but I think that is because they were stomping around hard. I never heard any noise from the rooms on my floor. There is a little water -on- the- floor issue when showering, but as a previous person posted, nothing that the bath mat doesn't take care of. Really, its no big deal. I loved the tub, it was very deep-so it was perfect for taking a luxurious soak after a long day of walking. The staff was very friendly and professional. The cleaning staff did an excellent job throughout my stay. The hotel is close to several sites: Luxembourg Garden is 2 minutes, Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, the Conciergerie are about 15 minutes, the Cluny is 5-7 minutes and St. Sulpice about 10-15 minutes. The Cluny/La Sorbonne and Cardinal Limoine Metro stations are about 5-7 minutes. I highly recommend the Hotel du Pantheon and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveparis909
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel, we had such a wonderful stay. It was spotless, the entire bathroom was sparkling. Each and every staff member we met were helpful and friendly. No scaffolding in sight, in fact we went to the wrong side of the square when we arrived because we were drawn to the only place we saw covered up. Didn't mind paying 13 euro for breakfast, yummy fresh fruit and nut loaf with home made conserves was my fav but there was plenty of other stuff on offer. I had never been to Paris before and had thought that this location might not be as good as being right by the river, but it turns out that Hotel du Pantheon was the most perfectly located. Peaceful yet close to everything. So glad I ended up there than some of those hectic touristy streets that look ideal on a map. I can't think what more I can say other than this hotel was perfect, oh yeah I loved the cute prints of hotel staff down the stairway. Also re: the shower/water thing, we had a basic room and didn't find the bathroom small at all or that it flooded after a shower (of course there was a little but nothing that a bath mat couldn't solve). The lift: Fair size, yet I loved the stairwell so I always took those. If I am ever in Paris again (fingers crossed) this is where I will be.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Janeite
Reviews.Content: The scaffolding was still up when we arrived on April 4--although it was supposed to be gone by the end of February--but we had an excellent view of the Pantheon nonetheless. Our room on the 4th floor was small (like most in Paris), but prettily furnished and very clean. Storage space was limited and we had to use our ingenuity to stow all our bags from the previous weeks' cruise, but we managed. Although the location is very convenient, there is surprisingly little traffic on the Place and we found our room to be very quiet with the window closed, and comfortable with it open during the day. The only downside was the bed--it was a bit saggy--but we were always exhausted at the end of a day and slept quite soundly. As for the ongoing work, it really didn't bother us because we were so happy just to be in Paris. The reception people all speak excellent English and were very helpful about booking the airport shuttle, cabs, etc. We hope to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: NorwichOscar
Reviews.Content: My partner and I scoured reviews and publications to help us to search out a small friendly hotel in Paris. We were thrilled with location. Dissapointed at the scaffolding . Arriving at 1.30pm Sunday we were surprised to find no-one at Reception. We waited, coughing and the like for some 5 minutes. The receptionist arrived and we were very dissapointed with her demeanour. Throughout our stay we found her most unfriendly, off hand and to be perfectly honest this spoilt our stay. Whilst the view from our 6th floor room was stunning, breakfast was dissapointing. 13Eu each, extra for eggs, ham cheese. For the money there are clearly better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Covered in scaffolding - such a shame”
Reviews.Author: clarew83
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights staying at the hotel du pantheon direct through the hotel website - cost about £270 for the 3 nights. There was NO mention of building work at the time of booking or before our stay. We were really looking forward to staying at this hotel - especially as the hotel advertised "great views of the pantheon!" however when we arrived the hotel was covered in scaffolding. See the photo i posted for the view from the room! Our room (No. 1) was right in reception so was not only noisy from all the people coming and going, but the building work started at 8am each morning.It was so noisy - we could hear rubble falling past our window. When I asked to be moved rooms I was told that they were full and we could not be moved. When I asked for some refund I was told this was not possible. They admitted that they forgot to let us know about the building work but wouldn't give us any compensation. The reception woman was rude. She said that the room was already discounted because of the building work (I didn't think it was a particularly cheap rate) Anyway we didn't let it spoil our hol but just want to warn others about our experience. On the positive side - breakfast was gorgeous and the staff serving it were lovely. Also the location is great for seeing Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, quaint room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzylichfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a weekend break with my boyfriend in January. I have stayed in Paris 7 times previously and this was the best place i have resided in so far. I have stayed in the Hilton, Marriot etc but they lack any local charm and quite frankly you could be anywhere. The Hotel Dun Pantheon is small but well decorated and in an excellent location. The room was very quaint with a wooden beamed ceinling and front facing overlooking the Pantheon. As my favorite area for nightlife, the latin quarter is a 5 minute walk i was more than pleased with the location. The staff were friendly and despite arriving at 10.30am out room was ready. My only complaint would be that the hotel states that it has a bar. The bar is actually a drinks cabinet in the reception/ lounge area, which was still lovely but the memeber of staff on nights did not have a key for it. I quite like having that one last night cap before bed so we were told to use the mini bar. Other than that i would highly reccoment this hotel, i intend to return to Paris around Christmas time with my Mum and will choose this hotel if the rates continue to be reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: d00bht
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights just before Christmas and thought it was gorgeous. The hotel had some scaffolding up but we had been warned. The location is fine really close to RER (4 mins walk) and only 7 mins walk to the metro. The room was pretty - beautifully decorated (very French) and an ok size for two (we were in a superior with view). The bathroom was lovely and looked very new. Breakfast was included in our rate and was fine pastry and fruit but prob not worth it if not inc in your rate. The staff were lovely and we thought it was a great value stay in Paris. I would definately go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 13drt
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel!! Location was awesome. It was a distance from the nearest Metro, but you were able to stroll through a great part of the Latin Quarter to get there. Easy access to all of Paris, 5 min to Notre Dame. The view was obstructed with the construction, but what do you want to be in your hotel room for? The only view I care about I can see in a room with no windows, if you know what I mean. We stayed in #30, and it was very spacious. Plenty of room for bags, and ample room in the bedroom. The shower was a little tricky, so take baths, they're funner together anyway! Great stay, and plan to return! Deli's Cafe right around the corner on Soufflot is great. Try the Raspberry and Chocolate tarts, together!!! There is a fantastic bakery toward the Metro stop at Monge. Fantastic quiesce! And across the streat is a great place (Le Grenier) for fondue, and the Rose table wine is really good. Anyway, from what I saw, and researched like crazy, this is one of the best and most affordable in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hard to find”
Reviews.Author: hi2wc2000
Reviews.Content: This tiny hotel was a cute hotel with a very small room. However, my wife and I did get used to the size of the room. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nice, however the shower stall only had a partial door that let out a ton of water on the bathroom floor so bathing was difficult. Overall, the location near the park and metro line was great. However we did have a difficult time finding the hotel as there were no signs out and a few other hotels next door did. We walked around the Pantheon a few times. The construction on the building made it hard to tell that it was a hotel. Yet, our stay here was problem free. The staff was pleasant, and the accommodations were sufficient for a good nights rest after a day out in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small and very dry air”
Reviews.Author: Wasatch08
Reviews.Content: Cute Parisian location, near Luxembourg Gardens, Latin Quarter, etc. Room was small, very dry air, although nice view of Monmartre and the actual Pantheon. There are better places, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at a Classic Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllTerra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days during our honeymoon. The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful. The room was downright expansive for Paris (we booked a superior room early). The furnishings were attractive and comfortable and our upper room had beautiful views across the city. We were also thrilled with the location! A few minutes walk to Ile de la Cite and the Latin Quarter. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel but I highly recommend Les Fontaines instead. Walk one block towards the Eiffel Tower. It is on the left. Like some other reviewers, we had trouble not getting water all over the bathroom floor. Perhaps the management will reconsider shower curtains. Be aware! the elevator is very small and a little underpowered. If you have a lot of luggage or a problem with stairs this is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disapointed”
Reviews.Author: clarabow35
Reviews.Content: I booked 7 rooms for a party of 14 for the first weekend in December. we paid extra for 4 rooms which were supposed to have 'Spectacular views of the Pantheon' unfortunately they had just covered the building in scaffolding and guaze so no view was to be had. They said they could not give us a discount as we had already pre paid but offered free breakfast for our whole party. I was really disapointed as candid pictures on tripadvisor sold this hotel to me and we were not told in advance of any work to becarried out. As I regulary take small groups on trips I try to research all hotels well and upon arriving this hoterl did not give a good first impression. The bedrooms were fine (very hot) and the bathrooms modern. The breakfast (12 euros) was ok a bit expensive for basic continental but we never paid anyway. The reception staff were pleasant and friendly. We all had a good weekend but I would choose another hotel if I were to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a short-break”
Reviews.Author: RetiredofSheffield
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris from St Pancras by train - what an easy journey and conveniently the RER B goes from Paris Nord to the Pantheon via Lxembourg Metro. The room was decorated like the inside of a beautiful chocolate box - fabrics on the walls and a 4 poster bed. We were on a short break to celebrate a birthday of a "certain age" and the hotel was delightful for such an occasion. Once you have your bearings you can be at the Notre Dame in 15 minutes via a downhill stroll. There were plenty of brasseries, restaurants and bars on the doorstep and with the metro 3 minutes away we could eat locally or anywhere in Paris within 20 minutes. The breakfast was excellent and at 12 euros we thought good value - most places were 8 euros for a continental. Given we had a wide range of choices and non-stop drinks I would certainly pay my money to the hotel and start the day in a relaxed way. The staff were always polite and inobtrusive. we will certainly consider the Pantheon forfuture visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: AnnyinLA
Reviews.Content: Nice, well-run and well-located but not fabulous. We stayed here due to rave reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites. Reserved a regular room (not deluxe) using the hotel's website, which has the best rates. This is a pleasant place, with good front desk staff, but not spectacular as some reviews (and the web site) imply. I loved the location as we could open the windows and still have moderate quiet, and it is close to good restaurants and RER B. Room was good size for Paris and clean, ditto bathroom, but bed was hard, and sheets and towels were low quality. Housekeeping was erratic - once we were left with zero toilet paper and had to ask downstairs. The small tube TV was supposed to have foreign channels, but they didn't work and the front desk had to get their tech guy to fix that - twice - and we gave up the third time. All in all, it is a good choice, but would be improved by upgrading the sheets and towels (which were worthy of a Motel 6).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: westham07
Reviews.Content: Despite our room not being ready, the staff took the trouble to sort this out quickly and efficiently. After that, everything was great. The superior room was still small, but really nicely decorated, and very comfortable. Depite being in a fairly busy location, the noise of the morning traffic did not disturb us and we would recommend this hotel as an excellent step up from the "budget hotels" so prevalent in Paris. Prices for breakfast were a bit steep, but great to be able to have it in our room. However, there was loads of it, and we would suggest that 1 breakfast between 2 people would be sufficient for most... or there are great cafes just down the road... There was a metro strike when we were there, but that just made us walk more, and we saw much more of Paris as a result. This hotel is centrally located so walking was an option. Overall, a great place to do the Paris city break...

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineCS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for four nights in the first week of November - which is well worth noting as they have a very low rate at this time of the year if you book via the hotel web site! I paid € 100,- for the room without breakfast (an additional €12,-) and that is very good value for what you get. I had room 63 on the sixth floor and it was a wonderful and tastefully done up little nest high above the streets of Paris, I loved it! It had a small but very quaint balcony and everything was spotlessly clean and just perfect for me. The bed was about 120cm wide which is great for a single person but not really for two people unless they are very slim or possibly for children, so watch out and make sure you get a properly sized bed if there's two of you! The only drawback are the people at the reception, there was a different one every day and of the five receptionists there was one very helpful and friendly one, the others were not exactly rude but certainly a bit huffy. One gets the impression of students being employed for the job, the attitude is not a professional one. If I had paid more I would have minded but for the price I got, oh well. Also the overall atmosphere and the decor of the place is just lovely and the location is very pleasant, not far from the Jardin du Luxembourg and you can walk to Notre Dame (about 20 minutes). It is true that the next Metro station is not very close, about a ten minutes walk away, but that is just a nice morning stroll, so I did not mind. Oh yes, and breakfast is lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Hotel du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Aussie099
Reviews.Content: The location was picturaesque but a fair walk to the nearest Metro. The hotel room was comfortable if a bit fussy. The shower was the worst shower in all the 21 hotels (and cities ) we stayed in. Every time we showered the floor was flooded no matter how careful we were. This was because of the poor design of the shower screen. The hotel staff were quite cool and unhelpful. When we were leaving we requested a taxi the night before and then first thing the next morning, but they said none were available and suggested we drag our heavy International suitcases onto a bus to get to the TGV train connection. They couldn't have cared less. The breakfast was chaotic. In the end we ate for four mornings at the local cafe round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the location”
Reviews.Author: Tooyoung4grandkids
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Paris, Sept. 10-14, 2007. We really liked the location, very close to Ile-de-la-Cite, easy walking to many sites, and a pleasant neighbourhood, especially the Saint Germain des Pres area. Rooms: the usual small, French country decor, charming room that one can expect in Paris. Also the same thin walls and small, slow elevator that is common in these old, charming buildings. The one thing we did not enjoy at Du Pantheon was the bathroom. Although decorated nicely, the problem with water spraying all over the floor during showers has caused a very bad mildew smell in the room we stayed in. We had to leave the bathroom window open at all times, which meant street noise at night, and early morning traffic noise. All in all, the hotel was similar to the New Orient, where we stayed our first visit, except we paid more at du Pantheon for the location. A note: the staff at du Pantheon were very friendly and helpful in finding our way around, and choosing restaurants. I also owe them a great thank you for finding and returning my itinerary, which I would have missed greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: nulawlady
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Hotel du Pantheon met our expectations. It wasn't the most amazing place we've ever stayed, but we never expected it to be. The atmosphere is very French Country, and very quaint! The service was, for the most part, friendly! (Although there was one night attendant who just simply needed a personality). And, everyone did a great job of forgiving my terrible french and speaking english to the best of their ability, which was good! Room: We had a room overlooking the Pantheon. We requested a room with a balcony, but didn't get one. No big deal, as we knew it wasn't a guarantee. The room was bigger than we expected, probably influenced by the fact that we arrived in Paris from London, known for their small hotel rooms. The one down point of the room was the closet, or lack thereof. There really wasn't a proper closet. There also were no drawers to store our clothes, which was also a disappointment. Other than that, however, the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: mbagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Du Pantheon for 5 days at the start of our honeymoon. It was our first time in Paris and we wanted a hotel that was easily accessible, in a nice neighbourhood with restaurants and cafes nearby, and was within walking distance to the main tourist attractions. The Hotel fit the bill on all accounts. Our room had a fantastic view looking out onto the Pantheon. The room was clean and decorated in a typical quaint Parisian style. Hotel staff were generally friendly and helpful. The hotel breakfast was fine with croissants, fruit cocktail, yogurt, juices, deli slices and cheese, and coffee and tea. The menu was the same every day save for the one day when there were crepes offered (very yummy with nutella!). The local area was very safe and not too noisy. There were some great cafes nearby on Rue Sufflot and north of the hotel on Rue Monge. Only drawback was the hotel sat on a bit of a hill so no matter what direction you approached it from, it was always an uphill walk. The hotel is in a good location with the Jardins du Luxembourg, Louvres, shops of St. Germain des Pres, and Notre Dame all within a short walk. As well, the Luxembourg RER train station is very close by, making it easy go to and from the airport via the train.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: farstar22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for the third time, bringing my 81 year old mother with me. Our room, overlooking the Pantheon, was small but lovely and well laid out, with everything we needed. The bathroom was spacious and bright with a huge glazed window facing the Mairie du Veme. We enjoyed receiving our Parisian cousins and friends in the beautiful salon downstairs. Norbert, who greeted me by name, and the other staff persons are kind, discreet and professional. The breakfast room is pretty but you can do better at the many cafes and bakeries nearby. We enjoyed dinner twice at the nearby wine bar/restaurant Le Vin Qui Danse. For those who find two short blocks too far to walk to the metro (not my Mom!) there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. I love staying at the Hotel du Pantheon!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, clean, a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Vivianite
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Pantheon is a perfectly nice hotel, with very pretty rooms, and mostly polite staff. Our room had a minibar with prices that weren't exorbitant, a sparking clean bathroom and a view of the Pantheon. The latter is less a draw than you might think, as the Pantheon is one of the stodgiest, least elegant buildings of Paris. On the Saturday night of our stay, there were crowds of students gathered in the Place du Pantheon, laughing and shouting and riding motorbikes until 5am. At other times, the immediate vicinity was chockful of tourists and completely devoid of the cafes, shops, and oddities that make Paris neighborhoods so compelling, but at least the nights were quiet. Behind the Place du Pantheon, there's more of a Parisian neighborhood atmosphere, geared largely to the university students of the area. For first-time or infrequent visitors to Paris, this pleasant hotel could be a good choice, although the lack of a close Metro stop would be a moderate liability to those who don't like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: ShinAbergavenny
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the Pantheon, the view was worth the upgrade to a superior room. Really comfortable and so Parisian. Staff too were most helpful. The location is all you could wish for. Try Perraudin for dinner - its just around the corner and we had one of our best meals there. The Odeon, the Seine, Ile de Cite - all within walking distance. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/location”
Reviews.Author: tkool59
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Pantheon in late August, 2007and had a very nice stay. Rooms were clean. Great location with easy access from and to airports and metro system. Overal quiet location, with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. Slightly understaffed at times is my only complaint. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, little french hotel”
Reviews.Author: twinsmimi
Reviews.Content: This lovely little hotel is perfectly situated in the 5th arrondissement.. It is VERY french, clean, and quaint. The rooms are very small (as all seem to be in Europe unless you are prepared to pay $1000 or up a nite) the en-suite bathroom was also tiny...but well appointed. Nice tile and all amenites.
