We loved staying there and would definetly recommend it. One just can't expect the "huge rooms and bathrooms" we have in America. All the employees were very helpful...and did speak english...and you can walk to some lovely restaurants, little bakeries, and sidewald cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary!!”
Reviews.Author: rb2007
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay for our 10th wedding anniversary - no kids!! Excellent location - easy to get to from CDG via RER. Walking distance of the river and Notre Dame. Hotel was excellent. Rooms are reasonable size, nicely decorated, clean. Yes water from the shower ends up flooding the bathroom floor - not great but not a problem. Quiet location but fantastic location opposite the Pantheon. Some good restaurants nearby - would recommend La Lozere which is probably a 10 minute stroll. Excellent food/excellent value. Would probably skip the breakfast - it was fine/adequate but if the weathers nice would sit outside somewhere. Did a lot of walking - next time would get a 3 day pass for the Batobus. Would love to go again and would be more than happy to stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in central, but quiet location”
Reviews.Author: tigger77Bristol
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the rave reviews on this site and on the whole they were fairly accurate, if not a little gushing. Our room was small, but tidy and comfortable, with a surprising amount of storage. The decoration was typically Parsian and a refreshing change from the sterile environment of larger chain hotels. Despite listing a BBC channel, the only English Speaking TV channel was CNN. The bathroom was fairly large, considering the size of the room, but the shower soaked the whole room when used. The location was fab. Very central, a short walk away from Notre Dame, Saint Chappelle etc, but it was so quiet and obviously it was a delight to come out every morning and see the very impressive Pantheon on your doorstep. If you are getting the RER from the airport, it is a direct line to Luxenbourg. Useful if you have a lots of luggage. The staff were friendly. We never tried the breakfast as we were able to find much cheaper alternatives in the small cafes and fast food places which were very close to the hotel. Overall a pleasant stay in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 25thanniversary25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pantheon for 4 nights in August. After a night of heavy rains, our room had a leak in the ceiling. After we notified the desk, they moved us right away - which was great! A bigger room for the same price! The various staff at the desk were very helpful and we asked many questions. Breakfast was great (cereal, fruit, make your own crepes, yogurt, cheese, pastries) Eggs were extra. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Douglas16
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The bedroom was charming, and although the bathroom was small it was fine. Above all it was really clean. We had a lovely view of the Pantheon and air conditioning. Not to be sniffed at. Not all Paris hotels have AC and trust me you need it on a hot August night. The staff were super friendly and really helpful. We had breakfast out every day but did decide to try it on our last day. This is where the hotel fell down. We walked in and were disappointed with the choise and quality. Mind you it was 10.00 and they close at 10.30 but even so we expected a better lay out. Needless to say we didn't stay. But, in summary, a great hotel, great value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay, but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Memory23
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th visit to Paris and my first time at the Hotel du Pantheon. (the hotel that we usually stay in is in the same area but was fully booked) Having read all the fabulous reviews about Hotel du Pantheon on Trip Advisor, I was extremely disappointed in my 3 day stay there. The location is great and the staff is helpful but the room itself is just so, so. and not that charming. The mattress was extremely uncomfortable and needs to be replaced and the shower made everything in the bathroom wet. The whole place could use a face-lift. I have always been a big fan of trip advisor but now I am beginning to doubt the reviews. I would not reccomend Hotel du Pantheon to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryborough
Reviews.Content: I spent two great days in Hotel du Pantheon in July. Very enjoyable. The best views are on the two top floors, but in fact every room seems to have a view, either of the square in which the pantheon is built or of the side street leading off it. The only disadvantage is that the nearest metro station is a bit of a walk - but, on the other hand, the location is easy to explain to taxi drivers!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Pantheon - great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lovewineandfood
Reviews.Content: We are a Canadian couple from near Toronto and wanted the perfect "France experience" so I spent quite a bit of time in advance researching the various places we would stay via TripAdvisor. We loved our 4-day stay at the Hotel du Pantheon! Our room was nicely decorated and very clean. The maid service had the bed changed and clean towels provided before we returned back each of the four days we spent there. The front-desk hotel staff was great! The location was superb - a view of the Eiffel Tower from very near the front of the hotel and the Pantheon just a stone's throw away. The Luxembourg gardens just a block away! Great brasseries, bistros, a pharmacie, coffee shops, and a superb boulanger nearby. (The boulanger just half a block "up" from the hotel had outstanding baguettes, croissants and mouthwatering sandwiches and pastries, all for unbelievably low prices! We often went there first thing each day to buy stuff in advance for our lunch that day and then ate "picnic-style" wherever we ended up.) The hotel was in an excellent location for travelling to and from Charles de Gaulle airport via the RER (train) line "B". The Luxembourg stop is less than a 5-minute walk to the hotel, and an easy walk even with luggage. Very easy location on the left-bank for walking to many great Paris "must-dos" like rue St Germain, the Seine, etc. and, along with the 5-day metro/RER pass we each bought, Versailles, the airport, etc. were all easily accessible and cheap to get to. Due to its unique positioning near the Pantheon, the hotel's location was extremely quiet at night given its central Paris location! Wireless internet access was not working the week we were there but we were able to use our laptop in the lobby of the "sister hotel" - Hotel des Grands Hommes - next door, also an excellent hotel choice! We would most definitely return when visiting Paris again. Absolutely no question! (When booking, be careful to first check sites like venere.com and bookings.com which offered our room for 99 Euros per night rather than the 105 Euros and 129 Euros that we paid through the hotel website.) You will not be disappointed with Hotel du Pantheon! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and location”
Reviews.Author: heleleat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely boutique hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. I could not have been happier. The location was excellent - close to subway and sights of Paris. The hotel was small and personal. My room was beautiful, with fabric panelled walls, and a wonderful balcony with 2 chairs and a table with views of Paris - perfect for sitting out in the evening and drinking red wine and eating cheese and bread. The staff were very helpful and spoke in English well. The only criticism I could think of was the transport that the hotel organized for me to the airport. The limousine service did not show up resulting in trying to get a taxi on a wet day in Paris. I almost missed my flight. I would not recommend using the transport recommended by the hotel at all. Taxi is fine. Everything else was perfect and I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: db70disco
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Du Pantheon to be a charming and rustic place to stay in a great location in Paris. The rooms were large and had a spectacular view of the pantheon, not all rooms have a view however. The service there was great, especially the breakfast which can be taken in your room (free of charge) or in the main dining room in the basement. The beds were not the most comfortable in the world but definately acceptable for our two night stay in Paris. You can walk to the metro train stop (Cardinal Lemoine) but it's a good 4 blocks away, definately doable and we used this stop for our excursions to Paris, any farther and it would have been far in our opinion though. Definitely use the Metro, it's easy, cheap and convenient. Great view of the eiffel tower in the distance from the front steps of the pantheon at night too. Also, if you are considering the Hotel Grand Hommes, it's right next door, so both hotels are in a great location for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ItalyMid30s
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend a romantic weekend in Paris with my wife, and after checking different reviews on Tripadvisor, we opted for this hotel.Well, it was beyond our expectations. The location is perfect for exploring a nice area of Paris; besides, we had a room with a fantastic view of the Pantheon. The decor of the rooms is not your usual algid hotel wallpaper and furniture, which adds to the charm of the place. Overall, a nice and romantic little hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Everything”
Reviews.Author: nicholsga
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excellent location for sights, and train to Airport, etc. Room was spacious, bathroom had large tub and shower, and separte room for toilet, view of Pantheon, air conditioning, honor bar. Great breakfast room, nice lobby, and you can get ice if you ask! Weekend rate was 99 Euro a night. No complaints - we will stay there again. Vancouver, WA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel...Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: JonNat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our travel agent, and we are happy to have taken her advice. This was our first trip to Paris, for our 20th anniversary, and we found this hotel to be a great place from which to explore this amazing city...at a great price. Our room, which was upgraded at the request of our travel agent, was on the third floor and had a great view of the very impressive Pantheon. We had a little difficulty finding the hotel at first, because our maps were not very detailed in this part of the city. However, all you need to do is go to the front steps of the Pantheon then look to your right. The hotel is literally steps away. The Luxembourg RER stop is three blocks away (right next to McDonald's and just across the street from the Luxembourg Garden). To save some money getting to the hotel from CDG airport (if you don't have too many bags) just take the RER straight to Luxembourg - you don't even have to change trains. Also, within a stop or two on the RER you catch any number of metro lines and go anywhere in downtown Paris. Very convenient! Our room was small, but I understand this is typical of Paris. Nevertheless, it was pleasantly decorated and quite comfortable. The bed was nice, and the bathroom (across the hall from the toilet) was clean and adequate. The elevator is a bit rickety, and the front desk staff were a little aloof. However, when I asked for assistance they were always helpful. They arranged a shuttle to CDG that saved us some Euros on our way home. Restaurant tips: - Le Fetes Galant (other side of Pantheon and down the hill a block) is a great little restaurant staffed by two people. Follow the servers recommendations and you won't go wrong. - Polidor (a few blocks away) is very casual and bohemian, and the beef bourguignon was terrific. - Le Relais de l'Entrecote (two locations) for delicious steak and fries - Le Bon Marche grocery (38, rue de Sèvres) is beyond belief, and the pastries are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ValenciaSp
Reviews.Content: It is the third time that I stay at this hotel. The last two on the sixth floor. The rooms are small (normal in Paris) but they are nicely decorated (paper wall, wooden beams, cute lamps) and very clean. The location is excellent, right opposite the Pantheon and within a quiet area full of students going to Sorbone University. The RER is down the road, a10 minutes walk. The staff is very friendly and ready to help. Breakfast is served on the basement and is very ok. The only thing is that you should not be in a hurry during it because the service can be a bit slow. It is not cheap (it depends on the season) but it is good value for money. I will certainly come back each time I travel to Paris if you travelers let me!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: vwarren
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel du Pantheon. We took the train from the airport to the Luxembourg stop and the hotel is literally two blocks away...really easy! Our room was really comfortable and quite large with a very nice bathroom. We were walking distance to Notre Dame and all the exitement in the Latin Quarter. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: volney
Reviews.Content: If one is seeking a good hotel in a splendid location with fine and cordial service at a fair price this hotel should be considered. Across the street from the pantheon and the Sarbone it has charm comfort and enough class to satisfy discerning guests. Like other Paris hotels rooms rather small but nice French doors and balconies, even in the bath make rooms seem more spacious. We were treated as old and familiar guests even though our first stay. They were excelent in arranging airport transportation and were ever ready to be helpful. Best overall value we have encountered after several Paris visits.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Hemingway's Paris”
Reviews.Author: Havana-O
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon several times. It is a charming place, reasonably priced, with small but comfortable and clean rooms and a great Left Bank location on the Place du Pantheon near the Luxembourg Gardens, easy walks to the famous Montparnasse and St. Germain cafés, and also to the Seine and Notre Dame. The nearby rue Moffetard, starting at the Place Contrescarpe, is one of Paris's great market streets. Ernest Hemingway lived near there when he first went to Paris in the 1920's and his apartment house, at 74 rue Cardinal Lemoine, is marked with a plaque. If you're interested in walking "Hemingway's Paris," the Hotel du Pantheon is a very fine place to start.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: MoJo10
Reviews.Content: Simply Wonderful! We would definiately stay here again, next time we visit Paris!!!! Clean, Cute, Affordable and close to all the sites!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: madla07
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay in France where we started our holiday with a stay at Hotel du Pantheon. We loved the peaceful location, the clean rooms, and its close proximity to many sites. The staff was excellent in accommodating our needs. At night we would cross the street to sit at the front of the Pantheon and watch the lights of the Eiffel Tower come on. While our room was small by American standards, we felt it was comparable to, or larger than, other rooms we've rented in Europe. Our bathroom was enormous, everything was very clean and very comfortable. We met several people who said they stay there every time they travel to Paris. I would definitely stay here my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - quiet while being in a busy part of town”
Reviews.Author: LtnCOTravelers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a couple of the Paris hotels and the Hotel du Pantheon is my favorite. It's on a quiet square (Place du Pantheon), within walking distance of many of the areas of Paris for strolling, and close to the Metro. The staff is wonderful; friendly and helpful. Why I like this hotel the best: It's on a quiet street (no loud cars all night long) but within walking distance of the Latin Quarter and the Marias - two very busy areas of Paris. No cafes or brasseries right next door, but within a block. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the steps of the Pantheon is outstanding and it's right outside the front door. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for something in the center of Paris, but a step away from the busy streets and sidewalks.

Reviews.Title: “Charming - Great location”
Reviews.Author: SG47
Reviews.Content: Bon Jour. Charming hotel. Worth the value. Check out their rates on their web site. I found the best rates that way. Reserve well in advance (2 months, if possible). My wife and I stayed for 2 weeks in room 62 (top floor, corner room). Beautiful view. You can order a chilled bottle of champagne to be in your room upon your arrival. A nice way to start the party. Had a WONDERFUL time in Paris. Fell in love with the people, the culture, the beauty and charm of the city. It is special. (HINT: For those who are not familiar with the culture, customs and habits of the French, it is highly recommended that you learn to start each, any, every and all contacts with any French citizen with "BON JOUR MADAM / MONSIEUR" [or bon soir, during the evening]. It is considered very rude not to do this and will be considered an affront to the person with whom you are trying to communicate. They will then treat you with disdain, as if you have insulted them personally, which you have. [This is why some Americans beleive the French to be 'rude', when in fact, it is a reaction towards our bad manners, due to our lack of knowledge as to their customs and habits]. Greeting others in this way is essential. This includes all hotel staff including the maids, and when dining, the waiters, who are PROFESSIONALS (at least, most of them are) and should be treated accordingly. If you do not speak French [as I do not] then learn the phrase: "No parlez vous Francais. Parlez vous Anglais?". People will be very helpful if you at minimum give an attempt at speaking their language. There is much to learn, and if you do your homework, you'll have a FANTASTIC time. The hotel room is generally small, but not too small. This was expected, so not a problem. Nice view of Le Pantheon (be SURE to go in and explore), and in the distance, Sacre Couer. Everything was in working order; the room was clean and well maintained. Staff was generally helpful and always polite (especially Michael and Christian on the night staff). There is an elevator (very small but it worked) that gets you upstairs. Be sure to bring an electrical converter for laptops, etc. The hotel has wireless and it is at no cost. Neighborhood was excellent. Some restaurants within walking distance were very good. Make reservations for Les Papilles at 30 Rue Gay Lussac about four blocks from the hotel. And a small bar for locals that was beyond belief, where on Saturday nights, a wonderful French woman singer/accordian player played and sang old French songs, locals danced, drank, sang, etc. The bar is just down the street from Egliese St. Etienne (the 13th Century church with Gothic exterior, gargoyles, and AMAZING wooden rood in the interior...kind of a mini-Notre Dame...check it out...it is beautiful). The church is on the other side of Le Pantheon (kitty-corner from the hotel). Morning time, you can walk to the Mouffetard district (about five blocks away) or walk down to Deli's Cafe (down Rue Soufllot towards Blvd. St-Michael) where you can get espresso and croissant, etc. for a reasonable price. Anywhere else, you are paying a LOT for breakfast. I suggest you save your money for lunch, which is THE meal of the day in Paris. One restaurant for the evening that I can recommend: Le Reminet at 3 Rue Des Grands-Degres (have the staff print out a map for you as it is a very small street on the Left Bank just off the Seine, and just to the east of Notre Dame). Ask to be seated in the downstairs room. Very romantic and intimate setting. The hotel staff can call to make reservations for you (recommended). Try the desert of the small cake from Bourgogne with the honey ice cream, almond milk and carmalized apricots. Anything this good should be illegal. Learn to use the Metro to get around town. Do a lot of walking. Museums, shopping, eating, drink the French wine, go on day trips to Versailles, or Giverney. Go to jazz clubs. The Flea Market was a trip. We were lucky enough to catch a Roger Waters (Pink Floyd) concert while we were in town. It rocked. Next trip: to the South of France, Provence, Cote D'Azour. Bring plenty of money. Bon voyage.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cute but small”
Reviews.Author: wuthering72
Reviews.Content: There's not much new to say about this little hotel. The location is perfect, the view in the evening over the Pantheon is lovely. Everything in the hotel is spotlessly clean, pretty, well maintained. We booked the upgraded room and were given room 52. It was a good view, but if that was the upgraded size, then, I can't imagine the regular rooms. It was tiny; I couldn't actually walk between the end of the bed and this huge piece of furniture, I had to turn sideways. Not really an issue since you're only in the room to shower and sleep. Don't book the hotel's breakfast for 12 euros. Just down the street to the left of the hotel is a very small cafe called Deli's cafe or something...croissant, coffee, fresh OJ for 4.50euros. And there's a great crepe place across the street, creps to go (or something equally cheesy, but it's good food and cheap wine).

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Pantheon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglishwomanBp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and stylish, set in a quiet and picturesque square, just a 10-minute walk from Notre Dame. Rooms are lovely, especially those with a view of the Pantheon just opposite. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is great - but the 12Euros per person came as a surprise when we paid our bill on the last day, as I had not seen this information on the hotel web site.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: richardsoden
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from the Metro (RER Luxembourg), surrounded by great bistro's and restaurants, and right in front of the Pantheon. We stayed there for 3 nights over the weekend, and it was an excellent base to see the sights of Paris. Peaceful in the evening, there were plenty of places to eat close to the hotel to rest our feet after walking all day.

Reviews.Title: “Civilised and central.”
Reviews.Author: RichardsLancashire
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel which has the double bonus of being both at the heart of things [A minute from the Sorbonne; fifteen minute leisurely stroll to the Ile-de-la-Cite and literally across the street from the Pantheon] and yet also unhurried and civilised with excellent staff who were most helpful. This was our first trip to Paris and the hotel's ambience was a contributory factor to a memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “high price for small rooms”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a Standard Room of the Pantheon Hotel for 3 nights and had once again a very good time in the fantastic city of Paris. The location of this hotel is OK, but the (standard) rooms are very small and for this size too expensive. Do realise that not all rooms have a view on the Pantheon. The rooms are well decorated and clean. The elevator cannot contain more than 2 persons and sometimes does not work. The water pressure of the shower is low in the morning. There is no storage room for luggage. Many previous reports on the hotel are too positive. There are many nice places in Paris and the Pantheon is just one of them. In my view this hotel is an average 2-star hotel on a good location. More critical reviews may lead to a better price-quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: danl8619
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in April and I am so glad to have picked this property. The location was perfect.In the universty area, walking distance to Latin quarter and the Seine, Notre Dame and Luxembourg Gardens.Very easy to use the RER from the airport,just one train. Our maid service was excellent,room service perfect,and the room was great with great views.We did book a superior room. The front desk were very proffesional and polite.This is a very good choice for the romance found in Paris.The other reviews about this hotel were all correct.The owners do a very good job here and really know how to please there guests. The Easter chocolates on Easter sunday were a very nice token on how they appreciate their guests.If you a first time vistor like me this is how Paris should be.

Reviews.Title: “Paris vist - March 2007”
Reviews.Author: sbull
Reviews.Content: As it was our first visit to Paris we read many reviews on Trip Advisor to find the best place to stay. We decide to stay at the Hotel Du Pantheon and it did not disappoint us. The staff were very well presented, polite and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and they offered good advice. The only downside was that we upgraded to a room with a balcony but all the room had was a window box of flowers. It might, however, have made the room overlook the Pantheon rather than out of the back of the hotel. We would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The location and view are excellent and the staff pleasant and helpful. I would recommend getting a superior room. This is what we did and it wasn't huge so I would imagine a standard room would be pretty small. The superior room was absolutely fine, it was clean and the decor was quirky and very 'French'. The bed was also very comfortable. There is no restaurant and the bar is very small but there are more than enough restaurants and bars within the vicinity that this didn't matter at all. Will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: boymomOmaha
Reviews.Content: My husband and teenage son just returned from a 7 night stay at the Hotel du Pantheon and were so pleased with our choice. We booked the family suite which was great for us. The rooms were not connected, but our son is a teenager..so that arrangement was perfect. The staff was so helpful in booking dinner reservations, setting up tours and giving us directions to the many places we visited. It is a quaint hotel that is located in a central location in Paris. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping services were excellent We have stayed in two other hotels in Paris, and this is by far our favorite. We will definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pantheon: Great Location”
Reviews.Author: par376
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel located very cose to the centre of Paris, and particularly close to all the restaurants and sights of the Left Bank. The rooms were very clean and beautifully decorated, with all modern facilities and surprisingly spacious given the proximity to the centre. Excellent value for money and difficult to beat for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Filled expectations”
Reviews.Author: timok
Reviews.Content: Last week, I spent 5 holiday nights at Hotel du Pantheon with my wife. We wanted a hotel near a train station from CDG airport to the city. First, we checked the neighbourhood of Gare du Nord, but very many Tripadvisor hotel reviews were bad. So we "changed to the other side" of Seine, with Luxembourg station as the reference point. This selection alone was succesful, because when using much the RER-train , metro or bus, Gare du Nord would have been terrible. When we found Hotel du Pantheon with exceptionally positive and numerous Tripadvisor reviews, we were sold. The price to quality value was good. The location is excelent, even on foot to many places we wanted to visit. Although centrally situated, practically no traffic noise could be heard, as the local main streets are a few blocks away. The 1800th century style renovated room was charming, although small, but this seems to be common in Paris. Breakfast was good and worth the price. Personnel was friendly and could communicate in English. No problems appeared.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent suprise”
Reviews.Author: WorthingVista
Reviews.Content: My wife an I (mid to late fifties) stayed at Hotel Du Panteon for 3 nights. It was our first visit to Paris and before we booked I had scoured enough websites to be aware of the most common complaints about Paris and paris hotels. We were very pleasently surprised by the reception we received on arrival, the facilitiesand the room. We had booked a standard room through Venere.com at 325 euros for the three nights. The room was bigger than all the warnings had led us to expect and beautifully presented. There was little perceptible noise at any time beyond the background hum of the heating unit and our room looked out onto a side street; what little noise came up was stopped by the double glazed windows. Our only criticisms would be the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room, and we would have referred the temperature to be significantly lower. Neither of these issues detracted from the enjoyment of our stay and we would be very happy to stay here again. We did not have breafast in the hotel, preffering to try or luck at local boulangeries (gernerally OK). We travelled to Paris by Eurostar (a mixed blessing!) and bought a three day Metro ticket in advance. This gave us our only real problem of our trip as the tickest let us onto the Metro, but would not let us out at the other end. To be stuck behind a reluctant barrier with assorted pieces of luggage at the end of a lengthy jouney was not fun. We had to be rescued by other travellers who passed their tickets back to us to use, and the following day our dud tickets were exchanged at the Metro station. (You only see staff on the way in!) All in all, Paris was much friendlier than we had been led to believe and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “the greatest view”
Reviews.Author: anto.tex
Reviews.Content: i have booked my stay at hotel du pantheon with a super great rate i was not hoping to get for that hotel, i booked a superior room and asked for a nice and quiet room, which made me get a wonderful room on the corner of the building, small, but soo cute and the view was aaamazing. the only thing is that i do not succeed to get the same rate and i do not know if i will go back again. but my staying was great, personell was nice to us and cooperative. will keep an eye on rates to see if it is possible to go back for the next trade show.

Reviews.Title: “Familiar surroundings, efficient problem solving”
Reviews.Author: Europhile-7
Reviews.Content: Third visit to the Pantheon in 20 years. This time combining business with a weekend holiday. Helpful staff, specially in dealing with the only real problem - the first room I was given had a very strong smell of new paint (the decorators were still working in other rooms on the 4th floor). Helpful front desk staff and Housekeeper changed it without fuss. The plus side is that all the rooms are being redecorated. Like most French hotels, it is a bit over-heated with little means of controlling the temperature other than by opening the window. Though the Place du Pantheon is reasonably quiet at night, the granite setts make vehicle wheels rumble quite loudly, so opening the window is not a good idea if you are a light sleeper. It's a good location for exploring the 5th and 6th arrondissements on foot - far enough from the main drags to avoid the madding crowds but close enough to be convenient. Notre Dame is only 15 minutes on foot, again along quiet streets. There are buses and the RER (Luxembourg) within 5 minutes walk. Breakfast (€12) in the vaulted room (the former cellar) is adequate, with the welcome option of fresh and dried fruit as well as cereals, bread, croissants, yoghurts, etc. Breakfast is served early enough (from 06.30) for business purposes and late enough (to 10.30) for a lazy holiday start.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: W&CSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well located, for easy walking within Paris, the room was comfortable and well equipped, clean and the views were OK. you can't get much closer to the Pantheon. metro and buses about 5 - 10 minutes walk, Louvre 20 minutes etc. good restaurants nearby, and plenty of cafes for breakfast. rooms as per website, overall good place to stay. We stayed in January, weather was mild, especially after a Sydney Australia summer. Staff were helpful especially for directions and tour recommendations. Wayne & Chris Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, great view”
Reviews.Author: Marta Hari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as described but though we booked a superior room it did not have a balcony as described and it was tiny. I was told the superior thing was the view. The view was stunning on the 6th floor but the lift was again tiny and getting up and down took an age. Not really worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Charming and a highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: SydneyGirl-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 5 nights in January 2007, and it was a real highlight of our 6 weeks in Europe. Absolutely charming decor, and for the most part terrific service - very polite, accomodating, professional and smooth. And the view of the Pantheon itself was terrific! The location is good - close to the Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Gardens, and a decent walk to the Seine. The free wireless internet was a bonus, although the signal strength was patchy on some days - my advice (if you have a problem) is to take your laptop to the lobby of the hotel next door where the signal strength is better. It is owned by the same people so they'll happily let you sit there too, when you explain why. Another bonus is that if you have wheelie suitcases then the walk to the Luxembourg RER is pretty smooth, and a quick way to and from CDG or Orly airports.

Reviews.Title: “Passport to Paris”
Reviews.Author: hilver
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed just recently at this excellent hotel.The setting for this hotel is magical and inspiring.The staff are welcoming ,helpful,and friendly.We immediately felt comfortable and at home a great foundation for our visit to Paris.This will be our place for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a must!”
Reviews.Author: LCoogan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful Hotel, with superb views, extremely friendly and helpful staff, immaculate rooms and good value for money then please look no further than the Hotel Du Pantheon. My husband and I stayed at the hotel last week for 5 nights and it was an absolute pleasure. The view from our 6th floor bedroom looked out over The Pantheon, an amazingly atmospheric building. We were also able to see the Sacre Coeur illuminated in the distance. The breakfast room was in the process of being refurbished during out stay but this did not cause us a problem as the staff happily worked around the slight disruption to provide a tasty breakfast either served in our room or the comfy reception area. We plan to return to Paris as soon as possible and we will not waste time searching through hotel reviews, we will definitely book the Hotel Du Pantheon. I suggest anyone reading this review considers doing the same. I hope to add photos shortly.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful friendly hotel du pantheon”
Reviews.Author: gilesy
Reviews.Content: A really wonderful classically parisian hotel! It is a beautiful place, very warm and welcoming, the decor is classic and cosmo, lift to all floors as well as a gorgeous spiral staircase. Much thought seems to have been made into making my stay a very pleasant and relaxing one, the lobby area being a good example of a nice place to linger/mingle with a lovely fireplace, curios and very comfy armchairs to relax in our room was lovely (we had a double). Of a good size, with a cute little balcony giving way to a supurb view of the Pantheon and Sacre-Coeur in the distance. We were not overlooked in the least and it felt very private. Great air con/heating control so we could have the room at the temp that suited us. The en-suite was impeccable with good powerful water supply for showering and a bath installed as well, all very clean and in very good order. The staff were all very friendly and always helpful, being very symathetic to my poor french and jumping straight into very good english without batting an eyelid when I gave up trying! there was a very good chioce of breakfast served in the beautiful vaulted basement. it was all served fresh and we were well looked after by the staff. (I noticed breakfast could be taken to your room for no extra charge) Transport was also close both good metro stations and bus stops. one day we felt inclined to take a short walk and visited the lovely jardin du luxwembourg, then into st germain and meandre into the left bank . very very good value, I'm suprised the star rating isn't higher, i will definitely use the hotel du pantheon on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Delighful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Rabnnif
Reviews.Content: We were happily surprised with the Hotel du Pantheon in its very charming decor, scrumptious continental breakfast, spectacular position on the Place du Pantheon and very helpful staff who answered our needs immediately and whose restaurant recommendations in the area were right on. We would recommend a room with a view. The hotel was extremely quiet so we were surprised when one night we were kept awake by a snoring neighbor!

Reviews.Title: “More than Happy”
Reviews.Author: berlin2
Reviews.Content: After staying in Paris at different hotels over the years, at this hotel we had one of the best experiences. We were lucky enough to find this hotel thru a German web site booking hotel rooms for 89 euro's a night. Our room was clean with a nice bathroom, a small balcony facing the Pantheon..Great view! The WC was in a seperate very small room across from the bathroom. We had enough space to walk around the bed comfortably as there were 2 closets to put our stuff away. Also there was a small table and chairs in front of the window. The front desk people spoke perfect English and were always very helpful. The only 'bad' thing that happened was that after I put my passport and money,etc. in the room safe, it would not open again. The person to fix it wouldn't be there until late that afternoon, but was able to get it open, thank God. The room was cleaned but the sheets were not changed. (4 day stay) We always had fresh towels. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again because in comparison to other 3 star hotels it is pretty good. And the hotel personal were way more friendly than most French experiences I have had. I am an American living in Berlin so I get to travel a lot. Some of the prices posted in the other reviews were way too expensive however. The area is nice and when we stayed on the main streets, which were well lit, we felt safe at night on the way to the hotel. The stone downstairs breakfast room is very Parisian but I would NOT book the breakfast because you can get the same thing at a Bistro in the area for between 4 to 6 euro's. Maybe one day..just for the experience, but then a new place each morning is fun. You don't have to book the breakfast and can decide to take it after you are there. The walk to the Seine doesn't take long and metro is close by. All is all, you don't need to have any anxious thoughts about this hotel, just watch the price.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: NicolaGalway
Reviews.Content: Having spent three nights just after Christmas in this hotel, I would strongly recommend it to anyone currently on the hunt for a hotel in Paris. Location is perfect -really central yet it felt removed from the hustle and bustle of the city. Service in the hotel was faultless - staff were really accomodating and helpful. Our twin rooms were small but beautifully decorated and were well equipped. Tended to be slightly chilly though. Bathrooms were pristine and we even had a balcony with a view of the Sacre Coeur off ours! All in all a good experience - we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DndG
Reviews.Content: We visit Paris at least once a year and stay at a different hotel almost every time. This year we were joined by friends, and looking for a last minute chance to join the Paris new year celebrations, we came across this hotel on Tripadvisor. The only difficulty was the price, which at €295 per night for a 3* was on the high end. Nevertheless given its location, the time of year and the lateness of the booking, we decided to go ahead with it. We couldn't have been happier. Within easy walking distance of most of the central sites such as Notre Dame, Isle-Saint-Louis, the Marais, the Luxembourg Gardens and at a little stretch the Louvre, and with the Pantheon on the door step, it was ideal. There were also some nice touches such as a present of a bottle of champagne and a note from the manager on New Years eve. The breakfast was not exceptional but it was fine and it was also included in the price. The room was very cosy, nicely decorated and we had a view of the Pantheon. All in all, we would definitely return to this hotel, but would perhaps look for a better deal the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dianna/Texas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days here recently. The location is beautiful and quiet. Definitely get a room with a view of the Pantheon. Although the hotel website states the hotel is entirely non-smoking, there seemed to be smokers staying in the hotel. At night we could definitely smell a continuous, strong cigarette smoke aroma coming from close by. We did not complain to management as it was not a huge problem for us; we just think perhaps advertising "entirely non-smoking" is a bit misleading, if not enforced. Otherwise, the hotel is beautiful! The bathroom especially was spotless and attractive. The bed did not have a comforter/bedspread; just a neatly tucked in top sheet, which I actually preferred this as I was assured it was clean and fresh. We had breakfast in the beautiful basement room. The pastry and cheeses were fresh and filling. European butter and jams were yummy. Coffee could have been fresher and more plentiful. The choices available were fairly limited. There was yogurt, cheese, pastry (croissant and baguette), dry cereal, sliced meat, and a bowl of chopped fruit. Juices available were OJ and grapefruit. For us, with the exchange rate, it amounted to almost $20 per person. Although we enjoyed the convenience and charm of the breakfast room, we felt it was a bit overpriced for what you get. The only upgrading I can think the hotel might consider, is the television set. In this day and age, most hotels have gone to flat screens. There in only a small older TV in a corner cabinet, which was totally adequate for catching up on the news. The hotel staff were professional, helpful, and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Hotspot”
Reviews.Author: Perraudin
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon is located on a paris hotspot!!!! We had a stunning view on The Pantheon Rooms are very comfy, service is good, breakfast is o.k. So, we had a "bon sejour"at the Pantheon

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: jkpd
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and Paris too! We will be back! Yiannis - Popi

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the rat race!”
Reviews.Author: FoggyDewLeeds
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a relaxing and intimate stay in your wonderful hotel! My wife and I were on an escape from the children overnight stay - we vow to return for at least 5 nights in 2007! David & Jo Foggin Leeds, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluemoon52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, bang opposite the Pantheon and about 5 minutes walk from the Luxembourg Gardens. Despite being in a tourist location, it's pretty peaceful at night. It's close to St Germain and Notre Dame but one of the reasons we chose it was its proximity to Rue Mouffetard and the markets there (5 mins). And if you like Japanese food, the Rue Monsieur le Prince is very close which has around 8 or 9 Japanese restaurants (as well as the wildly overated Polidor). The staff at the hotel were great - very professional. The hotel was clean and the bathroom was large by Paris standards. Would recommend this hotel to others looking for somewhere in a great location, just outside the hustle of St Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Hotel du Pantheon (14-19 September 06) and loved it. The location is great in that it is relatively close to the Luxembourg metro stop (which means easy access to both Orly and CDG airports, among other things) and is in my favorite part of Paris. While being very close to activity and interesting places, it was wonderfully quiet because of being tucked up near the Pantheon instead of on a noisy, hectic street. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the lobby area was attractive and offered free wi-fi net access, the room was clean and comfortable. The only negative I can think of was that breakfast was not included in the cost of the room -- but it was worth the extra cost -- was much better than the breakfast I got for slightly less money at a nearby cafe one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerEMEA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there because of a surbooking at sister hotel - Le Jardin de l'Odeon. I found the hotel very charming and the location great (on the Pantheon square, 1min from Jardins du Luxembourg). My room on the 6th floor at appearant beams and bathroom was recently redone. I even had my own little private balcony. Great for breakfast! Will keep it in my book for future trips...

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: TXartist
Reviews.Content: Area was great: in university, very pretty buildings, felt very safe (1 month after the Paris riots!!), 3 minutes from metro station, lots of good cafes nearby. We recommend Crepe A-GoGo, had brunch there everyday. Very close to Luxembourg gardens, 15 minute walk from Latin quarter with fantastic restaurants (had every dinner there!!). Hotel: very very stylish, small scale but elegant indeed. Front desk spoke English and were nice. We did not try the hotel buffett. Elevator was appreciated. Room: we got the smallest room: one queen size bed. The room was not much bigger than the bed, but enough for a couple. The bathroom was very nice with a heated towel rack, we liked it, plenty of soap supply. A small tv with cable, a tiny patio with table and chairs, it was cute. It was pleasantly quiet. Only issue: we visited in the freezing winter and the heater, controlled by hotel management, was too high. We got "baked" in the room so we kept the patio door open and it was fine. We asked the front desk to lower the heater, they said they would do something, but heat remained very high. We cannot say how is the temperature there in other seasons. Price: about $110/night including tax through the hotel website. Overall: very good value for the money, great location, comfortable and beautiful. Had the heater not been an issue we would have rated the hotel 5 stars instead of 4. Still, great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. The location is central yet not on a main street, rooms were well decorated, clean and an ok size for Europe. Would definitely stay here if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: LMC_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in June. Location is excellent central but quiet (in a good way). Our room was very nice, the perfect size for the two of us. The desk staff really stood out. They gave us great advice about places to go, and went out of their way to print out maps and call cabs. Everybody was very friendly, and both of us would definately stay there again. The room came with breakfasts, which was worth the extra few euros. I recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a great location without all the tourist traps found in areas on the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anita40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon with my 8 year old son for two nights near the end of June (just a couple of days ago) and we really liked this place. For the price, the location can't be beat (two short blocks from Luxembourg Gardens and literally a stone's throw from the Pantheon) and it is charming in the extreme! Everything was very clean, the staff all spoke English (except for one server in the breakfast room) and we were well-attended to. All was exactly as advertised on their website. The breakfast, by European standards, was above and beyond what one usually gets in southern Europe and is included with the price of the room. A heartier breakfast can be had for a very reasonable cost. We had room 35, in the rear of the hotel, overlooking a small courtyard typical of Paris. It faced some residential apartments and was very quiet with the exception of some BEAUTIFUL piano playing by someone and some exhuberant cheering over World Cup soccer but I consider that part of the wonderfulness of the Paris experience! The rooms are quite small but well-appointed - we had no problems (the person who complained about having his luggage gone through should have used the complimentary room safe!) and are happy we chose this very French little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_Monkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend Fri-Sun and enjoyed our stay. The room was reasonably spacious by European standards and the hotel in is a pretty good location. Try booking through the hotel's own website as it will probably be cheaper than booking it though a web agency. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro station and within 15 minutes walk of Notre Dame and the rest of the Latin Quarter. Rue Mouffetard is worth a look (down the bottom where the market and food shops are.)

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: beautiful quaint room friendly help ful desk overall just a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: rhonda7325
Reviews.Content: well we loved it! 1. Location, location, location. Quick walk to everything except the eiffel, beautiful quiet neighborhood, great spots to go to, close to the metro, taxi stand near bythe saturday market was five blocks away, notre dame 15 minute walk. 2. Staff, very helpful and friendly. Ask them for recommendations as there are great spots to eat. some very high end 600 for two but well worth the french experience, le truffiere. 3. Rooms tiny but very quaint, quiet, clean and comfortable. Balconys with wrought iron, you could not sit on them as they were small. 4. the cheapiest price 126 cdn average from jan 6-13 was on their website. 5. we did not eat here as its paris and the point is to visit as many cafes as possible! I would stay here again mainly because it was a "place in paris", its what we pictured.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: londoner_lass
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this lovely hotel when I took him for a surprise weekend to Paris. We just wanted a pretty Parisian hotel near the Latin Quarter (I'd heard it was good for restaurants) and near the sites so we could be touristy. This was definitely it. As you walk up from the Metro station you can see the Pantheon (which is such a fantastic and imposing building) in front, and the Eiffel Tower behind. It's an easy walk to the Seine, the Islands, the Louvre and Notre Dame (all 10 mins) and a slightly more adventurous walk from the Eiffel Tower or the Arc de T. (don't try and do it using the map in the back of the Time Out guide). It was really clean, with helpful friendly staff who spoke English AND happily put up with my broken French when I inflicted it on them. Our room was a cheapie, looking onto a very cute side street. Lovely bathroom with a good powerful shower and small but perfectly formed rooms with very comfy, quite soft beds. We didn't eat there because, you know, we were in Paris - there were far to many beautiful places to have breakfast to waste meals in hotels. This certainly isn't a luxury but for it's price range it's really good value and really lovely. Definitely highly recommend. Two tips: 1. Book through there own website, which does special offers much cheaper than the usual 'hotel-finding' websites 2. The latin quarter IS good for restaurants, even on Sunday night when most of them are shut! We had a fab sunday night steak at L'Ecurie on Rue Laplace just round the corner

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: usarover
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling to Paris and those travelling with children. I stayed here for eight nights with my wife and 19 month old daughter. They had the room set-up with a crib as soon as we checked in. The front desk staff accommodated every request. Will certainly stay here again whenever we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but you can do better in Paris. Much better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 211 for 2 nights to ring in the New Year. The room was clean, and had a ton of air freshener. Size: very small-- you have to really use the tiny drawers and closet if you unpack your stuff. Bed: comfy. Breakfast: Ok, but not worth getting as part of your package. Room to room insulation: Poor. We could hear what people next door to us were watching, and what they were talking about. Acoustics are even worse in the bathroom. Pretty much there's an unspoken understanding amongst guests that you have to be quiet. We had no problem with noise late in the night. Housekeeping: If you want more toiletries, tell them-- otherwise your supply won't get replenished. The toilet seat in this room kept sliding off. The cleaning staff just kept nudging it right back instead of fixing it. Reception staff: the men were much friendlier and accommodating. We had no acknowledgment of being guests (or just plain existing) from the female staff. We moved on to stay at Hotel Pergolese for our third night, and then at an apartment for a week right on Blvd St Michel. Both-especially the apartment- were a far superior experience... for the same avg. daily price, if not less.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here - superb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon here in October and stayed for 4 nights. The hotel was in a great location In Latin Quarter about 15 minutes walk to Notre Dame and loads of great bars/restaurants within 10 minutes walk. Our room overlooked the marvellous Pantheon! The room we had was lovely, very French and with loads of character. Bathroom very old fashioned and superb with good shower. We couldn't have asked for anymore. Didn't bother with breakfast as there as so many cafes/bakeries in the area. The staff weren't willing to speak English but think they enjoyed us Brits struggly with our rubbish French. Were friendly but slightly on the aloof side! Served a good cup of tea in the lobby! Would definetly go back here as location is great and the hotel is really good. In short, we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Eblana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon over the New Year and it was delightful, not to mention perfectly located - great for cafes, bars and restaurants, and hardly any need to use the metro. We arrived very late (after midnight - snow and fog had semi-closed CDG), but were disinclined to go straight to bed. The desk staff helpfully recommended a couple of possible bars (one turned out to be an 'English' bar, the Bombadier. We didn't go in...) and we ended up in the charming 'Methode' which was still open when we left at 2am. The Pantheon's Staff did speak English, but a little hesitantly. This was more than compensated for by their willingness to understand our 'school' French without difficulty! We had 'ordinary' rooms (i.e. not facing the Pantheon) but my partner and I were in one with a four-poster and lovely view to the side street (no street noise, however. Great double-glazing). My mum had the adjoining room (as requested when booking) which was twin, with lovely print (cloth) on the walls. Both rooms (which looked very like the 2 pictured in the brochure the Hotel sent us) were on 3rd floor (lift is tiny - only takes 3 people, or 2 plus substantial baggage). We heard no noise from other rooms, though my mum, whose room was by the (very elegant) staircase, said she could hear kids running on it whilst dressing for dinner one evening. Rooms small but spotlessly clean (heating was a little clackety if turned up too high, but actually we found the rooms very snug even with heating at 12-15 degrees C), ditto bathrooms (very characterful taps, good shower pressure, but one evening the water wouldn't run hot for a bath). One light bulb blew, but was replaced the following morning. All bed linen and towels etc. were replaced daily. Mini-bar was fairly priced (and the fridge was useful for storing champagne for New Year's Eve). Breakfast seemed pricey, so on the recommendation of a friend who knew the Hotel, we didn't sample it. There are loads of little cafes around, where one can have the coffee+croissant thing propping up a zinc bar (streets to the NE of the Pantheon teem with bars and cafes; ). The RER stop 'Luxembourg' is only a 5 minute walk, and definitely the sensible way to travel to/from Roissy CDG. For dinner locally, definitely go to L'Ecurie (Rue Laplace) - the E15 menu has the best beef I've ever had, lean and succulent, and the cheapness of the food encourages splashing out on the wine, which is well worth it. Various nice 'extras' in the way of aperitifs and calvados also came our way. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Janina1950
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with two of our friends in the early part of November, 2005. The rooms were very clean and quite large by Paris standards. The staff were not as helpful as we would have thought having read the previous reviews. On our first day we got stuck in the elevator with our luggage and instead of offering any apology I got the feeling that we disturbed the front desk. The hotel is in a very nice area, near plenty of bistros and small stores. It was quiet and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Such a perfect hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Pantheon is a really wonderful hotel. Ideally located within walking distance for most of the Parisian sights and really near Luxenburg metro station. The rooms are a good size, clean and decordated in a truely french style and all have a beautiful view of the Pantheon. If you are lucky and ask nicely you might even get a room with a balcony! The staff are more than helpful and have good english. Staying at this hotel really made our weekend trip to Paris and I'd happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a really good small hotel in an amazing location. We walked everywhere, its just a few minutes from Notre Dame and from all the reataurants and bars of the Latin Quarter, we even walked to the Eifel Tower and Champ Elysee, it was a bit of a distance but still walkable. It really is a good find and we will definately stay there again .The rooms were really pretty with such a parisian feel about them and the view was spectacular. Only complaint I would have is that the elevator broke down one night and we had to walk the 6 flights up to our room, which wasn't a bad idea after the indulgences of the evening. The stairs itself is a beautiful spiral one. As already stated we will most definately stay here again we couldn't believe our luck with location.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed in this little hotel for a week in July and i cannot praise it enough.The rooms are beautifully decorated and room 34 has a four poster bed. The staff were charming and helpful- even when we locked ourselves out of our safes by not reading the instructions properly !! its position is wonderful near the Pantheon and it is convenient to several metro stations.At night the area is quiet and there are literally hundreds of restaurants close by. i would definately stay here next time i visit Paris- which i hope is not too far away !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but sorry Sir we've never heard of you.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My second trip here involved arriving with the hotel telling me they were full and refusing to honour my pre-paid travel agent reservation. Not sure yet whether it was the agent's fault or the hotel's. But as someone used to grumpy service I can't begin to imagine how some of my (dare I say choosier) American friends would have felt over the complete lack of initiative or understanding displayed by the evening receptionist. He seemed to think it was acceptable for me to wander off into the night with my bags, 'confirmation' printout in hand, looking for somewhere else to sleep. Oh yeh, sure. What a great idea... So if you do book it, I'd phone ahead to check your agent's booking is on their system and will be honoured. If they ask why you're double checking, point them to this posting :-) And if you suffer my trouble, you have to sit for 2 hours at the front desk and refuse to go until they find and pay for a room elsewhere. I've stayed before in the hotel and we loved it. It's in a great location and has comfortable, well decorated rooms. A real cut-above average. Just make that call to reconfirm. For me, it's back to the favourite-Paris-hotel drawing board, though. Ideas on a postcard, please.

Reviews.Title: “Truly charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in March at Hotel du Pantheon, exploring the Left Bank. Our small, but superbly-decorated room provided a beautiful view of the Plaza du Pantheon, which became picture perfect when the last flakes of snow began to fall. Although the staff is a little annoyed if you return late after enjoying too much of the Paris nightlife, the service is otherwise first-rate. Overall, highly-recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having been worried about the feedback about general standard and size of hotel rooms in Paris we were pleasantly surprised on arriving at the hotel du Pantheon for a 3 night stay. Decor was lovely, everything clean, nice balcony looking onto the Pantheon. Would stay here again. Only gripe was that we were in a room right next to the lift which could be a bit noisy. Recommend the area - perfect for closeness to rue Moffetard (street market and restaurants) and just a couple of minutes walk to Luxembourg metro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Pantheon Way too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel du Pantheon. We stayed 2 nights first time and had a nice room but it faced the street (The Pantheon) and it was non-stop noise all night long. It was too warm to sleep with the windows closed (but when they are it really cuts down on the noise) so very little sleep those nights. Returned to Paris from a road-trip for another 3 nights and had requested a courtyard room due to the noise on the Pantheon side. We were given Room 15 (don't ever take that room) which faced the hotel air conditioning unit and a wall....it was very warm in Paris last week, 86 degrees F but they refused to turn on the air conditioning. We didn't get any ventilation with the windows open because of the wall but instead were up all night staring at the air conditioner we wish was on! Asked when it would be turned on and never got a straight answer. I requested another room the next day and was moved to room 43 which was better but faced the Pantheon again.....noise, noise and more noise all night long. There is a restaurant up the street and people eating, drinking and talking into the week hours of the morning. Europeans eat later than Americans so the dinner crowd arrives around 9 pm and doesn't leave until around 4 p.m. By then they have had so much to drink they just make a lot of noise walking past the hotel. And the scooters buzzing by all night. To make matters worse you can't even think about going back to the room to rest and regroup for awhile late afternoon because there is hotel renovations going on and hammering from morning until late afternoon....just no peace and quiet. I live in New York City so I know noise, but nothing like what was going on around this hotel. The rooms are nice, very clean but what good is that when you don't get any sleep. I will not return to that hotel. Many nicer, quieter hotels in the St. Germain area. Very quiet neighborhood with art galleries which are closed at night. I know that's where I'll be staying on my next visit to Paris. And there will be a next visit to Paris because it is such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay anbd excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel having seen the reviews on Tripadvisor - it really is a very good location and the hotel is quite charming. Being Paris the rooms are not the biggest, but they are very nicely decorated and the ensuite was certainly big enough. Moreover, the hotel staff were very helpful (and long suffering of my poor French) and happy to book us dinner reservations etc. Must admit we did book thoguh Expedia, so got a very cheap deal which also helped the positive experience, but all-in-all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “repeat visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeln
Reviews.Content: I live in Brussels and have made it a quest...to find the perfect Paris Hotel. I brought a group with me the second visit. Both stays were wonderful. The location is great...with well advised restaurants nearby. It is easily accessible to all the sites as well as the train stationa and airport. This is a find....and believe me I know!! Great value and lovely employees.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room and Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: rickanddeborah
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here in March. We stayed in the Deluxe room and found it to be decent size for 2 people and 3 pieces of luggage. Decoration is very pretty and bathroom was good sized with separate toilet. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful and kind, from locating shops we were looking for, to tips on restaurants. The location is terrific for eating and sight-seeing. There is a 24/7 internet business 1-2 blocks away that is handy for checking email that charges by the hour. Metro is fairly close and you can walk to many sights. Our only complaint was that being in the deluxe room catagory put us on the front of the hotel with a direct view of the Pantheon (that was great!) but also with quite alot of street noise. We keep our windows open, so this was noisy day and night. Traffic lessens late at night but it is still an issue. Early mornings bring tour buses and scooters. If not for that we would give it 5 stars, especially when you can get a good rate from the hotel's web site as we did. Unfortunately, due to the noise we would probably not return. Too many other hotels in this price range, in this area that are in much quieter streets. But if you keep your windows closed or maybe stay on the side of the hotel, it's a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for Overcharges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Six of us female friends had 3 reservations for 3 rooms at this beautiful and well appointed hotel. We spent five nights and checked out. When we got our credit card bills, four of us had been overcharged by two nights' fees and two were undercharged. I e-mailed the hotel immediately. The hotel manager said he would not credit my credit card until I gave him the credit card number for the undercharged women. I gave him their e-mail addresses so he could straighten it out with them. The hotel never even responded to the other women's e-mail complaint for the overcharge. We filed complaints with our credit card companies who gave us our money back, but the hotel never gave any money back to the credit card company. What thievery! We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: willnino
Reviews.Content: As for our whole travel, we did do a fair bit of research with places like Tripadvisor before settling in on a choice of hotel/s. For our Paris stay of 5nights, we chose this little gem of a hotel and were more than happy with it. The location is fantastic and our room overlooked the Pantheon. Even though the Pantheon itself probably isn't in the top 10 sights on most peoples itinerary, it is still a great sight for looking out your window when you were in the room. It is small but that is normal in Paris but still very comfortable and in a great location for all sorts of things. We walked most places around Paris but when we did need transport there are about 4 Metro and RER lines within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Feel free to email me for directions or questions if you ever choose this hotel. We did head towards the 6th arrondisiment every time we headed off and it wasn't till day 3 that an Aussie girl working in Paris told us about the restuarants around Place Mouge....they were fantastic and only a couple of minutes from our hotel...opposite direction though...haha. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The only problems I had with the room and hotel was the lack of tea and coffee. If you drink tea in Paris you tend to feel like a leper, 4 Euros for boiling water and a tea bag, in a tiny cup...hmmmm. Would have loved to have been able to have a cuppa in my room or even downstairs in the hotel. I could buy one there for the bargain price of 3 Euros...Wow. Second little problem was that we went in the winter and the room was hot...nice in the little bits of daytime we were there but too hot to sleep in and very hard to regulate. Well worth staying here though, hope you enjoy it like we did.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelfoblex
Reviews.Content: Would've rated it excellent except the elevator was broken when we were there in Nov. 2004. Hiking up 7 floors was not fun, especially at the end of a long walking day in Paris. The location is great. The rooms look right into the Pantheon courtyard. The rooms are clean and very nicely decorated. The neighborhood is filled with nice little cafes and stores. The metro is only a short walk away. Would definitely stay here again, but will call ahead to make sure the elevator is working!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Du Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: jmagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Du Pantheon on our first trip tp Paris about 2yrs ago. We are leaving for our second trip in 2 weeks and have 7 nights booked! Our room was spacious - the largest out of any room we have stayed in during European trips with a fabulous view of the Pantheon. We stayed on the second floor and used the stairs most of the time. We loved that it was a quick walk to resturants and Norte Dame and near by stops for the Green Double decker tourist bus... While planning our second trip to Paris we looked at a lot of hotels in the Latin Quarter and decided to go back since we had such an amazing time.. we will be looking at other hotels in the areas for different options but we adored this hotel... it was well appointed with a comfy and true size queen bed!!!! we did the Breakfast one morning and found it to be over priced and enjoyed the crepes and warm sammy's from the local places a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mach229
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon for 4 nights in January and I would stay there again. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful without the hint of condescension I've noticed at other Parisien hotels. We had 2 tiny rooms which looked out onto a warren of other buildings - no view at all. The rooms were lovely though - well-decorated, extremely comfortable and quiet (we should have asked for wake-up calls since the 4 of us slept until 11:30 one day - so much for an early start), and fairly well-situated. Buses, metro stops and the RER are all within a 10 minute walk and there are a number of restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood and at the rue de mouffetard, 10 minutes away. The bathroom was very clean and well-stocked and I do not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location-All Good”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaGaMember
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here August, 2004. Our room was on the top floor(6). The top floor is iffy in most European hotels but this one was roomy enough, no weird sloping roof, etc., and the view was GREAT. We could see the Sacre Coeur fom our window! Would recommend the 5th floor also, which has little sliver balconies, but not as good views. The 1st floor would be a nightmare-loud and busy. No problems during our visit with the a/c or the lift(although there had been during the week before our arrival--use the stairs) . Extremely clean. Front desk people speak english, are friendly.Also available is a rare commodity over there--ice. They have a sister hotel next door. Didn't go in but looks similar. This location was perfect as it is off the beaten path and quiet (it does border a mausoleum,after all) but cafes and shops are a very short walk away. A little further walk is required to get to the RER(Luxembourg Garden) or Metro(Cardinal-Lemoine). Would stay there again

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Pantheon
HotelInfo.Address: 19 Place du Pantheon, 75005 Paris, France
